loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry for his chicken-rearing and egg selling business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia es una mujer soltera pero tiene dos hijos Ella vive en la comunidad de Chauira en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa tiene luz y agua, lo bueno es que no posee ningun defecto  Lidia es agricultora y quiere un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera Aunque los hijos de Lidia son mayores y colaboran con los gastos, la familia no puede salir adelante a menos que reciba su ayuda Lidia goza de buena salud y su evaluación es buena
texts.en: Lidia is a single woman but she has two children. She lives in the community of Chauira in a house of adobe, which is her property. The house has electricity and water. The good thing is that it has no defects. Lidia is a farmer, and she wants a loan in order to buy a milk cow. Even though Lidia's children are adults and help with the expenses, the family cannot get ahead unless they receive your help. Lidia enjoys good health, and her evaluation is good.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 45-year-old married woman with six children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Marilyn has requested a loan amount of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers. Marilyn has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Patric

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Patric, 72 years old, married and blessed with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in January 2013.

Patric does maize and bean farming. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to commercialize his farming and is now able to earn more profits from his farming. 

He is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer. This will enable him to increase his crop yield and meet the demand for maize and beans in his locality. This will improve his income and put him in a position to meet his family's  needs. 

Patric is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 37 years. She is a widow blessed with three children, aged 12, 8, and 6 years old. Caroline runs a cereals business, which she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

Caroline has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy stock of cereals for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to pay school fees and her loan. Her hope and dream for the future is to have an increased income to be able to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals

loans.name: Niyazi

texts.en: Niyazi is married and has two children. He has a small carwash, where he washes cars. His older daughter is a nurse, and his son helps him at his work. Today Niyazi lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law. He has a lovely grandchild. They have lived in Absheron region for over 22 years. They are IDPs (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Today Niyazi wants to support his business and has applied to Komak Company for a loan of 1,350 AZN to buy one more washing machine. He currently does not have enough washing machines to support the development of his business. Niyazi says thanks to Kiva for aid.

loans.use: to buy a car washing machine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as God-fearing. Agnes operates a retail business where she sells compact disks, flash disks, and movies. She has been involved in this business for six years. 

Agnes will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of compact disks, flash disks, and movies. Her business goal is to own a music studio within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of compact disks, flash disks, and movies

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as God-fearing. Christine operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her primary customers are individuals. 

Christine will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Christine will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Chepkiripseet Kotes Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Elizabeth, 54 years old, married and blessed with four children. Elizabeth joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. The enterprise management training has enabled her to manage her farming activities of maize, beans and potatoes more effectively. 

She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer. This will improve her crop yield. She hopes that the loan will increase her income and that she will be able to provide for her family's needs like clothing and education for her children.

Elizabeth is very thankful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Siguidouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les huit membres du groupe Siguidouma ont en moyenne 49 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à  Kalaban-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, d’ustensiles plastiques, du savon et charbon du bois. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa  (femme  arrêtée  en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coura en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en: Married, solely in polygamous households, the eight members of the Siguidouma group, on average, are 49 years old and have four children. They all live in Kalaban-coura, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and know one another through neighborhood and revenue-generating business ties in Kalaban-coura. The group members run small businesses selling clothing, plastic utensils, soap and charcoal. With the intention of growing their business funds, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. Ms. Awa (the woman standing in the second place from the left to the right of the photo) is a major clothes saleswoman. She expects to use her loan to buy 25 wax pagnes (colorful wax cloths) at wholesale in Bamako. The resale will be made at retail in Kalaban-coura on foot, to a clientele made up largely of women. With this loan, Ms. Awa expects to have an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in the business and to meet the small needs of the household.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for seven years. She sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, cereals, seasonings, biscuits, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, etc. 

Juliet requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, cereals, seasonings, biscuits, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, cereals, seasonings, biscuits, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bidii B Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, a member of Bidii B Women Group. She is 30 years old and a mother of two. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013. Margaret has a poultry keeping business.

Margaret is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for enterprise training, as it has enabled her to manage her enterprise well. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase more chickens to satisfy her customers' high demand. She hopes to earn more income to enable her to meet her family's needs such as food and school fees for her children.  Margaret is happy with Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Ramón Arturo

texts.es:
Ramón de 54 años de edad, es motorista y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el bachillerato luego decidió trabajar para ayudar en los gastos de su casa. Esta casado y junto con su esposa tienen 2 hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, los dos se encuentran estudiando, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de sus hijos mientras que Ramón se dedica a atender un molino de nixtamasa en su casa desde hace 15 años, también tiene una pequeña panadería la cual atiende desde hace unos años trabajo que lo aprendió por la necesidad de los recursos económicos en que vivían y así logro tener un poco mas de ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor alimentación y una mejor calidad de vida, sus hijos y su esposa también le ayudan en la venta de pan por las tardes a los alrededores de la comunidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un motor diésel para su molino de nixtamasa, ya que el que posee es eléctrico. El sueño de Ramón es ayudarle a sus hijos económicamente para que puedan sacar sus estudios y ampliar el negocio de molienda y de panadería para ofrecerle a sus clientes un buen servicio y que se sientan satisfechos
texts.en:
Ramón, who is 54 years old, is a mill operator.  He graduated from secondary school, then he decided to work to help with the expenses in his household. He is married, and he and his wife have two children, ages 13 and 15. Both are in school. He lives with his wife and his two children. His wife does the household tasks and cares for the children, while Ramón has tended a corn mill in his house for 15 years. He also has a little bakery that he has operated for a number of years, work that he learned because of the need for economic resources that they were experiencing and also to have a little more income in order to give his family better food and a better quality of life. His children and his wife also help him to sell bread in the afternoons in the surroundings of the community.

The loan that he is applying for is to buy a diesel motor for his corn mill, since the one he has is electric. Ramón's dreams are to help his children economically so that they can get ahead in their education and to expand his milling business and bakery in order to offer his customers good service so that they feel satisfied.

loans.use: to buy a diesel motor for his corn mill, since the one he has is electric.

loans.name: Esau Antonio

texts.es:
Esaú de 20 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica debido a que tuvo que dejar la escuela para trabajar.

Es agricultor, aprendió desde pequeño con su padre que también se dedica a lo mismo. Esaú tiene que hacerse un chequeo médico, y realizarse unos exámenes de laboratorio, por lo que necesita el préstamo para poder pagarlos y también cancelar la consulta con el médico. Espera le resulten bien y a futuro tener un buen empleo y una familia por quien luchar.
texts.en:
Esau, who is 20 years old, is single and has no children. He went to school through the sixth grade of basic education because he had to leave school to work. 

He is a farmer. He learned this work from his father, who also did this work, when he was little. Esau has to have a medical checkup and have some laboratory tests, for which he needs the loan to be able to pay for them and also to pay for the appointment with the doctor. He hopes that the results are good and that in the future he has a good job and a family to work hard for.

loans.use: to pay for clinical examinations.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana de 49 años de edad, es ama de casa, debido a los recursos económicos ella no pudo estudiar y mejor decidió aprender a trabajar para ayudar económicamente a sus padres, luego decidió acompañarse y junto con su compañero de vida procrearon 5 hijos de 24, 21, 28, 30 y 13 años de edad, 3 de sus hijos están acompañados por lo tanto dependen de ellos mismos ya que trabajan para su propio hogar, los otros dos aún viven con ella pero solo uno se encuentra estudiando el otro ya trabaja para apoyar a su madrecita en los gastos, ya que su padre decidió alejarse de ellos.

 Ana se dedica a atender una tienda en su casa, pero también vende pupusas por las tardes en la plaza publica de la comunidad, este trabajo lo desempeña desde hace mas de 10 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de una amiga y por la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos, para llegar al negocio de venta de pupusas Ana camina tan solo 2 cuadras de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para surtir su tiendita, pues comprara jabón, rinso, lejía, churros, dulces, granos básicos etc., también ocupara una parte para comprar maíz, quesillo, carne , repollo etc., para surtir mas su pupuseria, con eso ella lograra obtener mas clientes y así podrá obtener mas ingresos para los alimentos de sus hijos y ella.

Los sueños de Ana son que su hija se prepare profesionalmente para que tenga mejores posibilidades de un buen trabajo y tener una tienda mas surtida para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes todos los productos necesarios, así los clientes se sentirán mucho mas satisfechos.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 49 years old, is a housewife. Because of [the lack of] economic resources, she was not able to go to school and decided it was better to learn to work to help her parents economically. Then she decided to marry, and she and her life companion had 5 children, ages, 24, 21, 28, 30, and 13 years old. Three of her children are married, and so they depend on themselves, since they work for their own households. The other two still live with her, but only one is in school. The other already works to help his little mother with the expenses, since his father decided to leave them.

Ana tends a store in her house, but she also sells pupusas [a typical Salvadoran dish] in the afternoons in the public plaza in the community. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years. It is work that she learned from a friend and because of the need to raise her children. To arrive at her pupusa-selling business, Ana walks only two blocks from her house.

The loan that she is requesting from the institution is to stock her store, since she will buy soap, rinse, bleach, churros [doughnut-like pastries], sweets, basic grains, etc. She will also use part to buy corn, soft cheese, meat, cabbage, etc. to stock her pupusa business more. With this she will be able to have more customers and thus will be able to obtain more income for food for her children and herself.

Ana's dreams are that her daughter prepare herself professionally so that she has better possibilities for a good job and to have a better stocked store in order to be able to offer her customers all the necessary products, so that the customers will feel much more satisfied.

loans.use: to buy soap, rinse, bleach, churros, sweets, basic grains, etc., for the store, and corn, soft cheese, meat, cabbage, etc., to stock her pupuseria more.

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc De Quellouno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC DE QUELLOUNO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha ella es conviviente y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC DE QUELLOUNO".  This bank is located in the district of Quellouno, belonging to Convencion province, in the department of Cusco.

The member  is Bertha,  she lives common law, and she is 44 years old and has 2 children.  The member works in her restaurant business.  The member prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups and sautéed meats.   The member works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, and  has been in this business for 10 years, and is doing very well.  The member's dream is to expand her restaurant business.  The member requests a loan to purchase products for cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

The other members are involved in the selling animals business, livestock business, grocery business  and restaurant business.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium and promises to comply with the payment of her fees by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking like chicken, beef, and vegetables.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Suzzette works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from personal products. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell to customers.

Suzzette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nurmira

texts.ru: Нурмира, 31 год, замужем, мать троих детей. Образование высшее, с 2005 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Нурмиры, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы и 1 лошадь. На земельном участке мерою 0,85 ГА собственной и 0,15 ГА арендованной земли, Нурмира выращивает ячмень. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Нурмира планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Nurmira is 31 and married with three children. She has a university education and has been working in agriculture since 2005. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has three cows and one horse as well as 0.85 hectares of her own land and 0.15 hectares of rented land where she grows barley. Her monthly business profit is 8,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nurmira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and into saving toward building a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam is a 19-year-old single man from Jenin city. He lives alone in a small house. He works as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income due to fluctuation in demand. Islam finished high school last year with a medium average result, which will not give him the chance to study what he wants. He decided to study further and get higher results in high school so he will be able to register in the university. Islam is taking a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay for his high school study expenses. By taking this loan, Islam will be able to improve himself. Islam appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay for his high school study expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and hire more land to grow nappier grass

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two sets of tables and chairs to expand her business and to serve more customers

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en: Ernalyn works hard to support her family. Ernalyn is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ernalyn has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Ernalyn has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer is a 20-years-old single man; he is one of four members of his family. His father has retired from the military and is using his retirement salary to support the family. Amer is now applying for an educational loan to pay for his semester fees, as he is now a second year student majoring in business administration.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en: Laurita works hard to support her family. Laurita is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Laurita has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers. Laurita has been in this business for 12 years now. Laurita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Geraldine has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional packs of frozen food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: The lady in the photo is Virginia, forty two years old, married and with seven children. Virginia operates a kiosk and does maize farming to earn a living.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 and she has benefited from training on savings mobilization, enterprise and financial management. This has enabled her run her business more effectively. She is borrowing a loan to add stocks of sugar, salt, washing detergent and flour to her kiosk. She hopes this will increase her income and she will be able to provide for her family needs. Virginia is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, washing detergent, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: The person in the photo is Faith, twenty five years old and a mother of two. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2012. Faith runs a poultry keeping business that earns her a living. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) for enterprise training as it has enabled her manage the enterprise more effectively. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to help increase her poultry numbers and purchase chicken feed. She hopes to earn more income to enable her to educate her children and meet other family needs. Faith is happy for Kiva and their lenders for their support, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry and chicken feed.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 40 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Evelyn has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 13 years now, and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Evelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: The person in the photo is Beatrice, thirty nine years old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has gained skills in enterprise development and financial management. Beatrice has been doing horticultural farming for the past three years now. After the training, she started a poultry business. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her poultry enterprise by buying more chickens since the demand for eggs is high. She anticipates improved income, which will enable her to provide her family with food and pay the school fees for her children. Beatrice thanks Kiva and their lenders for the support and help, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Editha has been in this business for 8 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 47 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business; she practices pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Lucresia has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a visionary. She operates a farm where she grows tea and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are factories and individuals. She says her biggest business challenge is price fluctuation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay for farm labor and buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in business.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret, forty years old and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She runs a tailoring business. Margaret is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for business training as it enabled her to manage the enterprise well. 

She is borrowing a loan to purchase more textile fabric, which will greatly help in meeting the demand of her customers. She hopes to earn more income to enable her to meet family's needs, such as food and her children's education. 

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy textile fabric.

loans.name: Rani Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Nasiman is a 44-year-old leader of the “Rani Mahila Samuha” SHG group. She lives in a small village in Dumka district, Jharkhand, India. She is married and has a son. Her husband is a small marginal farmer.

Nasiman has been a tailor for the last 10 years and has managed to survive through her tailoring business since then. Her son is also associated with her. She specializes mostly in ladies dresses such as blouses and salwar-kurta. She has been helping her husband with household obligations. 

Initially business was slow, as she did not have enough capital to buy materials to meet the demand. She also lacked business management skills that she obtained from the training offered at MESP, a local NGO.  This has enabled her to achieve better efficiency and effectiveness.

With the Kiva loan, she hopes to purchase a new sewing machine, which will help her to expand her business. She dreams of running a big shop.
The other four members are also seeking loans to improve their livelihoods, which will help them improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Majohe Halisi Group

texts.en:
Agnes, who is in her late 50s, is married with nine children and only one of them is still in school. She has been running several projects: a grocery store, a bar, and a retail shop. She has been in her businesses since 2007. She works from 2pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be one of  many loans which Agnes has taken from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a tricycle, have a cement shop, open a bar, open a retail shop, and open a grocery store. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support. 

She used the profit to pay school fees, build eight shops for renting, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to open a drink shop and also increase the grocery store's inventory.

Agnes will share this loan with her loan group "Majohe Halisi" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a drink shop and increase her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Durga Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Ajhola is the featured borrower of “Durga Mahila Samuha”. Ajhola is a housewife and her husband Brahmadeo is a carpenter. They live in a rural area of Deoghar District in Jharkhand. They have two sons, both are in school. Brahmadeo is the only earning member of the family. He works in a different village for a living. The family has a small piece of agriculture land where they grow crops for the family to ensure their food security. The family needs some working capital to run the business smoothly. With the loan, Ajhola’s husband will buy more equipment for his carpentry business. The family has a desire to establish a furniture shop at Deoghar and to educate their children. 

Like Ajhola, the other four members are also seeking loans to improve their livelihood for which they are in need of sufficient capital. Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their lives.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Lakhi Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
“Lakhi Mahila Samuha” is composed of five members and it is led by Gouri. The members of the group are engaged in various businesses. Gouri, who is standing with her hand raised, is living in Lagwa village, Dumka, Jharkhand. She is married and has a son. She has a dairy farm and her husband is into agriculture.
  
She wants to improve her husband’s farming. The loan that she is seeking will be namely for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, pesticides etc. This will allow her to generate income in order to support her family.

Like Gouri, the other members are also seeking loans to improve their livelihoods. The loan that they are seeking will help these women to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Witethie Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ziprorah, a member of Witethie Self Help Group. She is thirty-two years old, married and blessed with four children. Ziprorah raises maize and beans in her village. She has undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training modules on group dynamics, savings mobilization, and enterprise and financial management, which she applies in the management of her business.

Ziprorah is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds to help boost the crop yield. She hopes that the loan will increase her income and that she will be able to educate her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Nyaitugi Welfare Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is Joseph, 59 years old, married and blessed with three children. He does both dairy and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a loan to buy quality dairy feed for his two cows so that they can increase milk production, helping meet the growing demand for milk. He hopes that the anticipated income increment will help support his children's education by buying study materials and paying for tuition fees.
He is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Mary, who is 42 years old, works hard to support her family. She is a poultry farmer and also practices dairy farming. Mary is borrowing a loan to purchase animal feeds and mineral supplements and to rent an extra plot for her fodder farming.  She hopes that her business will go a long way in helping her support her family by ensuring food security.

Mary is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed and mineral supplements and rent an extra plot of land.

loans.name: Imamgulu

texts.en:
Imamgulu was born in 1965. He is married with three children. One of them is studying at technical college, another is going to tenth class, and the little child is 10 years old and going to school. Imamgulu’s wife is Taylor. The family is living in the Absheron region, but for 22 years they have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli City. 

Imamgulu has been a taxi driver for 14 years. Today he wants to repair his car’s motor, and for this reason his has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 1300 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN). For the help, he says thanks to all lenders of the Kiva organization.

loans.use: to repair his car’s motor

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, 38, has a mixed-farm where he is based with his family of four in Kebirigo in the Nyanza region of Kenya. On the farm, he grows various crops and keeps dairy cattle and poultry. For the last six years, he has made money selling his farm's produce and engaging in other side businesses. He feels passionate about farming. However, his business is facing challenges such as the high cost of inputs and occasional drought. Julius is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. The upside, to Julius, of focusing more on his poultry business is that it is not very much affected by the major challenges he faces: the high cost of farm inputs and drought. Poultry feeds on food that is readily available. They also lay eggs regardless of the season of the year. This investment provides a certain source of income all year round. The money Julius will make from this expansion will help meet his family's expenses such as food and school fees. He wants his family to enjoy a balanced diet to grow strong and healthy so that they can be more productive towards generating income for the family.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Mark, 77 years old, married and living with his wife and children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in June 2013.

Mark is a maize and beans farmer and also keeps poultry. He has undergone training on enterprise creation and financial management provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. This has enabled him to run his enterprise more effectively. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase chicken feed and add more chickens to his brood.  He hopes this will enable him to meet the rising demand for chicken and eggs in Nakuru, Kenya. He hopes for improved income that will help him support his family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their help and support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Pheminah

texts.en:
Pheminah is 38 years old, married, and - together with her spouse - blessed with 4 children. She has a grocery business, which she has been running for the past 3 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of cereals to sell. She will also pay school fees for her child. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is Pheminah's first loan from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to grow her business, make more income, and buy a farm for farming.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals and also pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Houriya

texts.en: Houriya is a 26-year-old married lady in her fourth year at college majoring in economics. Houriya wants to graduate and start looking for a job to improve her family’s living conditions before having kids. She is now applying for an educational loan to be able to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda is 32 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school while the other one is still too young for school. Living in a village in the Krokor district, Chanda has been farming rice for a living for 14 years. She manages to earn about 23,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children.
 
This is the first loan for Chanda with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy a water filter for use by her family. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for use by her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Tupendane Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Tupendane Women Group. She is forty-two years old and a mother of six. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November 2013.

Jane sells vegetables in the local market to earn a living. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for enterprise training as it has enabled her manage the business more effectively. She is borrowing a loan to purchase more stock of vegetables, such as onions and tomatoes, to meet the rising demand for her products. She hopes to earn enough income to meet her family's needs such as food, education, and medical care.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be business oriented. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in an area with a favourable climate and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use her KES 20,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more dairy cows. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he grows crops and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a fertile area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the lack of finances. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Raheelah

texts.en: Raheelah is a 59-year-old mother of seven sons and daughters. Raheelah is an illiterate woman; her husband attended only primary school. She wants her children to get an education and have better living conditions than what she had. So she opened a small grocery store where she sells some food products and household items to serve the neighborhood and make some income for the family. Raheelah is now applying for a loan to purchase some basic food items for the store, such as rice and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase some basic food items for her grocery store

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn, 39 years old, is living in a rural community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has an only child who is currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. So far, it has been almost twenty years for her being a farmer. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 per day.

Thorn wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lina works hard to support her family. She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Lina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 22-year-old married lady with no children. She is a university student in her second year, majoring in programming engineering. Ghada is seeking a loan to pay for her semester fees so that she will be able to expand her studies and find a job in her field.

loans.use: to pay for her study fees

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
Caroline, who is raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Ngeleno Women Group. She is 39 years old and blessed with three children. Two of her children are in primary school and one is in high school. Caroline is a single parent and lives with her three children. 

She runs a business of selling clothes in Nakuru, Kenya. She is borrowing a loan to purchase more stock for her business, which she has been operating for seven years. With this loan, she hopes that her business will go a long way in helping to increase her level of income. This will enable her to meet her family's needs with ease, such as food and education for her children. 

Caroline is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Al-Rawia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rawia. It consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 230,000 YER from AMB.

Alwia is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of four children who lives with her family in a poor area. Her husband works as a street cleaner with a very small salary, which is not enough to cover the needs of the family. The house where Alwia and her family live lacks basic home appliances, and they do not have enough money to improve the living condition of the family. 

For this reason, Alwia has applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances. Alwia looks forward to providing her house with all the necessary home appliances and furniture.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Enshirah

texts.en: Enshirah is a 21-year-old conservative lady, so she asked her husband Hamza to take her place in the photo. Enshirah is a married lady with no children. She started working in beauty salons to get experience and make good connections with people. Now she is starting her own small beauty salon at home, so she applied for this youth loan to bring the needed tools and equipment that will enable her to start the business.

loans.use: to bring the needed tools and equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Chirindo

texts.en:
Chirindo is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Chirindo operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over six years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Chirindo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps pigs and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the 10,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to have a large business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has a small farm in the heartland of Kemera, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. He is a husband to a lovely spouse, and they have been blessed with three children. Samwel has been doing mixed farming for 28 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and other personal businesses. 

The land in the Nyamira area is characterized by a rolling topography, not permitting the best cultivation practices to be followed. The only farming business that thrives is poultry farming. Samwel is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. There is so much growth opportunity in the chicken business in Kenya. The demand for poultry products is always high, especially during the festive seasons. Samwel has always had chickens but only recently has moved from a subsistence basis to a commercial one. 

He dreams of expanding the business, but he is constrained financially. With the help of a loan, he has plans to acquire several fowl. From this acquisition, he will be in a position to produce many eggs and much meat for sale in the local market. The income generated from the sale of the poultry products will help Samwel to afford his children’s growing educational expenses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have  a large business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of farm inputs

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra de 43 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 3° grado, no continuo sus estudios por la economía y mejor decidió aprender a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos. Esta acompañada y es madre de 5 hijos de 26, 24, 22, 19 y 16 años de edad, de los cuales solo uno vive con ella porque es el que esta estudiando y depende de ella, los demás ya tienen su propio hogar y trabajan para ellos mismos, su compañero de vida trabaja en los Estados Unidos y Sandra se dedica a la venta de queso fresco desde hace años decidió trabajar en este negocio para poder darle a sus hijos todo lo que necitaban, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos de engorde, después de un periodo venderlos y así podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cemento, ladrillo, arena etc. para terminar de construir un corredor que ya lo tiene empezado; así lograra tener un poco mas de seguridad en su casa para ella y su hijo. El sueño de Sandra es terminar de ampliar y construir su vivienda ya que solo la tiene a medias y con los créditos obtenidos podrá irla mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Sandra is 43 years old and a housewife. She has a third grade education but could not continue any further at school due to her financial situation. Instead, she decided to learn how to work in order to help her parents with household costs. 

Sandra is married and has five children, ages 26, 24, 22, 19 and 16 years old. Only one of Sandra's children lives at home - he is studying and depends on his mother. The rest now have their own homes and jobs. Sandra's husband works in the United States. 

Sandra has been working selling fresh cheese for a number of years. She decided to start this business in order to be able to give her children everything that they needed. Sandra also raises pigs, which she sells in order to make a little more income.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy cement, bricks, sand and more in order to finish building a hall in her house. This will give Sandra and her son a little more security in their home. Sandra's dream is to finishing extending her house and to use her loans to make improvements to it.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and more in order to finish building a hall in her house.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa âgée de 47ans a pour conjoint un notable avec un enfant de 26ans scolarisé. Pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Kossiwa revend du céréale et en même temps du "kom" une nourriture préparée à base de mais. Elle revend de façon ambulante à KPALIME. Pour acheter plus de marchandises, elle demande un premier crédit à WAGES.  Comme perspectives d 'avenir, elle espère avoir son propre réseau de distribution et s'épanouir.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 47 years old and her husband is a public figure; they have one child who is 26 years old and educated. In order to help her husband provide for the family's needs, Kossiwa sells cereals and at the same time "kom", which is a dish made from corn. She sells on a door-to-door basis in Kpalime. She is requesting a first loan from WAGES so she can buy more stock. Her future ambition is to have her own distribution network and to flourish.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Atsufe

texts.fr: Atsufé est revendeuse de profession. Elle revend des produits d'alimentation générale depuis 1995 à KPALIME et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Vu que les fêtes d'année s'approchent, Atsufé demande un premier prêt pour s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. A l'avenir, elle espère voir son activité prospérer et avoir une vie aisée avec sa famille( elle est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge).
texts.en: Atsufé is by trade a retailer. She has been retailing groceries since 1995 in Kpalime and gets her supplies in Lomé. Since the end of year festivities are approaching, Atsufé is requesting a first loan to get fresh supplies so she can satisfy customer demand. In the future she is hoping that her business will prosper and that she will have a comfortable life with her family (she is married with two children in her care).

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des sandales pour revendre à ses clients, Afi fait sa toute première demande de prêt à WAGES. Le profit l'aidera à vendre en gros et détail et construire une habitation pour ses enfants. Elle est mère de famille et a pour mari un ferrailleur soudeur. Afi âgée de 40ans a une ancienneté de 13ans dans l'activité.
texts.en: Afi is requesting her first ever request for a loan from WAGES so that she can buy sandals to resell to her customers. The profit she makes will help her to sell wholesale and retail and also to build a home for her children. She is a mother and has a husband who is scrap metal dealer and welder. Afi is 40 years old and has 13 years experience in her business.

loans.use: to buy sandals.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit avec son conjoint et leurs 03 enfants à KPALIME. En 2004 elle a démarré comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits alimentaires dans la même ville. Ses approvisionnements se font à Lomé et KPALIME. Ne disposant pas assez de fonds pour acheter des marchandises, Akossiwa fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir atteindre ses objectifs. Elle souhaite vendre en gros et construire plus tard.
texts.en: Akossiwa lives with her husband and their three children in Kpalime. She began an income-generating activity in the same town in 2004 selling food products. She gets her supplies in Lomé and Kpalime. As she does not have sufficient funds to buy more stock, Akossiwa is getting a first loan from WAGES so she can achieve her objecives. She would like to become a wholesaler and build a home later on.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Vicarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICARANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosalía es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra y venta de ganado vacuno, artesana en chompas, producción de papas y tunta (papa deshidratada), servicio de construcción, producción e queso, producción de hortalizas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosalía es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un capital básico al observar que el mismo 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra mesas y refrescos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The association 'Vicarani' is beginning their second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional hub. It is made up of eight members and directed by an executive board of which Rosalía is the treasurer. The businesses that the association's members are involved in include buying and selling cattle, hand made jumpers, potatoes and tunta (dehydrated potatoes), running a construction service, making cheese and growing leafy green vegetables.

This loan will benefit the small micro-companies that Rosalía is a part of. She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer after having been invited by a consultant from the institution that visited her at home. At the moment she is running a business selling food. She tells us that she started this business with just a small amount of capital. 

The loan that she is taking out now will be used to increase her capital by buying tables and soft drinks in bulk. She will purchase them from the bulk vendors in La Paz and then install them in her workplace. This line of work allows her to generate an income to support her family, as she lives with her partner and has two children. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Rosalía replied that she likes the loans the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy tables and soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Pour acheter des casseroles, des fourchettes et cuillères, Amivi sollicite un second crédit à WAGES. Elle souhaite ouvrir plus tard une boutique et assurer la scolarité des enfants. Son mari est menuisier, ils ont 03 enfants en charge.
texts.en: Amivi is requesting a second loan from WAGES so she can buy pans, forks and spoons. She would like to open a shop later on and also provide for her children's education. Her husband is a carpenter and they have three children in their care.

loans.use: to buy pans, spoons and forks.

loans.name: Ilcia Verónica

texts.es:
Ilcia es una joven muy trabajadora de 23 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 7° grado, no continuo sus estudios porque su abuela ya no se lo permitió y le enseño mejor a trabajar para que le ayudara en los gastos.

 Esta soltera, vive con sus padres, su hermano y su abuelita. Ilcia se dedica a la venta de tostadas y pasteles de papas desde hace 15 años trabajo que lo aprendió de su abuela para ayudarles económicamente en los gastos de la casa, en la venta le ayuda su madrecita este trabajo lo desempeña en su casa en el horario de 1:00 pm a 5:00 pm todos los días. 

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar plátanos, papas, maíz y leña para continuar trabajando en el negocio de la venta de tostadas y pasteles de papas. Así podrá ofrecerle siempre a los clientes un buen producto donde ellos quedaran satisfechos, con eso ella podrá obtener un mejor ingreso para la alimentación y para tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

El sueño de Ilcia es ampliar mas su negocio y tener ingresos suficientes para poder pagar muy puntualmente su crédito y así poder tener una buena calificación en su historial.
texts.en:
Ilcia is a very hardworking young woman of 23 years of age. She is a housewife and studied up until Year 7. She didn't continue her studies because her grandmother wouldn't let her. Instead her grandmother taught her how to work so that Ilcia could help her with the bills.  

Ilcia has worked selling tortillas and shepherd's pie for 15 years, a job which she learnt from her grandmother to help her financially with the household costs. She also helps her mother to sell these dishes from her home from 1pm to 5pm every day. 

The loan that Ilcia is applying for from the institution will be used to buy bananas, potatoes, corn and wood to continue her business selling tortillas and shepherd's pie. In this way she will always be able to offer her clients good products which will leave them satisfied. She will be able to obtain a better income to purchase food and have a better quality of life.

Ilcia's dream is to expand her business and have enough of an income to repay her loan punctually so that she can obtain a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, corn and wood to continue her business selling tortillas and shepherd's pie

loans.name: Ronal Alexander

texts.es: Ronal de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esmera dando lo mejor de sí en su trabajo de mecánico de obra de banco, dicho trabajo lo realiza en su vivienda elaborando productos como: balcones, puertas de hierro, enrejados, portones, etc. estos productos gracias a su experiencia de 7 años son muy bien recibidos por su clientela.  Ronal desea construir un corredor en su vivienda, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir un corredor en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ronal is 36 years of age and lives in his own home with his life partner and two year old son. He is a man who goes to great efforts and gives his all to his job as a bench worker. He works from home making items such as balconies, iron doors, lattices, gates, etc. Thanks to his seven years of experience his items are very well received by his customers. 

Ronal would like to build a hallway in his home, which is why he made the decision to apply for a loan from FUSAI to purchase galvanised metal sheeting, wood and nails.

loans.use: to purchase galvanised metal sheeting, wood and nails to build a hallway in his home

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda de 31 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta el 6° grado, no continuo sus estudios para dedicarse a trabajar a los oficios domésticos. Esta acompañada y es madre de 2 hijos de 13 y 6 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura y a mecánico desde hace varios años, mientras que Olinda se dedicaba a la venta de charamuscas, chcobananos y venta de pescado, pero ahora en día se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 3 años, trabajo que se decidió hacerlo porque vio que le fue dando mas ganancias y así ella puede darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El crédito solicitado en la institución, es para comprar pollos de engorde, concentrado y vitaminas para que en un tiempo pueda venderlos y con las ganancias recibidas poder darle a su familia una mejor alimentación.

El sueño de Olinda es que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente para que tengan mejores posibilidades de un buen trabajo, tener una granja de pollos mas amplia y ahorrar mucho para ir pagando las cuotas del crédito muy puntualmente.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 31 year old housewife who has studied up until the 6th grade. She didn't continue her studies because she wanted to dedicate herself to working at home. She has a partner and is a mother to two children who are 13 and 6 years of age, both of whom study. Her life partner has worked in agriculture and mechanics for many years, while Olinda has worked selling lollies such as charamuscas and chocobananas as well as fish. For the last three years Olivia has worked raising chickens to fatten up. She decided to do this because she noted that it was more profitable and she is able to give her family a better quality of life.

The loan that Olinda has applied for from the institution is to buy chickens to fatten up as well as extracts and vitamins to resell. With the income that she receives she will be able to provide her family with a better diet. 

Olinda's dream is for her children to become professionals so that they have better possibilities of securing a good job. She would also like to have a larger chicken farm and save a lot so that she can make her loan repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten up, extracts and vitamins

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina is 55 years old, married with four children and resides in Jimenez, the Philippines, with her family. She owns and operates a motorcycle taxi service to earn a living. For over nine years, she has sustained it and has been able to provide for the educational needs of her children. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying spare parts and tires for her motorcycle. She took out a new loan recently to buy more new tires and to cover the repair costs for her motorcycle. Her future plan is to buy a four wheeled vehicle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal, pictured above, is a 22-year-old single man from Jabalia in Palestine. He has opened a store in the city, where he sells basic groceries. It is a good business but still needs a lot of improvements. He would like to expand his business in the future and rent a bigger store. 

Nidal has taken out a $500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more groceries for his store and in turn increase sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for his store

loans.name: Elizabeth Guadalupe

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una persona amable, gentil y muy sonriente de la vida, ha dedicado su tiempo al bienestar de su familia y a salir adelante, se ha esforzado por dar lo mejor de ella, por eso no ha dejado de trabajar. Todas las mañanas son distintas para Elizabeth con bolso en mano y lleno de productos sale a ofertar sus productos a sus clientes. Elizabeth se siente agradecida por la facilitación del crédito anterior que repercutio de buena manera en su negocio, logro incrementar sus ganancias y ganar nuevos clientes. Con ánimos de seguir trabajando y surtir su negocio, Elizabeth solicita su segundo crédito para comprar los siguientes productos, ropa interior, pantalones y blusas, todos estos son nuevos estilos ya que tiene mucha demanda por la mayoría de sus clientas que se caracterizan por ser mujeres. 
Elizabeth es una mujer con esperanzas y sueños y uno de ellos es poder tener un tramo en el mercado y ofrecer su mercadería de una forma más surtida y ordenada, pero por el momento seguirá con su negocio en su casa, hasta que obtenga más ganancias, de esa manera Elizabeth deposita su confianza en el financiamiento del crédito que la beneficiara a ella y a su familia a incrementar sus ingresos y ganancias, seguirá trabajando con Micrédito a través de KIVA, hasta ser autosuficiente, y no dejara de soñar y seguir trabajando arduamente por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very friendly and kind person who smiles at life. She has dedicated herself to the wellbeing of her family and to moving forward in life. She has made a great effort to give the best of herself, which is why she hasn't stopped working. 

Every morning is different for Elizabeth. With a bag in her hand filled with products she goes out to offer her products for sale to her clients. Elizabeth feels very grateful for her previous loan which had a positive impact on her business. She was able to increase her income and obtain new clients. With the desire to continue working and restock her business, Elizabeth is applying for a second loan to buy underwear, pants and blouses, all of which come in new styles since there is a lot of demand for it, most of all from her female clients.   

Elizabeth is a woman of hopes and dreams, one of which is to have a spot in the market where she can offer more of her merchandise in a more orderly fashion. For the moment however she will continue working from home until she obtains a greater profit. Elizabeth is placing her trust in this loan that will benefit both her and her family to increase their income and profits. She will continue working with Micredito via Kiva until she is able to be self sufficient. She will not stop dreaming and will continue to work hard for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pants and blouses

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. She is a mother of four children; one is a rice farmer and the other three are students. She is an active farmer on a small rice farm, which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make a decent income to support her family. So far, she has been involved in this career for almost twenty years. 

Savy wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by installing a latrine in her house. Thus, she is taking out a loan from KIVA to build one. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL as it has a much lower interest rate than other general loans.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: María Isidra Del Rosario

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudió porque no le gusto y no queria estudiar, esta casada y es madre de 4 hijos de 19, 17, 14, y 13 años de edad, de los cuales solo 3 estudian el otro les ayuda a trabajar para poder aportar dinero a la casa; su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura y María se dedica a la siembra de pepino y frijol de rienda desde hace años trabajo que lo aprendio de sus padres, para llegar a su trabajo ella camina 1 kilometro trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 12:00 del mediodia, ahora en dia esta empezando a trabajar a la crianza de pollos de engorde para obtener un poco mas de ingresos y asi ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar pollos de engorde y para comprar semilla de pepino y asi poder sembrar nuevamente en donde en un periodo podra obtener ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de María es que sus hijos estudien mucho y ampliar la granja de pollos de engorde.
texts.en:
María is a 35 year old housewife. She didn't study because she didn't like it and she didn't want to do it. She is married and is a mother to four children who are 19, 17, 14 and 13 years old. Three of her children study while the other one helps them by working and bringing some money home. Her life partner works in agriculture while Maria works planting cucumbers and green beans. She has worked in this job for years, having learnt it from her parents. To get to work she walks one kilometre and works from 6:00am to 12pm (midday). Now she is starting to work raising chickens to fatten up so that she can obtain a bit more of an income and help her husband with the household costs. 
 
The loan that María is applying for from Credicampo is to buy chickens to fatten up and to buy cucumber seeds to sow again so that she can obtain a seasonal income to give her family a better quality of life.

María's wish is that her children study a lot and that she can expand her chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten up and to buy cucumber seeds to sow again

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
Naum is 30 years old, married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with two children. She has a tailoring business and has been running it for five years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of textile materials for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children as well as to invest in farming.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes are to expand her business by buying more sewing machines and even to train other members of her family and friends in the tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married with four children and she works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. She is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and has been blessed with five children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Grace operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Grace dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a retail business where he sells green groceries. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a fast-growing area and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of green groceries. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of green groceries.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman and a mother of two who lives in Kaloleni. 

She sells green groceries, helped by her family. Christine is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. 

Christine is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as fluctuation in milk prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rinelda

texts.en:
Rinelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rinelda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rinelda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Hello world! The above picture presents to you a young, very ambitious small holder farmer who is only 25 years old. Geoffrey, based in Bosamaru, a very remote area in the Nyamira area of Kenya, is happily married and a proud father of two. 

Because he lacked the finances, Geoffrey did not go to college. Instead, he has been engaged in mixed farming for the past four years, earning a decent and honest livelihood. He passionately loves poultry farming, and the Bosamaru area sees high demand for poultry meat and eggs, so farmers have been overwhelmed. 

Geoffrey never worries about competition because there is enough demand. Visionary and enterprising, Geoffrey has always wanted to increase his poultry numbers, but his biggest challenge is lack of funds. He is therefore seeking a loan to buy additional poultry, which will enable him to satisfy the demand for eggs in his village. This will lead to increased income and profit margins. 

The poultry Geoffrey intends to buy are not ordinary poultry but rather breeds that have high productivity and high resistance to diseases. These breeds will assure him of an increased income level and hence improved living standards. He will also benefit from poultry manure, which has higher nitrogen levels than other livestock sources. 

Geoffrey’s long term goal is to save more money and be able to start a large shop where he will be selling poultry meat, eggs and poultry feathers, which are used in making earrings. He also plans to save more money and go back to school; he will be taking care of poultry in the morning hours and attending evening classes.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 35 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Rosalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing. 

Rosalyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan.

Rosalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir was born in 1969. But for 22 years his motherland has been occupied by Armenians and Shakir’s family are IDP (internally displaced persons).

Shakir is married and the father of two children. They live in the Abseron region. 

Shakir works as a teacher but after school he works as a taxi driver, because he can't provide for his family. 

Shakir safely repaid his previous loan. Now he needs a loan in amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). It’s his third loan. With this loan he wants to buy winter wheels. Shakir is thankfull to the Kiva organization and lenders for all help.

loans.use: to buy winter wheels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ground nuts, sweets, and other items

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes. Beatrice has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area suitable business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. 

Beatrice will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes. 

Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be sucessful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Belen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling seafood. Belen is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
