Leizel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leizel is 41 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Leizel has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Leizel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 54 years old, and married with five children. He grows sugar cane that he sells to Kinyara Sugar Works. He earns a salary to boost his income. 

Edson intends to use the loan for planting sugarcane. He hopes to expand and diversify his farm business, but he suffers from a challenge of fire outbreaks that burn all his sugarcane.

loans.use: to plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is married, with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for use in her business . 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Juventina

texts.es:
Doña Juventina es una señora de 66 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive en Morazán, Yoro, junto a su hijo, su nieto y su nuera.
Hace varios años que doña Juventina con sus propios esfuerzos estableció su negocio de venta de ropa nueva como camisetas, pantalones, ropa interior, cosméticos y sandalias. Consiguió un  local o puesto de venta en el mercado de la comunidad donde vende la mercadería. Atiende  todo el día a sus clientes. Con las ganancias obtenidas más los préstamos ha surtido el negocio. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para  surtir su inventario de ropa, zapatos, sandalias y cosméticos y aprovechar la temporada para vender. Su plan es mantener surtido el negocio para satisfacer la demanda y obtener más ganancias para tener un  mejor nivel de vida y ayudar a sus hijos cuando necesiten.
texts.en:
Juventina is a 66 year old widow who loves in Morazán, Yoro, who lives with her son, grandson and daughter-in-law. A few years ago with her own effort started a business selling new clothing like t-shirts, jeans, underwear sandals and cosmetics. She got a stall in the community market where she sells her merchandise. She takes care of her clients every day. With her earnings and with the loans she has stocked her business.

Currently she is requesting another loan of 15,000 HNL to stock her inventory with clothing, shoes, sandals and cosmetics and take advantage of the season to sell. Her plan is to keep her business stocked to satisfy the demand and make more income, to have a higher living standard and to help her children when needed.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, sandals and cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. 

Joyce has operated a fresh milk selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when the business is low. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase milk gallons for use in her business when selling milk. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase milk gallons for use in her business when selling milk.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent has a bakery in Eldoret town, and has been in this business for two years. She 32 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. 

She will be using this loan to buy a bakery mixer to make bread and scones for her business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more equipment, such as ovens.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to open a bigger bakery and build a home for her family.

loans.use: To buy a bakery mixer for baking bread.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos (queso y crema), con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de la casa, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda y terminar de construir el cuarto para sus hijos, que es el que muestra en la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar cemento, arena, laminas, puertas, ventanas y pago de mano de obra para que sus hijos puedan vivir más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Mercedes lives in her own house with her life companion and her two children. She works selling dairy products (cheese and cream). With her income she manages to pay the household expenses. She wants to make improvements on her house and complete the construction of the room for her children, which is shown in the photo. She does not have sufficient capital to do this so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy cement, sand, laminate, doors, windows and pay for labor. Then her children can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, laminate, doors, windows and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ralyn

texts.en:
Ralyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store, E-loading (mobile prepaid load) and plastic-wares businesses. Ralyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her coffee business.

Ralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her coffee business.

loans.name: Mbuche

texts.en:
Mbuche is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Mbuche owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mbuche operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables

loans.name: Al- Sokor Group

texts.en:
Al-Sokor is a group which consists of five women from Taiz city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Karama is the leader of the group. She is a 45-year-old married woman, and a mother of eight children, living with them in a small house which needs  expanding. That house is not enough for all the members of the family; it consists of a few rooms. Karama is an uneducated woman, and works as a cleaner with a health institute in Taiz city, with a small salary. That salary is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family and to expand the house. 

Karama wants to expand her house but she doesn't have enough money to do. For this reason, Karama turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank and took out a loan of 60,000 YER to purchase construction materials to build another room in order to expand her house.

Karama looks forward to renovating all her house to make a better future for her family.

loans.use: to expand her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es: Alba, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, reside en un sector suburbano del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 4 años que Alba inicio su propio negocio de elaboración de ropa de cama como ser sabanas, cubre colchón para camas unipersonales y matrimoniales. Esta ropa que confecciona la vende en su casa por pedidos y en el mercado local. Está solicitando el segundo préstamo a la institución y este es por 20,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar la materia prima que utiliza para la elaboración de sabanas y cubre colchón, como es la tela, hilos y elásticos. Espera ampliar mas el mercado y obtener mejores ingresos. Su sueño es que el producto tenga su propia marca y poder vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Alba is 34 years old, married and has two children. She lives in a semi-urban area of the Municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Four years ago Alba started her own business making bed clothing like sheets and mattress covers for single and double beds. She sells the bed clothing that she makes at her house on order and at the local market.

She is requesting her second loan from the institution, this one for 20,000 HNL. She will use it to buy raw materials that she uses in making the sheets and mattress covers such as fabric, thread and elastic. She hopes to expand her market and make more income. Her dream is to for her product to have its own name and be able to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and elastic to make sheets and mattress covers to sell.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dora is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her two sons and her husband. She has worked making and selling tortillas for several years. Her business is located in an area of her house and she has a lot of clients. She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime so that she can make more income to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Candelaria Nohemi

texts.es:
El comienzo de toda mujer trabajadora da inicio desde que abre sus ojos, así es la historia de Candelaria quién se ha esforzado al sacar a su familia adelante, convirtiéndose en un pilar fundamental. Luego de haber finalizado su primer crédito este le fue de gran éxito en su negocio ya que pudo abastecerlo ofreciéndole a sus clientes un alta gama de productos como sus mejores granos básicos, esto le ayudo a obtener más ganancias incrementar su clientela y a mantener sus ahorros que le ayudaran en un futuro, Candelaria se siente complacida porque este crédito le dio la oportunidad de proyectarse a un nuevo publico adquiriendo nuevos clientes y más ganancias.
Candelaria se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brindó, esta vez solicita un segundo crédito que le ayudara a seguir surtiendo su negocio, este financiamiento lo utilizara para comprar los siguientes productos: arroz, frijol, azúcar y aceite ya que estos son los principales productos de consumo de sus clientes, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para poder surtir su negocio y seguir obteniendo más ganancias, de esta manera le ayudara a incrementar las ganancias y seguir abasteciendo el negocio.
texts.en:
Every working woman's story starts when she first opened her eyes. That is true for Candelaria who has worked hard to support her family, becoming their mainstay. She has just completed her first loan, which was very successful for her business because she could stock it well, offering customers a wide range of products such as her best staple grains. This helped her increase her income and her customers and keep her savings which will help in the future. Candelaria is pleased because this credit gives her the opportunity to address a new public, acquiring new customers and more income.

Candelaria is grateful for the opportunity which she's been given, this time requesting a second loan to help her to continue with her business. She will use this funding to buy rice, beans, sugar and oil as these are her customers' staple food products.

Candelaria relies on funding to stock her business and continue to generate income, this will help her increase her income and continue to stock the business.

loans.use: to buy the following products: rice, beans, sugar and oil

loans.name: Zenita

texts.en: Aside from her farm, Zenita was engaged in a buy and sell business to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for her farm fertilization. She earned well from this activity and was able to make some home improvements out from her income. She took a new loan recently to cover the costs for plowing and cultivating her farm for a more productive harvest. She plans to buy farm equipment to be used for farming.

loans.use: to cover the costs for plowing and cultivating her farm for a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a married woman; she has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, drinks, milk and other items. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are daily. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, milk and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, milk and other items to sell in her store

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Hoy is 47 years old, a married farmer with two teenage children. She has been a farmer since 1992. One of her children and her husband are workers. They live in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $12 per day. Now Hoy would like to request a loan to build a latrine. This loan will provide her family a hygienic living. In the future, she wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her family

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Saumu operates a dairy milk selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Saumu dreams of becoming a wholesaler of milk in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cow feeds and two milking gallons for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cow feeds and two milking gallons for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 20 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, milk and other items for her store.

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
Naum is 27 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child. She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for 6 years. 

She will be using this loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, and flour to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to build rental houses and buy more land.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, sugar and flour to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials to use in her craft business

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas, who is in his late 20s, is single with one son who is still in school. He has been running a poultry business for eight years now. He works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Dismas' 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy chicks which he grew and sold as broiler chicken. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, covered household expenses and reinvested in business. He will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds. He dreams of being a successful business man.

Dismas will make sure that he pays his loan at the scheduled loan date.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the Kes 30,000 loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school.

Chizi has operated a fresh water selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; business is especially low during the rainy season. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to install water tap for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to install a water tap for her water sales business

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix de 61 años de edad vive con su esposa, su hija y su nieto en casa propia, el es un hombre  trabajador y responsable, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  crianza de ganado lechero (producción y venta de leche)  en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio, por eso solicita un crédito para poder comprar un ternero que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Felix, 61 years old, lives with his wife, children and grandson in an own house. He is a hard-working and responsible man. For years he has been making a living by raising dairy cattle (for the production and sale of milk) in the area where he resides. He has many customers as he knows how to gain the trust of his customers.

He has decided to invest in the care of his cattle, since that is what his business depends upon. He is therefore requesting a loan to be able to buy a calf to allow his business to grow. With this he hopes to have favorable results and to continue providing the economic help that his household needs so much.

loans.use: to buy a calf to allow his business to grow

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Edgardo de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes,  Edgardo ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y la compra de mas ganado que le permita crecer en el negocio y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edgardo, 45 years old, lives in an own house together with his two children and his wife. For several years he has been making a living by raising cattle in the area where he resides. He has many customers since he has known how to gain their trust.

Edgardo has decided to invest in the care of his cattle since that is what his business depends upon. He is therefore requesting a loan to be able to buy vitamins and purchase more cattle. This will allow his business to grow and to have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and purchase more cattle

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de queso freso desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita ese crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, lámina galvanizada, pines, etc.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and lives in an own house together with her life partner and daughter. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has long been making a living by selling fresh cheese. This sale is done in an itinerant manner, and together with her life partner, they support the economy of their home.

With the desire to improve their life conditions she requests this loan to FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bedroom. With the requested amount she will buy cement, sand, bricks, galvanised iron sheets, pins, etc.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, bricks, iron, galvanised iron sheets, pins, etc. to build a bedroom

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a conservative lady who asked her husband Samer to take her place in the photo.

Hanaa is a 27-year-old mother of three children who started working in a flower shop to get experience. She wanted to help her husband, who is a military man, with supporting the family.  For this reason, Hanaa is starting her own home business making plastic flowers and center pieces. 

She is applying for a youth loan to purchase needed tools and materials to start the business.  She will distribute her flowers to home product shops.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools and materials for making plastic flowers.

loans.name: Chengo

texts.en:
Chengois a married man with no children. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Chengo operates a food-making business, making staples like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. He mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs to be his major challenge. 

With the Kshs. 20,000 he wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, and beans. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a retail shop in Eldoret town and has been running this business for close to two years. She is 54 years old and widowed with four children.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of goods such as flour,cooking fat,rice and sugar to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and, in the future, she hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is 18 years old and a student at a university. She lives with her parents in Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. Due to the fact that she is short of financial support, Lida would like to request a loan to pay her university fees. This loan will help her graduate. After graduation, she wants to work for a bank or micro finance institution with a reasonable salary so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Female small-scale farmers dominate the agricultural landscape in most production environments in Kenya, yet they constitute the majority of rural actors locked in socio-cultural structures that limit their agricultural productivity, efficiency and effectiveness at all points across the value chain. Key examples are entrenched inequities in access to productive land, limited access to credit, poor access to markets, and lack of extension services and agricultural technologies relevant to their needs. 

Kiva lenders, the above picture presents Mary who started farming 14 years ago on a small inherited piece of land in Kiamwagi, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow which makes her very proud.

 Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Through the loan, she will also be able to buy a chaff cutter which is a mechanical device used in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage for better feeding of the cow. The chaff cutter also prevents the animals from rejecting any part of the food. Mary believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Mary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a soft drink and soda distribution business which she has been running for the past three years. She is 36 years old, married and, together with her spouse who provides additional income, they have been blessed with 3 children. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of soda and soft drinks to supply her retail customers. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes are to grow her business and be successful, make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soda and other soft drinks for her supply.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Jane, a mother of two boys and one girl, has overcome this challenge and has been practising mixed farming for the past five years. 

Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, tea and milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Jane, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. 

Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Jane is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is a married mother of nine kids and lives in Kaloleni. She sells green groceries, helped by her family. Kavumbi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money. Kavumbi is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy beans, sugar, fruit, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, fruit, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman and has been blessed with eight kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Rachael operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over three years and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs. 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y reside en el Municipio de Lepaera, Lempira. Tiene varios años de haber establecido su propio negocio, elabora y vende desayunos, almuerzos, cenas y golosinas como pastelitos, baleadas, tacos y refrescos. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar insumos como carnes, harina, verduras, condimentos, aceite, y otros materiales que utiliza en la elaboración de comidas para vender. su plan es seguir trabajando y mantener el negocio para darles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Digna is a 48-year-old single mother, has 4 children and lives in the town of Lepaera, Lempira. She established her own business several years ago. 

She makes and sells dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and also sells cupcakes, baleadas (a wheat flour tortilla with beans, cheese and butter), tacos and beverages. 

The business is located at her place of residence and has kept it stable through the investment of loans. She is currently requesting a loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy supplies, like meat, flour, vegetables, condiments, oil and other ingredients that she uses for the making of her dishes. 

Her plan is to keep working and continue with her business so she can keep providing her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy supplies, like meat, flour, vegetables, condiments, oil and other ingredients that she uses for the making of her dishes.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, 45, lives with her husband and four children in a village of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 27 ten years and they supplement the family’s income by raising pigs. 

Phan is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to pay her son’s tuition fee at the university. She hopes to keep him there until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school. Judith owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Judith operates a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Al-Kawakeb Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Kawakeb. It consists of five women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.
Maryam is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children living with her family in a poor area. She is from an extreme poor family in Taiz. Maryam and her husband work as street cleaners with a very small salary, which is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. Their humble business is the main source of income for the family. The house where Maryam and her family live lacks the basic home appliances and they do not have enough money to improve the living condition of the family. Maryam can't afford that condition. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to do that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances.
Maryam looks forward to providing her house with all home appliances and furniture.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is a 21-year-old single man from Attell, a village near Tulkarem. One year ago, Sameh opened a bee farm next to his home. He produces honey and sells it in the local market. It is a very profitable business, but seasonal. 

Sameh requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more beehives for his business. This will increase the productivity and also the income. Sameh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more beehives for his business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Hearing a description of Judith can sound a lot like hearing someone describe your own mother. She doesn’t stand out in a crowd. She’s not the first one to speak, nor the loudest. She sits down every day in the evening to catch the latest intrigue on her favorite local radio station, which provides maybe the only break in her day. 

Judith, who is a mother of two and based in the Nyamira area of Kenya, has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years. She sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. That makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy building, so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy building. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is an institution that provides small holder farmers with a service bundle that includes credit, training and market facilitation, she believes her life will change. 

Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy building provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from contracting diseases that may arise from being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Judith believes that through this loan her living conditions will change, because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy building. 

Judith believes that ending poverty begins with empowering women so that they can control their own destiny

loans.use: to build a dairy cow building.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Mary, who lives in Thika area of Kenya. Mary is the mother of five lovely children and has been doing farming for the past ten years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping, she has been able to produce milk and eggs. Mary is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, she is able to take care of her family’s needs and wants. 

Although she experiences challenges in farming, her attitude keeps her going. Enjoying what she does, she has even nicknamed her cow “lovii.” Mary is seeking a 50,000 KES loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forages. This assists the animal in digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. With the loan, she would be able to increase her milk productivity and also increase her income levels, hence reducing the poverty level that is currently facing her. Mary’s biggest dream is to get out of this poverty level, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of her family and increasing her income level.

loans.use: to buy a chaffcutter.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself as self-motivated. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes. 30,000 loan to buy more stock of animal feeds and other farm inputs. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a ranch. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfnance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of animal feeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a boutique shop and has been running the business for 2 years. She is 24 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 1 child. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family.

Mary will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes for resale. These include blouses, skirts and dresses. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by buying more stock of clothes and shoes.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business, make more profits, be able to educate her child and live a happy life with her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes such as dresses and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has been blessed with six school-going children. Her husband is a businessman. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  

Amina has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she sells soap and homemade jik (bleach) to her clients. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 
With the loan of Kshs. 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
Claribel de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado debido a que había que caminar mucho para llegar a la escuela y por la situación económica de esa época, sus padres se negaron a seguir apoyándola porque de lo poco que ganaban sus padres había que ayudar a todos sus hermanos algo que era bien difícil de hacer. Ella es casada su esposo se dedica a trabajar como seguridad, juntos han procreado dos hijas la 1ra tiene 16 años y estudia 2do año de bachillerato, la 2da tiene 15 años y estudia 1er año de bachillerato.
   
Claribel tiene un negocio donde vende productos alimenticios de la canasta básica. Cuenta que cuando se casó su esposo era el único que trabajaba de vigilante también en esa época y a medida se hizo de capital decidió ponerle un pequeño negocio para que ella también le generara ingresos, al principio eran pocas las cosas que tenía a disposición de los clientes pero esto les fue rentable y poco a poco agarro experiencia y decidió meterse de lleno al negoció con lo que hasta hoy ha mejorado su situación financiera. Antes solo hacia los oficios del hogar como lavar, planchar y cocinar. El negocio lo tiene en su casa, solo lo hace cuando se le agotan algunos productos y tiene que salir a buscarlos para tenerlos a disposición de los clientes. En el negocio colaboran sus hijas y su esposo. Normalmente mantiene abierto el negocio de 6 a.m a 7:30 p.m

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para complementar el dinero que requiere para comprar un terreno.  El crédito será de gran ayuda porque podrá pagar el terreno de una vez.  Construido el terreno tendrá más valides lo que será de provecho en un futuro para sus hijas.	

Los sueños de Claribel son trabajar fuerte  y hacer crecer su negocio y apoyado de credicampo lograr que sus hijas que entre poco van a salir de educación media, accedan a la universidad a optar por una carrera para que puedan un día tener un mejor ingreso económico que ayude al sostén financiero de la familia.
texts.en:
Claribel is 37 years old. She studied up to Grade 6. She had to walk a long way to school and due to the economic situation at the time her parents refused to continue to support her studies. With the little that they made it was difficult to them to help all their children. She is married and her husband works as security. Together they have two daughters. One is 16 and is in her 2nd year of secondary school and the other is 15 and in her first year of secondary school.

Claribel has a business selling basic food items. She says that when she married her husband was the only one working, as a security guard at this time. As she gained capital she decided to open a small business so she could also generate income. At first she had few items to offer her clients, but it was profitable. Little by little she gained experience and decide to go full-time with the business and today she has improved her financial situation. Previous to that she only did housework like washing, ironing and cooking.

Her business is located in her house. When she runs out of some product then she has to go out and find more to have to offer her clients. Her daughters and husband help her with the business. Normally she keeps her business open from 6 am until 7:30 pm.

The loan that she is requesting is to compliment the money that she needs to buy a plot of land. The loan will be of great use as she can pay for the land at one time. Building on the land will make it more valid in providing for the future of her children.

Claribel's dreams are to work hard and expand her business. And with the support of CrediCampo she will achieve this. Her daughters in a short time will graduate from their schools and enter university to study so that one day they can have greater economic income which will help sustain the finances of the family.

loans.use: to supplement the money she needs to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Hija

texts.en:
Hija is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Hija dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rusaka Mirembe Group

texts.en:
George, aged 32 years, belongs to the Rusaka Mirembe group. A resident of Rusaka in the city outskirts and a father of two school-going children, 
George operates a retail shop which he has been operating since 2000 and he believes it is doing well. George has the possibility and capacity of growing his business if he gets enough capital because he is such a hard working and focused man. He  approached UGAFODE for a second loan of 600,000 Shs. through the group to buy daily house-hold use items like sugar, soap, salt, toiletries, cooking fat among other items that he will sell to increase his profit and income. He thanks the group members for guaranteeing him and the Kiva lenders for the support. He hopes to get another loan after this one. He is hard working and committed.

loans.use: to buy household use items.

loans.name: Al- Marwa Group

texts.en:
Al-Marwa is a group which consists of four women from Taiz city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB.
Asema is the leader of the group. She is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of four children living with them in an very old house which needs a renovation from the inside. That old house is threatening to fall down at any time. Asema is an uneducated woman and works with her husband as street cleaners with a small salary. That salary is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family and to make renovations on the house. Asema wants to renovate her house but, that business needs a lot of money and, she doesn't have enough money to do. For this reason, she asked for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to purchase construction materials to renovate the house.
Asema looks forward to renovating all her house to make a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate the house.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta built a stable for her animals with your help and now she needs your help again. This time she wants to invest in fishing nets and a motor for the fishing boat that her sons use. They are self-employed and still live with their parents.

Ruta is very grateful to her lenders and remains hopeful that they will help her again this time.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a motor for the boat her sons use. They are self-employed.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 61 years old and widowed with 7 children. She sells fruits, vegetables, tomatoes and onions, a business she has operated for 1 year, earning a monthly income of about KES 4,000. 

She has requested KES 10,000 for her first loan of with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock of vegetables, such as cabbages,  tomatoes and onions, as well as bananas, mangoes and avocados. With the anticipated profits, Khadija will be able to provide for the needs of her family. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve her business, make more income, eradicate poverty and thereby live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man, and he has five children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

Joseph operates a retail business where he sells pens, pencils, and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a developing area and his primary customers are daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

Joseph will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of pens, pencils and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to  buy more stock of pens, pencils and other items

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a promising place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes. 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, sweets and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will open a big supermarket. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes. 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that, in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothing.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells motor vehicle tires. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more tire stock. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.	

He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more tires.

loans.name: Jaibi Orquidea

texts.es:
Jaibi de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado por la situación financiera de su familia no pudo continuar estudiando. Es acompañada y madre de tres hijos, el 1ro estudio hasta bachillerato y actualmente está trabajando tiene 20 años, la segunda tiene 17 años y estudia 2do año de bachillerato, la tercera tiene 13 años de edad y estudia 4to grado. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como albañil


Jaibi se dedica desde hace 4 años a elaborar pasteles, enchiladas, yuca, frescos. Desde que era pequeña aprendió de su madre,  porque como no siguió sus estudios no le toco más que aprender este oficio y ayudar a su madre. Para sacar adelante su familia, desde que tiene uso de razón salió con ventas a la calle más que todo cuando hay alguna actividad en su comunidad, de igual manera prepara su venta para ir a las canchas de futbol los días sábados y domingos. Antes trabajaba de doméstica en la ciudad pero por no descuidar sus hijos decidió regresar a su casa. En el negocio se involucra su esposo ayudando a comprar la materia prima, igualmente su hija mayor le colabora a hacer los bocadillos. Los días sábados y domingos venden casi siempre por las tardes.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar tres bultos de yuca, 1 quintal de maíz para los pasteles y las enchiladas,  5 libras de papas, 25 libras de azúcar para el fresco,  300 bolsas para empaquetar los productos. El crédito ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos con lo que podrá mejorar la condición económica de su familia, y dar así lo más básico para su alimentación, vestuario, calzado.		

Su sueño es que sus hijos ingresen a la universidad y que puedan sacar su profesión, para que en un futuro ayuden a su última hija, y que la condición de su familia cambie con los ingresos que puedan tener de un trabajo digno. Por otra parte, quiere ampliar su negocio y lo va lograr adicionando productos que hasta hoy no tiene  como hamburguesas, pupusas.
texts.en:
Jaibi, age 37, went to school through the second grade.  She was not able to continue going to school due to her family’s financial situation.  She is in a relationship, and she has three children.  The first one, age 20, has a high school degree and is currently working.  The second one, age 17, is in the second year of high school.  The third one, age 13, is in the fourth grade.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Jaibi has been making pies, enchiladas, yucca, and soft drinks for four years.  When she was little she learned this from her mother.  Because she did not continue her schooling, there was nothing else to do other than learn this trade and help her mother in order to get her family ahead.  She has been going out and selling on the streets, especially when there is some community activity, ever since she can remember.  She also prepares for her sales by going to the soccer fields on Saturdays and Sundays.

She used to be a domestic employee in the city.  However, she decided to return home so that she would not neglect her children.  Her husband is involved by helping her buy the raw material.  Her oldest daughter helps to make the food.  On Saturdays and Sundays she sells almost always in the afternoons.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy three cases of yucca, one ‘quintal’ [100 pounds] of corn for the pies and enchiladas, five pounds of potatoes, 25 pounds of sugar for the soft drinks, and 300 bags to package the products.  The loan will help her to get better earnings with which she will be able to improve her family’s financial condition.  She will also be able to give them the most basic things in regards to their food, clothes, and shoes.

Her dream is for her children to go to the university and that they are able to get a profession.  She wants this in order to be able to help her last daughter and for her family’s income to change so that they are able to have a decent job.  She wants to expand her business, and she will do so by adding new products like hamburgers and ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas].

loans.use: to buy three cases of yucca, one ‘quintal’ [100 pounds] of corn for the pies and enchiladas, five pounds of potatoes, 25 pounds of sugar for the soft drinks, and 300 bags to package the products

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman living with her husband and five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seventeen years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to becoming a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

Eunice operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Eunice will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jose Isaias

texts.es: Jose de 57 años vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, age 57, lives with his family at their own house. He has a bakery located at his place of residence, where he has lived for the last 5 years. He has a lot of customers due to the quality of his bread. 

With the earnings that he makes he manages to cover the payments of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, jellies of different flavors, molds, etc. This will allow him to continue with his work and improve his incomes in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jellies of different flavors, molds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es: Elba de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee un taller de costura ubicado en su casa desde hace 30 años, posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de tela, hilos, botones, elásticos, etc. todo por mayor y asi continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Elba, 56 years old, lives in her own house with her two children. For the past 30 years she has had a sewing shop in her house. She has many customers due to the quality of her work. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fabric, thread, buttons, elastic, etc. wholesale to continue her work that generates a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabric, thread, buttons, elastic, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling dumplings to her neighbors and passersby to earn a living. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Maria Roselia

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus hijo y sus nietos, ella se dedica desde hace 19 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frijoles, chicharrón, maíz, quesillo, etc. para prepararlos asi como muestra en la fotografía y poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 56, is a single mother who lives at a house of her own with her children and grandchildren. For the last 19 years she has worked making and selling pupusas. Her business is located at her place of residence and has a lot of clients. 

She is requesting a loan to buy beans, pork cracklings, corn, cheese, etc. to make the pupusas like it is shown in the picture. This loan will help her to continue with her business and have better incomes, thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, pork cracklings, corn, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to own more motorcycles within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, soap, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has three children ages between 9 years and 15 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, milk, bread and other items. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, milk, bread and other items.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a repair business where he repairs bicycles and motorcycles. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bicycle and motorcycle repair materials. His business goal is to have a big garage within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy bicycle, and motorcycle repair materials.

loans.name: Shehab Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shehab. It consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Alia is a 25-year-old married woman, and a mother of six children, living with her family in a poor area. She is from a very poor family in Taiz. Alia and her husband work as streets cleaners with a very small salary. The house where Alia and her family live lacks of a lot of home appliances and most of them are very old. Alia wants to purchase home appliances, but her income is not enough. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase home appliances. Alia looks forward to providing her house with all home appliances and furniture.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: La Gran Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 57 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, luchadora, constante, trabajadora y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad, un lugar caracterizado por el constante crecimiento del comercio en todas las áreas, de clima tropical con una temperatura de 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Elena es de tez morena, cabello gris, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español (la segunda de la derecha, blusa blanca) su necesidad por mejorar su calidad de vida la hiso formar una banca de personas, con negocios como; tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería, tienda de videos y venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; hamburguesas, salchipapas (salchichas en rodajas y papa frita), sándwich de huevo y pollo frito, en un puesto de venta fijo y atiende de lunes a domingo por las noches, durante el día se encarga de vender ropa como empleada en una tienda de ropas de marca, cumple su labor de lunes a sábado en horarios de oficina (09:00am hasta 18:30pm). Esta es la cuarta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en doce años que viene realizando esta labor. Su negocio es exitoso porque la ubicación es céntrica y caminan por el lugar muchas personas. Su sueño es tener un snack completo en su propio domicilio, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión en la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is a 57 year old single woman and doesn't have any children. Her business is selling fast food. She is enterprising, optimistic, dependable, hard-working and very responsible. She works in the southern area of her city, in a place known for its constant business growth in all areas. The zone has a tropical climate with a temperature of 27-32 degrees centigrade all year long.

Elena has a dark complexion, grey hair, medium height, her first language is Quechua and her second language Spanish. She is the second person from the right in the blue blouse). She needs to improve her quality of life so she formed a communal bank group. The members have businesses such as making baby clothing, selling french fries, selling athletic clothing, neighborhood store, butcher, video store, selling sandwiches. They seek a loan to grow their respective businesses.

Elena's business is selling fast food such as hamburgers, salchipapas (sausage and french fries), egg and chicken sandwich. She has a fixed stand that she works Monday through Sunday in the evenings. During the day she sells clothing as an employee in a brand-name clothing store. She works there Monday through Saturday 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM.

This is the 4th loan cycle, and she has had this business for 12 years. Her business is successful because of its central location and many people walk through that area. Her dream is to have a snack bar in her home. She wishes to expand her business by investing in buying tables and chairs in order to serve more customers. For these reasons Elena seeks a loan to purchase tables and chairs to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in order to serve more customers.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred, who sells produce, is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He desires to educate his children. One of his challenges is bad weather, which limits accessibility to the market centre for increased earnings. Fred is asking for a loan to buy maize for reselling.

loans.use: to buy maize for reselling.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be cooperative. 

Isaac operates a bakery where he cooks cakes which he transports to different retailers for sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Isaac will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for preparing cakes. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will increase profits and apply for a bigger loan. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for preparing cakes

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 39 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for fourteen years now. Right now she earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Lillian has requested her first loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase cosmetics to sell and use in her business. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business.

Lillian's future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of groundnuts, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Ediburgo Franco

texts.es: Ediburgo tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y una hija. Ediburgo trabaja como jornalero y carpintero desde hace mcuho tiempo y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del corredor dado que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y significa un peligro para todos. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, pines, etc.
texts.en: Ediburgo, 47, lives in his own home with his wife and a daughter.  He has worked as a laborer and carpenter for a long time; this is how he supports his household.  Because he wants to improve the condition of his house, he has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the covered patio, which is currently in bad condition, creating a danger for others.  With the funds from this loan, he will buy sheets of corrugated metal, wood, fastening pins, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
This kind and responsive woman is Sabohat. She lives and works in the small town of Tursun-zoda. At the age of 37 years, she has a husband and three children. 

Sabohat's husband is a cattle breeder. Sabohat helps her husband in his work. They have been engaged in buying and selling cattle for six years. Through animal husbandry they make their living, and now they need to expand their business to improve their living conditions. 

With this aim Sabohat applied for a loan. She is going to purchase one calf and feed for cattle from the loan amount. Livestock is a major source of income for the family and your support is very important to them to maintain life.

loans.use: to purchase one calf and feed for cattle

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is divorced and she has one adult daughter. Natalia has her own business. She makes and sells wreaths, baskets, and bouquets made of artificial flowers. With previous loans she was able to buy an outlet and expand the range of goods. Natalia is a very hardworking and responsible person. She spends all of her time selling and making funeral goods.

Natalia is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to buy frameworks for flowers. The loan will help Natalia to increase her profits and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy frameworks for flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles and other supplies for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia no pudo continuar sus estudios. Esta acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  es padre de una  menor de 18 meses.

Juan trabaja prestando servicios de seguridad en una colonia privada en la ciudad, en este trabajo tiene 2 años, él desde sus 18 años salió a prestar su servicio militar, cuando salió de alta decidió trabajar como seguridad actividad que hasta hoy realiza y disfruta cada momento de su vida,  otra actividad productiva es la siembra de granos básicos como: maíz, frijol que junto a su padre y sus hermanos realiza; el lugar donde trabaja le queda a unos 50 km de su casa y para llegar se traslada a pie y cuando es de agricultor camina 25 minutos a pie.


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 6 quintales de sulfato de amonio para su milpa, 1 galón de herbicida para controlar la maleza y cancelara el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva. También pagara la mano de obra para que le hagan y coloquen una puerta de su casa. 

El crédito mejorara su condición de vida porque comprara los insumos agrícolas que necesita para sus cultivos, con ello lograra que sus cosechas sean mejores y al momento que los granos alcancen un buen precio podrá vender parte de la cosecha, lo que ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos económicos.


Desea mejorar su vivienda, lo que  más quiere es agregarle un corredor a su casa para tener espacio para guardar las cosechas cuando las recoge, también  pretende repellar su casa ya que son paredes de adobe y corre el riesgo que insectos puedan hospedarse en medio de las paredes y causar una picada a cualquiera de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old. He studied until the 9th grade, when due to his family's poverty he could no longer attend school. He is married and his spouse is a housewife, and they have an 18 month son. Juan works providing security services in a private neighborhood in his city. He has worked there for 2 years, as when he was 18 he volunteered in the military and when he left he decided to work in security and today he enjoys every moment of life. His other work is growing basic grains such as corn and bean with his father and brothers. Their land is 50 km from his house and he goes there by foot which takes him 25 minutes to get there.

The loan he seeks is to buy 6 quintals of ammonia sulfate for his corn field, 1 gallon of herbicide to control weeds and to pay the rent of the land where he farms. He also will pay the laborers than work for him and add a door to his home. The loan will improve his living conditions because he will buy the farming supplies he needs for his crops, resulting that his crops will be better and the grains will fetch a good price at harvest, thus increasing his income.

He wishes to improve his home, with his top goal of adding a place to store his crops when he harvests. He also wants to plaster his house as his walls are made of adobe and he runs the risk of insects being able to take residence in the walls and end up biting his family members.

loans.use: to buy 6 quintals of ammonia sulfate for his corn field, 1 gallon of herbicide to control weeds and to pay the rent of the land where he farms.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Las puertas de la pulpería de Margarita están abiertas desde muy temprano, desde los que buscan el café hasta los que buscan el pan, en la venta de Margarita, encontrarás lo que buscas, el negocio que le ha ayudado y mantenido económicamente por estos tres años, desde que decidió , organizarse y poner su propio negocio, desde esa vez a Margarita le ha ido bien, sin embargo tiene deseos de crecer y surtir más su venta, con la variedad de productos que estén al alcance de sus clientes, Margarita cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo del cual recibe remesas y quien siempre la ha apoyado en sus decisiones.
 Por los domingos sale a vender enchiladas para tener una ayuda extra y generar más ingresos a la familia. Margarita solicita el crédito para el abastecimiento de su negocio y comprar Arroz Frijoles, Huevos, Aceite entre otros, ya que de esa manera podrá surtirlo y obtener mayores ingresos, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que este le será de soporte fundamental en su economía. Margarita tiene como metas seguir trabajando duro para mantener su negocio próspero y surtido, así como las ganancias que le ayudaran a ahorrar.
texts.en:
The doors of Margarita's convenience store are open very early in the morning for those looking for coffee, bread and other items. At Margarita's you will find what you are looking for. The business has helped her and supported her for 3 years. From the moment she decided to open a business, she organized herself and opened her own business. Margarita's business has gone well for her, and she would like to grow her business and have more stock to sell, with a variety of product to be within reach of her customers. Margarita has the support of her son who receives the shipments and who has helped her with decisions. On Sundays she goes out and sells enchiladas in order to have extra income for the family.

Margarita seeks a loan to support her business by buying rice, beans, eggs, oil, and other items to be able to stock her store and obtain greater income. She relies on the financing as this support is important for her store. Margarita has as goals to continue working hard to maintain her prosperous business and have it well-stocked, resulting in earnings that will help her save money.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, eggs, oil, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old and single. He has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for two years. He also supports four members in his family. Right now his current monthly income is KES 6,000.

He will use this loan to buy spare parts for servicing his motorcycle. He will be able to keep it in good condition and serve more customers. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.  This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to have a successful business and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for servicing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Doña Lidia, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a una hija y su yerno en el Municipio de Puerto Cortes. Lleva tres años de tener su propia pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar (arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, condimentos, jugos, productos enlatados, abarrotes como productos de limpieza, etc.) y achinería como desodorantes, ganchos y colas para niñas, chinola, tintes para cabello, cremas, etc. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 11,000 lempiras para comprar productos de la canasta básica como granos básicos, harina, manteca, huevos, refrescos, churros, verduras, productos de aseo etc. esta inversión le ayudara a surtir mas el negocio y aumentar las ventas ya que su plan es hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: Lidia is a 51 year-old single mother. She lives with her daughter and son in-law in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. For three years she has had her own convenience store where she sells basic consumer goods (rice, sugar, butter, beans, condiments, juice, canned goods, and other convenience items such as cleaning products, deodorant, hairpins, girls' hair accessories, hair dyes, creams, etc.) She has requested a loan for 11,000 lempiras in order to buy basic consumer goods such as grains, flour, butter, eggs, soft drinks, chips, vegetables, cleaning products, etc. This investment will help her stock her business and increase sales. Her plan is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer goods such as grains, flour, butter, eggs, soft drinks, chips, vegetables, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas is a 23-year-old single lady, who has eight brothers and sisters living in the same house. After her father retired, her brothers are the ones who are supporting the family. One of them is a teacher, the other is a military serviceman. 

Ekhlas is a second year Master's student majoring in history. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay her semester fees so she can graduate as soon as possible and help her brothers in supporting the family.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Khabakha

texts.en:
Khabakha has a retail shop in Eldoret town which she has been running for six years. She is 36 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of goods such as flour, cooking fat, milk, rice, sugar and washing detergents to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.
