This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to expand her business, be successful and live a good life with her family.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, milk, washing detergents, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en:
Mayada is a 40-year-old, conservative mother. She asked her son Abdulmalek to take her place in the photo instead.

Mayada is a mother for four children, one of them is Abdulmalek who is 23 years old, and in his third year at the university majoring in psychological therapy and guidance. He is also working in a part time job in a construction company. Mayada is applying for loan to pay for her son’s educational fees and to buy some books that he needs.

loans.use: to pay for her study fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old university student majoring in education. He is in his third year. He lives with seven family members in Irbid, Jordan. His father is a taxi driver, and he doesn't earn enough money to cover his family's needs. Because of that, Mohammad wants to find a job in his field after graduating. Now he is applying for this loan to pay the fees for his upcoming semester.

loans.use: To pay the fees for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair weaves and hair oil.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 45 years old. He  is married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with four children between the ages of 8 and 2 years old.

Denis is a tailor. He specializes in cushion making, a business he has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of 9,000 KES. He has requested his third loan with VisionFund Kenya of 35,000 KES, which he will use to buy different kinds of prints and materials for making cushions and cushion covers.

With the anticipated profits, Denis will be able to pay the school fees for his children as well as repay his loan. His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and to become the preferred cushion supplier in his area.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making cushions

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27 year old. married man from Yata, a village near Hebron city. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. Mohammad has a farm in the village where he raises sheep and sells milk, wool and meat in the local market. His wife helps him sometimes with the farm work. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his farm. This will help him to increase productivity and improve the farm. 

Mohammad appears in the photo in his sheep farm

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Thaera

texts.en:
Thaera is a conservative woman. So she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. Thaera is a 47 year old, married lady living with her 6 family members. 

Her husband is the only provider for his family; he is running his own supermarket which he launched 21 years ago. 

Now he needs to purchase new products such as foodstuffs and to do some maintenance on the supermarket. But because he is currently facing financial crisis, he is not able to do all of this alone. For that, Thaera wants to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to help her husband stock his supermarket and do some maintenance.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as patient, God fearing, and social. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of capital. 

She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more fruits. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes to open another branch in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more fruits

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгуль 47 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Бактыгуль - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется скот - 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 10 лошадей. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 7,000 сом (KGS). Бактыгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Baktygul has vocational education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with agriculture. Thanks to Baktygul's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, two calves and 10 horses. The monthly income is around 7,000 som (KGS) on average. 

Baktygul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 32 years old, married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with 2 children aged 7 and 3. He sells household goods such as wooden cooking spoons, wooden rolling pins, kitchen boards and picture frames among other items. He has been in this business for 6 years and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy a motorcycle which he will use to supply household items to his customers from far places. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and also repay the loan. 

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. In future he hopes to grow his business and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to supply items to far away customers..

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.ru: Гулзар 31 год, замужем, есть сын. У Гулзар высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Гулзар есть 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 2 лошади и 8 овец. Вся экологически чистая продукция Гулзар пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма и сена для скота на зиму. Сохранение скота и хороший откорм в зимний период позволит получить здоровый приплод. Доходы от кредита Гулзар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulzar is 31 years old, married and has one son. She has higher education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with agriculture since 2010, after having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Gulzar has two cows, one calf, two horses and eight sheep on her farm. All Gulzar's ecological products are in high demand and bring her a good income. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulzar turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase fodder and hay for the livestock for the winter. Keeping the livestock and feeding them during the winter period will allow her to get healthy offspring from them. Gulzar plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hay and fodder for livestock in order to feed them during the winter season

loans.name: Redwan

texts.en:
Redwan is a 24-year-old single man who lives with his family in Haja city, Yemen. He is a student in secondary education. 

Redwan has a very old mobile phone, and it doesn't work well. If any person calls him, his phone breaks down quickly. He couldn't afford this condition, so Redwan decided to purchase a new phone in order to connect with other people and his friends and relatives in a better manner. For this reason, Redwan applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new (Galaxy) phone for himself.

loans.use: to purchase a new phone for himself

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printing and photocopying papers and expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her brother's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 58, is a mother of seven who lives in an upland village called Kemera, which is swallowed by the Nyamira valley. The only activity to speak of for Kemera residents is livestock farming. Joyce keeps cattle and poultry on her farm. Her primary income sources are milk, a variety of food crops and eggs. Joyce’s agribusiness has been profitable for five years. She is very contented with farming, not only as an economic activity, but also as a lifestyle. 

Today she is seeking a loan to purchase poultry in order to expand her business. With your loan, Joyce will make enough income from the investment to repay the loan and better her living. The brood of hens she plans to acquire will produce more eggs for her to sell. They will also help aerate soil and break vegetation in her farm as they scratch the earth trying to find bugs. The additional income will be timely as her children’s education expenses keep increasing. The loan will also help her family to enjoy food security.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 21 years old university student majoring in Business Administration, and he is in his third year.

Abdullah wants to support his family financially by finding a job in his field after graduating because his retired father isn't able to cover his four family members' needs. He is applying for this loan to pay for upcoming semester fees so that he can continue his study and reach his aim in the future,

loans.use: to pay for upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 46 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Розы - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, благодаря упорному труду Розы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 2 лошади и 30 овец, а также земельный надел мерою 2,08 ГА, где она выращивает ячмень и картофель. Также Роза реализует экологически чистое домашнее молоко на ежедневной основе. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 18,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства Роза старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Однако нужно и улучшать жилищные условия своей семьи, Роза хочет построить в доме санузел. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку душевой кабины, бойлера, труб и прочих отделочных материалов. Доходы же от ведения бизнеса, Роза будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Roza is 46 years old, married and the mother of four children. Roza has vocational education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. 

Thanks to Roza's persistent work, her farm currently has two cows, two calves, two horses and thirty sheep. She also has a plot of land of 2.08 hectares, where she grows barley and potatoes. Roza sells ecological milk on a daily basis. The monthly income is up to 18,000 som (KGS). 

Roza tries to invest the money she earns in developing and expanding her business. However, she also needs to improve her family's living conditions. Roza would like to build a bathroom in her house. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purhcase a shower enclosure, a boiler, pipes and other building materials. Roza will direct the income from her business into further developing it.

loans.use: to purchase a shower enclosure, a boiler, pipes and other construction materials in order to build a bathroom in her house

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 24 years old; he lives with his parents in Gaza. He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house after the last war at Gaza. Mahmoud is asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house, install new doors, and paint it, which will make it better to live with more psychological comfort. He has a shortage in money to buy the things he needs, and to help his parents. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy flagstone to pave his house, install new doors, and to paint it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beauty products for use in her salon.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 45 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children.

She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 15 years. Her salon is profitable and she earns a monthly income of KES 35,000.

This will be her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan purchase more stock of hair products, hair weaves, and cosmetics for sale and use in her business. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children.

She paid her previous loans successfully and her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy hair products and cosmetics for use and sale in her salon.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 10 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be goal oriented. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a local area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his motorcycle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: La Piña Ahorros (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Amas de casa y excelentes madres trabajaras son Martha e Irene ellas viven en una comunidad muy tranquila que se caracteriza por el cultivo de maíz y la cría de animales como borregos, becerros, pavos, pollos y cerdos para venta.

Martha quien es representante del grupo tiene 40 años de edad y está casada con el señor Rodrigo, juntos formaron una gran familia con 8 hijos, cinco de ellos aún se encuentran estudiando. Desde hace 14 años Martha se dedica a la cría y engorda de becerros, con su préstamo comprará dos animales pequeños para cuidarlos durante algunos meses y posteriormente venderlos para obtener sus ganancias. Para Martha, esta es la actividad ideal pues tiene la oportunidad de quedarse en casa y cuidar de sus pequeños, especialmente porque su esposo trabaja en la construcción de casas en la Ciudad de México y pasa mucho tiempo lejos de sus seres queridos. 

Martha e Irene están muy contentas porque el préstamo les permitirá continuar con sus actividades y así ellas apoyarán a su familia cubriendo los gastos del hogar. Su sueño es tener un mayor número de animales. "También me encantaría que mis hijos terminaran una carrera profesional para que pudieran tener mejor oportunidades de trabajo y no padecer lo que su papá y yo vivimos” comentó Doña Martha. 

*En la imagen: las integrantes sentadas en el jardín municipal, doña Martha viste un suéter blanco.
texts.en:
Our two hard-working moms, Martha and Irene, live in a quiet rural town.  Local people make their livings growing maize and raising farm animals--sheep, cattle, pigs and poultry--for market.  

Martha, 40, and her husband, Rodrigo, have a large family of 8 children, five of whom are still in school.  She has operated an animal sales business for 14 years, raising calves and selling them.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy two calves that she will raise and sell for a profit when they are ready to market.  Martha says that the business is a perfect one for her because she needn't juggle her business or her children to take care of both, an especially important consideration for her because her husband works construction jobs in Mexico City and is often away from the family.

Martha and Irene like this means of borrowing because they can carry on their businesses and help provide for their families.  Martha says that she hopes to have many more animals in the future.  "I'd also like my children to have jobs that pay well and don't require the sacrifices that their father and I have had to make to pay our bills", she adds.  

*Martha, in the white sweater, and Irene are pictured in the photo sitting in a local park.

loans.use: to buy two calves for her animal sales business.

location.town: San Jeronimo de los Dolores, San Felipe del Progre

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Poultry farming is something that is more of a passion for Margaret than a business. She started pursuing her passion 15 years ago. Margaret is a smallholder mixed farmer from Nyamira, Kenya who is married to a nice 62-year-old husband. They have been blessed with six kids so far. She is very hardworking and focused. Her primary income sources today are milk, eggs, and tea, among other crops. 

Margaret is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She seeks this expansion to enhance her family's financial security. The more hens she acquires, the more assets under her name and the more income she makes through egg sales. The hens will also bring other numerous benefits including chicks, manure, and feathers. The income from this investment will enable Margaret to take better care of her family and pay for her children's education. Lend $25 to improve the quality of life of a wife, a mother, and a progressive lady farmer in Kemera village.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Radia

texts.en:
Because Radia is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to be in the photo instead.

Radia is a 62 year-old married woman who has been a good support for her husband for ten years. She has been helping her husband in running their mini-market.

At one time, the mini-market contained only few products to sell. Later, they added variety and built a good customer base. Now their mini market is running out of products. For that, she needs to purchase more food, chips, candy and snacks to sell. But because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more food, candy, and snacks for her mini-market.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 56 лет, замужем, мать троих детей, но они все взрослые и проживают отдельно. Образование у Дамиры - средне-техническое, она работает администратором в гостинице, на протяжении 2 лет занимается животноводством. Супруг Дамиры помогает по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Дамиры есть 9 бычков. Дамира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для постройки сарая для скота, в котором она будет содержать животных зимой. Доходы от бизнеса Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Damira is 56 years old, married and the mother of three children who are adults and live by themselves. Damira has secondary technical education. She works as a manager at a hotel. For a period of two years, she has also worked with livestock breeding. Damira's husband helps her with the farm. 

Currently Damira has nine bull-calves at her farm. She turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase building materials to build a barn for her livestock, in which she will keep the animals during the winter. Damira plans to invest the income from the business in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a barn for her livestock

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Sabina. She lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations. Sabina is the mother of 4 lovely children and she has been in the agriculture business for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. 

Sabina has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as for fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Sabina remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Sabina is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Sabina will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. 

This loan will support Sabina’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Mary started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Bonyunyu, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have an easier time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also keeps them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Mary believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Mary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy reed material to make her crafts and support herself and her parents.

loans.name: Elenilson De Jesus

texts.es: Elenilson tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 8 años y 2 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Elenilson es pequeño comerciante de variedad de productos como: colchas, sabanas, hamacas, sillas artesanales, toallas, cubrecamas, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es el que le permite dar a su familia lo necesario. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para establecer una pequeña comercial. Con el monto comprará toallas, colchas, cubrecamas, hamacas, sabanas, etc.
texts.en:
Elenilson, 40, lives in his own house with his life partner and their two daughters, ages 2 and 8, who are studying. Elenilson is a small trader selling various products, such as bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, artisan chairs, towels, covers, etc. With this work, he makes a living and provides for his household. This business is his main source of income, which allows him to give his family what they need. 

He is applying for a loan from FUSAI to purchase a larger quantity of products to establish a small shopping area. He will use this loan to buy towels, covers, bedspreads, hammocks, sheets, etc.

loans.use: to buy towels, bedspreads, covers, hammocks, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en: Mourine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Mourine's business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Veronicah operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sandra  Veronica

texts.es: La señora Sandra, tiene 31 años, es madre soltera, vive en Pastaza, cantón Puyo,  dicha zona es considerada cálida – húmeda, es una ciudad donde el sector turístico y por ende comercial está en auge, la señora tiene un negocio de venta de artículos de plástico (fundas, platos y otros), este trabajo los realiza sola en su local, ella tuvo aspiraciones de estudiar y tener un título profesional pero debido a varias circunstancias no pudo realizarlo por lo que decidió poner su propio negocio porque así puede estar también al pendiente de sus 2 hijos, y con el crédito que se le otorgo, va a incrementar otro tipo de productos en su negocio. Sandra agradece a KIVA por el poyo brindado a su crecimiento personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra,31, is a single mother who lives in Pastaza, region of Puyo. 

This area is considered hot and humid. It is a city where tourism and trade are booming. She sells plastic items (covers, plates etc.) 

She works by herself in her place. 

She had dreams of studying and having a professional title but due to different circumstances she was not able to fulfill this and decided to open her own business. This way she can also take care of her two children. 

With the loan she is planning on increasing the types of products she sells. 

Sandra is thankful to Kiva for the support given to her personal and familial growth.

loans.use: to buy new products and improve her business. With these earnings she will take care of and educate her children.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Hellen operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in  a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Kanchaim

texts.ru: Канчаим, 43 года, замужем, есть 4 детей, самому младшему 1,5 года. У Канчаим высшее образование, работает медсестрой. Дополнительно занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 1 корова, 20 овец, также на 2,0 ГА собственной земельной доли, Канчаим выращивает подсолнечник для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Канчаим составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS), в том числе от заработной платы. Канчаим старается вкладывать доходы в развитие ее бизнеса, однако нужно и достроить дом, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов, она хочет достроить дом и отремонтировать времянку. Канчаим планирует закупить пеноплекс, гипсокартон для утепления, а также сетку, клей и штукатурку.  Доходы от ведения бизнеса Канчаим будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Kanchaim is 43 years old, married and has four children. The youngest one is 1.5 years old. Kanchaim has higher education and works as a nurse. In addition, she works with agriculture. She has one cow and 20 sheep, and also 2.0 hectares of own land where she grows sunflower to sell. Kanchaim's total monthly income is around 18,000 som (KGS), including her salary. 

Kanchaim strives to invest her income in developing her business, however she needs to finish building her house. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase building materials. She would like to complete her house and and renovate her outhouse. Kanchaim plans to purchase penoplex, drywall for insulation, adhesive and plaster. Kanchaim invests the income from her business in further developing it.

loans.use: to purchase penoplex, drywall for insulation and other construction materials to finish building her house and to repair her outhouse

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has three children, who range in age from 3 to 5 years old. He describes himself to be God-fearing. 

Patrick operates a retail business where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His primary customers are loyal. He will use the 14,500 KES loan to buy more stock of fish. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living. 

This is Patrick's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Bonita Luna Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México hace ya algunos años se formó un grupo con el nombre de “Bonita Luna” los integrantes necesitaban dinero para invertir en sus negocios y decidieron solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México. 

Muy sonrientes, los integrantes comentan que su comunidad es muy tranquila, pero cuando se realiza la fiesta patronal en el mes de septiembre, son días increíbles. Las familias se reúnen para celebrar a la virgen de los Dolores y se realizan carreras de caballos, danzas y fuegos artificiales iluminan el cielo.

Martha pertenece al grupo, tiene 46 años de edad y está casada desde hace 30 años, fue mamá de siete hijos de los cuales ya sólo uno vive con ella. Su actividad es la cría y engorda de borregos y con 30 años de experiencia, cuenta que aún es difícil hallar a una persona que pague adecuadamente por el peso y tamaño de sus borregos. actualmente, tiene un corral con más de 30 borregos. “Para no gastar tanto en alimento, aprovecho el campo que hay en mi comunidad para que los animalitos coman". Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano saca a los borregos hasta mediodía y así no tiene que comprar los bultos de alimento que suelen ser muy caros, salvo en tiempo de sequía cuando los campos pierden su color y nutrimento. Martha pretende comprar más borregos y comenzar a ahorrar un poco de dinero y prepararse para la sequía que pronto se acerca. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y seguir invirtiendo en sí misma ahora que sus hijos ya son independientes. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Natalia, Angélica y Rosa María quienes invertirán en sus borregos, mientras que Doña Juanita comprará productos de abarrotes y Candelaria, pollos. 

*La foto fue tomada en el jardín del Municipio*
texts.en:
A few years ago, in a community in Mexico State, a group was formed called "Bonita Luna" (Pretty Moon). 

The members needed money to invest in their businesses and they decided to request a loan from  VisionFund México. 

The members are very cheerful and remark that their community is very peaceful. However, when the patron festivities start in the month of September, it is incredible. The families get together to celebrate the Virgin of Sorrows and there are horse races, dances and fireworks that light up the sky. 

Martha is part of the group. She is 46 and has been married for 30 years. She has 7 children out of which only one lives with her still. 

She breeds and fattens sheep. She has been doing this work for 30 years. She explains that it is difficult to find a person who will pay adequately for the weight and size of the sheep. Currently she has a flock of more than 30 sheep. In order to not spend so much on feed, she takes advantage of the field in the community so that the sheep can eat. 

Early every morning, she takes out the sheep until noon. This way she does not need to buy feed which tend to be very expensive. Apart from the dry season when the fields loose their color and nutritional value. 

Martha plans to buy more sheep and to start saving money to prepare for the dry season which is approaching. 

Her dream is to improve her home and to keep investing in herself now that her children are independent. 

The other members of the group are: Natalia, Angélica and Rosa María who will invest in their sheep, Juanita who will buy grocery supplies and Candelaria who will buy chickens. 



*La foto fue tomada en el jardín del Municipio*

loans.use: to buy sheep.

location.town: Los Lobos Segunda Seccion, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Watafutaji New Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her late 20s, is married with a son who is still small.  She has been running several projects, having a beauty salon and selling cosmetics and clothes. She has been in her business for two years now.  She works from 9 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Catherine's's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy clothes for both men and women to resell.  She dreams of opening a big shop for clothes and cosmetics.

Catherine will share this loan with her loan group "Watafutaji New" which consist of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nebi

texts.en:
Nebi used his previous loan to invest in a hydraulic machine for his business. This time he is requesting another loan for $3,000 to buy a vehicle for his business activities. It will be used for transporting workers and heavy tools to the job site. 

Nebi is seeking your understanding and is hoping that he will get funding for the loan.

loans.use: to invest in a vehicle for his business to transport workers and heavy tools to/from the job site.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia, tiene 47 años, de estado civil separada, vive en Puyo en la vía al Tena sector Obrero,  dicha zona es considerada cálida – húmeda, tiene muchos lugares turísticos y zonas de diversión es considerada zona rosa, se dedica a la venta de ropa, este trabajo lo realiza sola, culminó sus estudios secundarios, pero no pudo continuar con los superiores, ya que se dedica de completo a su trabajo ya que ella es la responsable de los estudios de sus hijas, y con el crédito que se le otorgó, va a comprar una vitrina para su negocio. Agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado para cumplir con sus retos laborales y personales.
texts.en:
Patricia, is 47 years old, separated, and lives in Puyo on the road to Tena, in the Obrero sector. This region is considered warm and humid. It has many tourist attractions and entertainment zones. It is also considered a bohemian district. 

She is engaged in selling clothing and works by herself. She finished her high school studies, but was unable to go on to college since she is completely dedicated to her work. She is the one who is responsible for her daughters' schooling. 

With the loan she is granted, she is going to buy a display case for her business. She is grateful to KIVA for the support it has given her so she can achieve her personal and professional goals.

loans.use: To buy a case to display her clothes, and with the profits she will keep her daughters in school.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be experienced. 

Nancy operates an agrovet shop where she sells animal medicines and supplies. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of agrovet products. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. 

This is Nancy's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of agrovet products

loans.name: Gjystina

texts.en:
Gjystina wants to buy a dairy cow from a good breed that produces up to 20 kg milk/day. 

With her previous loan, she built a stable where two or more cows would fit in. Now she is seeking your consideration again to achieve her goal. 

She expressed her deepest gratitude towards the lenders when she was told that she could seek their financial help again this time.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding another dairy cow to the existing herd.

loans.name: Noong Het 7 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huom is a Thai ethnic lady who is 33 years old and lives in a small Thai traditional house with her mother-in-law, her husband, and her two children. To cover living expenses and tuition fees for the children, as well as taking care of her mother-in-law who is at an advanced age, Huom works very hard at agricultural production, including planting rice and raising poultry. Her husband works for the construction employers. 

Because of a high demand for consuming clean food, Huom is expanding her farming, especially animal husbandry, and she hopes that her business plan will help her increase the income for her family. For that reason, she has just taken out her 5th loan in the Anh Chi Em program to buy chicks and ducklings. Huom has worked at farm since she was a little girl, so she has rich experience in farming. She said the only difficulty she has encountered so far is lacking capital for investment, and the loans and the technical agricultural training sessions from the program have turned her plan into reality. 

Despite plenty of challenges and instability in agriculture, such as diseases and bad harvests, Huom is always smiling and optimistic, and looks forward to a brighter future for her family, especially for her children. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy chicks and ducklings

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.es:
Vitalina de 43 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora comenta que su nivel académico es de sexto grado de primaria, debido a la distancia de la escuela no continuo más con sus estudios además debía de trabajar para sostener sus propios estudios porque la situación económica de su casa no daba para más y su padre lo poco que ganaba trabajando lo invertía en comida para su familia entonces decidió dejar la escuela y dedicarse ayudar en su casa trabajando para aportar en los gastos económicos. 

Está acompañada su esposo se dedica a la zapatería, hace zapatos para vender tienen dos hijas de las edades de 22 y 20 años ambos están estudiando en la Universidad.


Vitalina se dedica a los oficios domésticos debido a que cuando era pequeña no pudo continuar estudiando comenzó a dedicarse solamente a los oficios de la casa y fue así como ella obtuvo experiencia y practica en esta actividad y ahora  no se le hace difícil atender a su esposo e hijos, en su casa su esposo tiene un taller de zapatería el cual hace zapatos para vender a otras zapaterías y ella le colabora mucho ayudándole con los pedidos y la distribución a otras tiendas de zapatos también recibe la ayuda de su hija, comenta que gracias a este negocio han podido sacar adelante a su familia debido a la producción de zapatos y los pedidos de diversas zapaterías, tiene muchos pedidos trabaja hasta el domingo para poder sacar a tiempo los pedidos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para que su esposo pueda comprar materia prima para su zapatería, como cuero para zapatos y zapatos de hule para baño.  Gracias al crédito podrán mantener la zapatería y así continuar sacando los pedidos que les realicen y debido a esto pueden obtener ingresos económicos los cuales les será de mucha ayuda para los estudios de sus dos hijas y para los gastos del hogar.

Vitalina planea para un futuro junto con su esposo, poder ampliar más su zapatería y poder abrir  un taller donde puedan emplear a personas y así poder distribuir sus zapatos a tiendas de prestigio y poder así obtener mejores ingresos económicos para tener una mejor calidad de vida ellos y sus hijos. También comprar un terreno para construir una casa para su familia y que sus hijas sigan estudiando y puedan terminar sus estudios profesionales,
texts.en:
Vitalina, 43, is a very hardworking woman. She has a sixth-grade level education. Due to the distance to her school, she did not continue with her studies. She also had to work for her own education because her family's financial situation did not allow for this. Her father invested what little he earned in food for the family. Therefore, she decided to leave school and help out by working to contribute to the household expenses.

She is in a common-law marriage. Her husband makes a living as a cobbler, making shoes to sell. They have two daughters, ages 20 and 22, both of whom are studying at university.

Vitalina is dedicated to the household duties. Since she couldn't continue studying, she started to work with the household chores, which is how she gained experience and practice in this activity. Now it is not difficult for her to care for her husband and children. Her husband has a cobbler shop in their house where he makes shoes to sell to other shoe shops. She helps out a lot with the orders and distribution to other shoe stores. Her daughter also helps her. She says that thanks to this business, they have managed to provide for their family by producing shoes and receiving orders from various stores. They have many orders and work until Sunday to fulfill the orders on time.

She is applying for a loan from CREDICAMPO for her husband to buy materials for his cobbler shop, such as leather for shoes and rubber-soled shoes for bathing. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to maintain their shop and continue fulfilling the orders which they receive, thereby earning a financial income which will be a great help for their daughters' studies and the household expenses.

Vitalina, along with her husband, is planning to expand their shoe shop in the future and open a workshop where they can employ other people and distribute their shoes to prestigious stores. They will then earn a higher financial income to have a better quality of life, along with their children. They would like to buy land to build a house for their family. They also hope for their daughters to continue studying so that they can finish their professional studies.

loans.use: to buy leather for shoes and rubber-soled shoes for bathing.

loans.name: Yessel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessel de 28 años de edad, alcanzo un estudio de 4º grado de educación básica, actualmente está acompañada; sus esposo se dedica a la albañilería y son padres de una niña de un año de edad.

Yessel se dedica a la venta de tortillas tiene muchos años de ejercer este labor junto a su familia y hoy lo realiza para el consumo diario de su hogar. Además, de la venta que realiza en su casa ella sale a vender al mercado donde hay una mayor circulación de personas y es ahí donde el producto lo vende las tortillas más rápido.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar maíz para su negocio pues tiene mucha demanda de clientes y el promedio que está gastando diario de maíz esta entre el quintal y quintal y medio. Además, invertirá parte de su capital en arreglar el techo de su cocina, comprara unas láminas, clavos y madera.

A futuro desea ampliar más su negocio, generar fuentes de empleo, poder darles un trabajo digno a personas que lo necesitan. Además, sueña con darle un estudio completo a su hija, una carrera Universitaria que le permita ser una profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Yessel, 28, studied up until the fourth grade of primary school. She is in a common-law marriage. Her husband works in construction and they have a one-year-old daughter. 

Yessel makes a living selling tortillas. She has been working in this activity for many years along with her family. Now she works for her family's daily sustenance. Aside from making sales from home, she also goes out to sell in the marketplace where there are more people and she can sell tortillas more quickly.

She is applying for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy corn for her business, as she has a high demand from her clients and is currently going through an average of 1 to 1.5 quintals of corn per day. She will also invest part of the loan in repairing the roof of her kitchen. She will buy metal sheets, nails, and wood.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and generate a source of employment to give people who need work a decent job. She also dreams of providing her daughter with a complete education and a university degree which will allow her to be a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas, as well as metal sheets, nails and wood to repair the roof of her kitchen.

loans.name: Hector Leonel

texts.es:
Héctor de 49 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 3 hijas, 2 de ellas ya están acompañadas y con su propia familia, solo una vive con él, ya es mayor de edad y trabaja como secretaria. Él estudió hasta 9° de educación básica, solo su hija vive con él.

Héctor es comerciante, vende candados, extensiones eléctricas, focos, lámparas y demás, de forma ambulante y de casa en casa, tiene 7 años trabajando de esta manera, antes solo trabajaba la tierra como agricultor. Su horario de trabajo es de todos los días de 6:30 am a 4:00 pm. Sus productos los comprar todos en la capital, porque al comprar al mayoreo es más barato.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar, extensiones eléctricas, linternas de mano, lámparas de techo de bajo consumo, herramientas entre otros. Héctor sueña con algún día terminar de pagar su casa y vivir tranquilamente con su negocio.
texts.en:
Héctor, 49, is a widower and has 3 daughters. Two of them have their own families, only one of them lives with him. She is already an adult and works as a secretary. 

He studied up to 9th grade. Only one of his daughter lives with him. 

Héctor is a merchant who sells locks, extension cords, light bulbs, lamps etc. door to door. 

He has worked this way for the past 7 years. Before he worked as a farmer. His work schedule is every day from 6;30am to 4:00pm. 

He buys all his products in the capital because buying wholesale is cheaper. 

The loan will be used to buy extension cords, flashlights, lamps, low consumption ceiling lights and other tools. 

Héctor dreams of one day paying off his house and to live peacefully with his business.

loans.use: to buy extension cords, flashlights, lamps, low consumption ceiling lights and other tools.

loans.name: Mercy Gay

texts.en:
"Hardworking mother" best describes Mercy Gay, 31 years old and residing in the Poblacion Municipality of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Mercy Gay has 3 children and is married to a driver.  The wage that her husband earns isn’t enough to sustain their family's daily needs. So, Mercy Gay started a business, a food stand or “carinderia.” Mercy Gay has been in the business for more than a year now. 

Mercy Gay wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to earn greater profits and to have enough to provide for her family, especially for her children, whom she would like to be able to send to college. 

In order for Mercy Gay to make her wish possible, she requires 10,000 PHP in additional capital which she will use to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings, and all the ingredients, utensils, and other things she requires in her food stand. 

Mercy Gay hopes to someday live a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for her carinderia.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, tiene 66 años, no tiene hijos pequeños, vive en casa familiar en el sector de las Palmas que pertenece a la ciudad de Atuntaqui por algunos años, Zona en donde realizan agricultura, artesanías, donde también elaboran prenda de vestir personas que tiene su taller propio de confecciones, zona donde también hay turismo y de platos típicos como las fritadas con choclo, papa y tostado.
Rosario tiene su puesto de venta de papas en el mercado de Atuntaqui por bastantes años, las ventas la realiza a todo el público es una persona conocida por la zona por ser responsable, respetuosa que ha llegado  a ganar el respeto de todas las personas que le rodean, Rosario solicito el crédito para incrementar los quintales de papas para aumentar las ventas y también los ingresos y seguir teniendo mercadería para ofrecer en el mercado.
Esta actividad lo viene realizando día a día  por qué es lo que más le gusta a ella es su fuente de ingreso y que también mediante a esta actividad realiza amistades para que puedan seguir promocionando los productos que ella vende, agradece a fundación alternativa por dar la oportunidad de seguir creciendo mediante a su negocio y seguir incrementando la mercadería para estas temporadas que se vienen.
texts.en:
Rosario, 66, has no children living at home.  She has lived in the Las Palmas neighborhood of Atuntaqui for many years.  Local people make their living from farming and small businesses.  Tailoring businesses, for example, and restaurants.  The area also attracts tourists and supports a small tourism industry.
Rosario has operated a food stall, selling potatoes, in the market at Atuntaqui for many years and local people say that she is responsible and respected by everyone who knows her.  Rosario is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business.  The investment will allow her to buy more potatoes and, in turn, increase her income.  Rosario works hard day in and day out and says that the business is both a means of making a living and a way to meet the many friends she's made over the years.  She adds that she is grateful for this means of borrowing money and the opportunity your loans have given her to grow her business.

loans.use: to support her farming business.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 59 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Eleuteria has a sewing machine, and with it she is able cater to her clients, fixing clothes and making dresses. She's had her business for 4 years now. 

Eleuteria has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to pay for the repair of her sewing machine, so she can keep up her business and her source of income. 

Eleuteria has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to have a new sewing machine unit.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi owns and operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for almost 5 years, and she repaid her previous loan used for her business.

To make improvements in the services she provides, Heidi would like to take a new loan amounting to 35,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more beauty and hair products like straightening treatments and other products required by her business.

In the future, Heidi wants to make expansions in her business. She also dreams of giving her children a better future. 

Heidi meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and life every week. This is also where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 50 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married with three children. Arlene has been working in an institution that sells autoparts and spare parts for 30 years. She requested a loan for house repair to make her children comfortable. She is looking out for the goodness of her children. Arlene has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes that her children can finish their studies and make her proud.

loans.use: to make house repairs

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta de 27 años de edad. Ella es acompañada y madre de tres hijos. La primera de ellas tiene 9 años y estudia 3er grado, el segundo tiene 8 años y estudia 1er grado, la tercera tiene tres años y por su edad  aun no estudia.


Marta, se dedica al cuido de cerdos y aves de corral,  cuenta que desde que era joven le gusto batallar con animales domésticos junto a su madre era el oficio que ella realizaba. Fue así que a medida paso el tiempo se encariño de los animales y decidió seguir trabajando con estos y gracias a ello ha mejorado la situación económica. Antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos, luego se fue a la ciudad a trabajar en un centro comercial. Los cerdos los cuida en su casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 4 cerdos, 2 quintales concentrado y hacer un pequeño encierro (corral) para que los animales estén más cómodos y puedan ganar energía más rápido, para este corral necesitara 3 bolsas de cemento y 1 metro de arena. El crédito ayudara a tener mejor asistidos los animales para que rápidamente salgan a la venta y que le generen ingresos para su familia.			


Los sueños de Marta son comprar una vaca lechera para cuidarla y que pueda darle parte de la alimentación para sus hijos, también quiere comprar materiales para al menos fraguar el piso de su cocina ya que es de tierra y así evitaría enfermedades provocadas por el polvo lo que muchas veces viene a desmejorar la situación económica.
texts.en:
Marta, 27, is married with three children.  Her oldest child, 9, is a third-grader; her middle child, 8, is a first-grader; and her youngest child, 3, isn't yet in school.  

Marta operates a business raising and selling farm animals: pigs and poultry.  She says that her mother taught her how to raise farm animals and that she enjoys the challenge of caring for them.  She likes the work and when she needed a way to earn an income, an animal sales business was a logical choice for her.  

Marta is applying for a loan that she will divide up to buy 4 pigs, a supply ("2 quintales") of feed and materials for building a small pen for her animals.  She says that the pen will make the animals more comfortable and ultimately more fit for market.  She needs 3 bags of cement and 1 square-meter of sand to build it. 	

For the future, Martha hopes to buy a dairy cow that will provide milk for both her family and for sale.  She also hopes to apply for future loans to lay a floor in her kitchen.  The kitchen has a dirt floor now and a new floor will mitigate the illnesses and other problems inherent to a dirt floor.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and improvements for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Narantsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Narantsogt, 24 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting passengers between districts since 2013. His wife studies at the medical college. His mother takes care of their daughter when his wife has class. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay the tuition fee of his wife. If his wife successfully graduates from her university and secures a job, his family's living standard will improve.

loans.use: to pay his wife's tuition fee.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda was working as a mail carrier when she saw an opportunity to go into business for herself – as a rural mail route contractor. She won the contract in February 2014. “It makes good sense as I have experience delivering mail and owning my own business is a good way to be an independent woman and provide for my future,” Amanda says. Since taking on the route, she is most proud of her work towards “increased reliability and delivery schedule for the local area.” As part of her business, she employs a relief driver to handle the route when she is unable to make the route. Like all mail delivery carriers, weather is the biggest hurdle for her. Amanda can cover over 100 miles a day to make her rounds and needs to make sure her vehicle can handle any kind of storms. She needs a loan to get her business vehicle ready for the Montana winter!

loans.use: to pay to winterize her business vehicle

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for many years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Loida would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 30,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Loida hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She dreams that her children will be able to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is thankful for the previous 8,000 PHP loan that was granted to her. She utilized the loan to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Lucila would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to be able to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lucila hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and she dreams of enjoying good health and strength every day. 

Lucila faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Petronela

texts.en:
Petronela is a 46-year-old widow. Her husband passed away three years ago, so Petronela has to look after their children, namely: Aldy, 19, who is in college, and Aldo, 16, who is in his second year of senior high school. 

Petronela has been working as a seamstress for two years. She sews school uniforms, blouses, skirts, curtains, and party dresses. 

She plans to improve this business by buying a new hemming machine. She is sure she can generate more income for her family. Therefore, she requested a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000.

loans.use: to buy a new Obras sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Dimas

texts.es:
José de 58 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos están acompañados y tiene su propia familia, el menor vive con él y es electricista. Con José solo vive pareja y su hijo.

José Es comerciante, administra junto a su esposa una tienda en la que vende productos de la canasta básica y tiene 10 años de tener el negocio. Antes trabajaba como electricista, pero debido a su edad, dejo ese trabajo y llego a la conclusión con su esposa de que no querían quedarse con los brazos cruzados por lo inicio su tiendan trabajan de 6:30 am a 6:30 pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar productos de canasta  básica arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, condimentos, verduras, vegetales, harinas y demás para abastecer el inventario de su tienda y la reserva. José sueña con adquirir su propio vehículo para salir a comprar su mercadería y ahorrarse algunos costos
texts.en:
José, age 58, is married and has four children.  Three of them are in relationships and have their own families.  The youngest, an electrician, lives with him.  Only his life partner and his son live with José.

José is a merchant.  Together, he and his wife run a store where they sell basic needs food.  He has had the business for ten years.  He used to work as an electrician, but he left this work due to his age.  He and his wife came to the conclusion that they did not want to be idle.  Therefore, he started their store.  They work from 6:30 a.m. until 6:30 p.m.

The loan will be used to buy basic needs products like rice, corn, beans, sugar, condiments, greens, vegetables, flour, and other products to stock the inventory of his store and their supply.

José dreams of getting his own vehicle in order to go out to buy his merchandise and save some of the costs.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products like rice, corn, beans, sugar, condiments, greens, vegetables, flour, and other products.

loans.name: Maria Rosela

texts.en:
Ma. Rosela is grateful that she was granted a 60,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her store earnings and by providing welding services and steel fabrication, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ma. Rosela dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible so they can have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is grateful for the loan assistance extended to her because she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucia wants to maintain an increasing profit from her business, for she desires to become successful in the future. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for some years now. She also finds ways to improve her income such as selling school and office supplies. Anita has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her business.

Relative to this, Anita would like to take a new loan so she can increase her product inventory for her variety store. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP in order to buy greater quantities and a variety of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her business.

In the future, Anita wants to grow her business as well as attract more customers to patronize her store. She dreams that her children will complete their studies, and she also desires to one day buy their own house. 

Anita meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 36 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a married woman. 

Belinda has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kevin

texts.es: Kevin de 21 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada  desde hace 3 años, negocio  que decidieron entre él y su hermana, cuando se les ocurrió la idea de generar ingresos independientes para apoyar los gastos de su familia, pues ambos estudian y aprendieron de su madre quien se dedica a la actividad comercial. Sus proveedores se encuentran en la ciudad de Medellín lugar donde compran ropa de buena calidad y es que su mercado así se los exige y otra variedad de mercancías, las encuentran en la ciudad de Barranquilla y las ofrecen de manera directa a crédito y de contado,  a sus clientes, que son sus compañeros de estudios, vecinos del barrio donde habitan y referidos por estos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, suéteres, accesorios femeninos y para el hogar entre otros artículos. Con esta inversión sus ventas se incrementarán, pues teniendo un inventario exhibido dice: “ Que todo entra por los ojos “  y con un mayor surtido venderá mucho más, mejorando así su negocio con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Kevin, age 21, has been selling varied merchandise for three years.  He and his sister decided on this business as an idea to generate independent earnings to help with the family expenses.  They both go to school, and they learned from their mother who devotes herself to commercial activity.

They find their providers in the city of Medellín.  It is the place where they buy good quality clothes, as their market demands.  They get other various merchandise in the city of Barranquilla.  They sell to their customers for credit and cash.  Their customers are their classmates, neighbors, and people referred by these customers.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domino.  He will use the loan to buy jeans, sweaters, women’s accessories, and household items, among others.  With this investment his sales will increase.  He says that by having his inventory displayed, “Everything is visual".  With greater stock he will sell a lot more.  With this investment he will be improving his business.

loans.use: to buy jeans, sweaters, women’s accessories, and household items, among others.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a 48-year-old lady who is married to Bernadus, 55. They have three children; two of them are married and live in Kalimantan. Only their youngest son Yusak, 18, lives with them. Yusak has graduated from senior high school and is looking for a job. 

Helena runs a shawl weaving business. She usually produces 50 shawls in a month, since she has regular customers who often come to buy the shawls directly to resell at the art shop. 

In addition, Helena sometimes spends her spare time raising goats at their farm with her husband. 

In order to meet her customers’ demands, Helena requested a loan from TLM for IDR 10,000,000 to purchase weaving yarn for her shawl business, and also more goats.

loans.use: to purchase weaving yarn for her shawl business, and also more goats.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie, 52, is engaged in a food vending business. She makes and sells peanut butter. In addition to that she is also into a buy and sell business. She is a dealer of triumph bras. These are her sources of income. Virgie has been engaged in these kinds of businesses for 10 years. She and her husband have two children ages 18 and 12 years old. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. Her husband is a carpenter. Due to her very limited amount of capital to sustain day to day needs, Virgie has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more ingredients for food vending and additional capital to purchase a variety of bras. 

In the future, Virgie hopes to expand both businesses to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending and additional capital to purchase a variety of bras

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su padre y  sus dos hijas (9 años, 6 años) quienes se encuentran estudiando. José es agricultor, cultiva variedad de frutas como: mangos, guineos, manzanas, entre otros. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. José desea seguir cultivando la tierra y de esta forma poder llevar el sustento a su familia ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, entre otros. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma  poder seguir cultivando sus productos y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, his father, and his two children (nine and six years old), who are currently studying. José is a farmer who cultivates a variety of fruits like mangos, bananas, and apples, among others. This is how he makes a living and supports his home. José wishes to continue cultivating the land and therefore be able to support his family, as it is his main source of income. 

Because of this, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI [Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development] to invest in the purchase of seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other supplies. He hopes to be able to count on this financing in order to continue cultivating his products and to improve his sales.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other supplies

loans.name: Wenefredo

texts.en:
Wenefredo is a fisherman from Dulag, Leyte.  He is 48 and has six children. His youngest child is 16.

He catches and sells fish to the people in the community. He has been fishing for more than 20 years now. He is facing financial difficulty in his present situation now, so Wenefredo has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials like fishing net, weights, floaters and hooks.  Wenefredo can now maximize his tools to have more effective fishing that will create improvement on his daily catch and eventually increase his earnings.
   
Wenefredo hopes to have a stable income that would help him send his children to school for brighter futures.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like fishing net, weights, floaters and hooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, iron, gravel, etc. to build a toilet and a septic tank.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
This is Ma. Teresita. She owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for five years and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds other ways to improve her income.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She looks forward to financial assistance with thankfulness in her heart.

In the future, Ma. Teresita wants to expand soon. She also desires good health and to help others who are need. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Yolanda would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 14,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Yolanda wants to expand her place for her business. She also desires to have her own house. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 40 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a married woman.

Leonisa has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

She has been in this business for thirteen years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 50 years old and has eight children. She is a married woman and has four children who are in school.

Adelaida has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Adelaida has been in the business for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Segundo Joaquin

texts.es:
Segundo es divorciado tiene 48 años, tiene un hijo con el cual vive en casa familiar en el sector de la Merced perteneciente a San Roque, él vive desde la infancia con sus papas que le han ayudado en lo que él ha necesitado, donde él vive es una zona de producción de artesanías y talleres de confección también hay lugares de turismo platos típicos por la zona.
Segundo tiene su local de comidas rápidas en donde vende alas asadas, choclo asado, salchipapas, las ventas las realiza en la casa que vive los productos los ofrece a las personas del barrio y más a las personas que llegan a la cancha hacer deporte ellos son los que realizan el gasto, el crédito que solicito lo va invertir en la compra de nuevos una nueva carpa, en mesas, cocina nueva para que sea más llamativo y que este en buen estado y en buena presentación el puesto.
Es una persona luchadora a pesar de tantas cosas que le ha pasado sigue intentando día día que la vida de ellos vaya mejorando, al hijo le está dando el estudio para que en lo futuro sea una persona de bien y que no pase las necesidades que paso el papá, con el tiempo Segundo quiere seguir incrementando su negocio para poder atender a más gente en la zona va tratar de poner en su domicilio el mismo negocio para que este la gente cómoda y mejor atendida. Agradece a KIVA por la oportunidad de cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Segundo, 48, is divorced.  He has one son and the two, father and son, live with Segundo's parents in the Merced neighborhood of San Roque.  Local people operate small businesses.  There is also a small tourist industry that, among other things, supports local food businesses.  
Segundo operates a small food business where he sells steaks, salchipapas and other prepared foods.  He operates the business from his house and draws most of his customers from the neighborhood or from people who play sports at the local park.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy an awning, a new cooker, new tables, etc. that will make the restaurant more comfortable for his customers and draw new customers, as well.  
Despite the many obstacles he's faced over the years, Segundo has never stopped working to make a better life for himself and his son.
