He has high hopes for his son's future, one without all the struggles that he himself has had to overcome.  For the future, Segundo wants to grow his business further.  He adds that he is grateful to KIVA lenders for the opportunity they have provided to help him fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his food store.

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of beauty products business in the Philippines.

Ailen requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more beauty products like soap, lotion, etc. to sell to her customers.

Ailen has been in this business for three years now.

Ailen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products like soap, and lotion to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ruthjane

texts.en:
Ruthjane is very grateful for the financial assistance that was granted to her. She used the loan to buy additional accessories like jewelry and other products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan for her to buy more stock of accessories needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ruthjane dreams to make her accessory store bigger and better, for she desires to give her children good educations. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is thankful for the 30,000 PHP loan that was granted to her. She used the loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria wants to become a successful entrepreneur and she desires to give her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cellphones in bulk.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 44 years old and has four children. She is a married woman.

Rosalia has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a 1,300 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. Rosalia has been in business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Elviza

texts.en:
Elviza is 43 years old and married with five children. She has three children who are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Elviza has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been fish vending for 20 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elviza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some more sheep

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a forty-two-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has three children aged 20, 17 and 16 years old. She has operated a fishing business for more than 15 years now. She catches and sells fresh fish to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman. Elma  has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy a fishing net and a fish pen. With these materials, Elma can continue her livelihood activity and enable her to have a higher-yielding catch.  

Elma hopes that , with these new tools, she will be able to expand her fishing business to provide for the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a fish pen

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with two children. Teofila has a seafood business selling sea shells, crabs, and shrimps and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to buy a variety of seafood for her business. Teofila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Teofila hopes that someday she can supply the neighboring town.

loans.use: purchase additional seafood

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.pt:
Senhor Jossefa tem 47 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 2 filhos dos quais sustenta um filho ainda Bebé, vive na casa própria com a sua familia a qual sustenta.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar refrigerantes, sardinhas, leite para revender na sua mercearia.
No futuro espera ampliar o seu negócio vendendo mais productos, de modo a obter mais receitas  para melhorar o sustento familiar.
A exiguidade de fundos torna seu negócio dificel, assim sendo vai continuar a apostar na hluvuku como forma de desenvolver seus projectos.
texts.en: Jossefa is 47 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is only a baby. He lives in his own house with his family, who he provides for. With this loan he will buy soft drinks, sardines, and milk to sell in his grocery store. In the future, he hopes to grow his business by selling more products, so he can increase his revenue and improve his ability to provide for his family. A scarcity of funds makes it difficult for him to run his business, so he will continue to borrow with Hluvuku as a means of developing his projects.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sardines, and milk to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Senhora Luisa tem 56 anos de idade, é casada, e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais sustenta 2 frenquentando ensino secundário, é negociante a mais de 37 anos de idade, vive em casa própria e sustenta 7 netos  dos quais 4 são órfaos de pai.
O montante financiado será aplicado na compra de máquina de lavar, pois tem plano de montar uma pequena lavandaria.
No futuro espera construir uma mercearia visto que agora vende numa banca, também pretende iniciar o negócio da lavandaria.
A exiguidade de fundos coloca seu negócio não competetivo, assim sendo vai continuar a apostar na hluvuku de modo a garatir mais oferta de produtos aos seus clientes.
texts.en: Luisa is 56 years old, married, and the mother of six children, two of whom attend high school with her support. She has been a businesswoman for over 37 years, lives in her own house, and provides for seven grandchildren, four of whom have lost their father. This loan will go toward buying a washing machine, so she can pursue her plan of starting up a small laundry. In the future she hopes to build a grocery store, as she currently sells out of a booth. She also plans to start up the laundry business. A scarcity of money makes it hard for her to keep her business competitive, which is why she will continue to borrow with Hluvuku so as to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and pursue her plan to open a small laundry.

loans.name: Los Lobos Group

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer muy trabajadora, siempre muy responsable. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con Fernando desde hace 15 años y juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales continúan estudiando. 

Desde hace nueve años, Catalina se ha dedicado a la cría y engorda de borregos. Ella compra los animales con tan sólo algunos días de nacidos, los cuida durante seis u ocho meses aproximadamente, tiempo en que alcanzan el tamaño y peso adecuado para obtener buenas ganancias. El negocio en realidad lo inició su esposo aunque con otro tipo de animales: compró sólo dos chivos que se reprodujeron rápidamente, no tuvieron problemas para conseguir clientes y con las ganancias comenzaron a comprar borregos.

Actualmente Catalina tiene 15 borreguitos y aunque se reproducían fácilmente, hace poco perdió al semental, razón por la cual necesita un nuevo préstamo.

El grupo “Los Lobos” también está integrado por Doña Juana y Don José, suegros de Catalina, que también se dedican a la cría de los mismos animales. Los integrantes viven en una comunidad mazahua en la cual los habitantes hacen lo posible por rescatar sus raíces indígenas. 

*En la imagen: los tres integrantes de pie en el corral de sus borreguitos.
texts.en:
Catalina is a hard-working woman and always very responsible. She is 33 years old, has lived in a common-law marriage with Fernando for 15 years, and together they have formed a family with three children who are still in school. 

Since 9 years, Catalina has worked in growing and fattening sheep. She purchases the animals when they are only a couple of days old, and looks after them for six to eight months approximately, during which time they reach the adequate size and weight to yield a good income. In reality, her husband started the business, though with other types of animals: he only bought two goats which reproduced quickly. They had no problems to get clients and with the earnings they started to purchase sheep. 

Currently, Catalina has 15 lambs and although they reproduce easily, she has recently lost her stud sheep. This is why she requires a new loan. 

The group "Los Lobos" also includes Doña Juana and Don José, the parents-in-law of Catalina, who also breed the same animals. The group members live in a Mazahua community in which the inhabitants do everything possible to retain their indigenous roots. 

*In the image: the three group members in their lamb corral.

loans.use: to purchase a stud sheep

location.town: Los Lobos, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Marleny Nohemy

texts.es: Marleny de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 10 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a viernes tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Marleny is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and her son. For the past 10 years, she has had a beauty salon business in her house. She works from Monday to Friday. She has a large customer base because she performs good work. With the income that she earns and with the help of her husband, she is able to cover household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her beauty salon, such as lotions, shampoos, hair clips, and scissors, among other things that she needs. This way, she will earn a higher income, which will help her have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy lotions, shampoos, hair clips, and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.pt:
Senhor Paulo tem 37 anos de idade é casado, tem 2 filhos dos quais um estuda frenquentando ensino primário, é mestre de obras, vive na casa própria com a sua familia a mesma que ele sustenta.
O montante financiado será aplicado na compra de cimento, area, varrões, blocos, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa visto que ainda está na faze inicial.
No futuro espera abrir uma empresa de construção civil, pois agora está se formando nesta área.
Como mestre de obras tem o desafio de garantir a qualidade de obras que executa como forma de angariar mais clientes.
texts.en: Paulo is 37 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends elementary school. He is a contractor and lives in his own house with his family, for whom he is responsible. This loan will be used to buy cement, gravel, beams, and blocks to continue with construction on his house, which is currently in the early stages. In the future he hopes to open a civil construction company, and he is currently training in this field. As a contractor, his main challenge is in guaranteeing quality work so he can attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, beams, and blocks to continue with his construction project.

loans.name: Monica

texts.pt:
Senhora Mónica tem 62 anos de idade,  solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais sustenta 2 frenquentando ensino superior, vive na casa própria com a sua familia, a qual ela sustenta,é docente de profissão mas agora já é aposentada.
O montante financiado será aplicado na compra de farinha, óleo, sabão, açúcar, massas, arróz, sabonete para revender  na sua mercearia.
No futuro espera crescer no novo negócio da mercearia vendendo mais produtos em grandes quantidades, visto que antes vendia frangos.
Liquidar  o empréstimo sem cair em mora e  seu maior desafio, para garantir mais financiamentos como forma de lograr os seus projectos.
texts.en: Monica, age 62, is single and the mother of six children, two of whom are in prep school with her support. She lives in her own house with her family, who she is responsible for. She is a teacher by profession, but is now retired.  This loan will be used to buy flour, oil, soap, sugar, pastas, rice, and body wash to sell in her grocery store. In the future she hopes to grow her grocery business by selling more products in larger quantities, as she used to do when she sold chicken. Repaying the loan without falling behind will be her top priority, in order to secure more financing as a means of realizing her plans.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, soap, sugar, pastas, rice, and body wash to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is a married mother of three children. She is a local from Carles, Iloilo. For more than 22 years, Analee and her husband have earned an income through fishing. 

Analee is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and pay for repair of their fishing boat. She believes that through her loan, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market to expand their business. In the future, Analee hopes to improve her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is married with six children. For more than 21 years, he has been a fisherman who lives in Carles, Iloilo. Fishing is a lucrative business in his location but Roberto needs additional inputs to sustain his business.

Roberto is requesting a loan to buy nylon, fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. His loan would greatly help him to improve his fishing business and his income. In the future, Roberto wants to invest more in his business in hopes of making it more sustainable and profitable. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy nylon,  fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 50 years old and is married with five children. She lives in the town of Carles, Iloilo. Minda is a very hardworking woman. Aside from doing the household chores and taking care of her children, she also helps her husband in their fishing business. For several years now, fishing has been the family’s main source of income.

Minda is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other fishing materials. Her loan will allow her to improve the family’s fishing business and income. In the future, Minda hopes to make the family’s fishing business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other fishing materials

loans.name: Rosita

texts.pt:
Senhora Rosita tem 50 anos de idade, tem 2 filhos, dos quais 1 estuda frenquentando  o ensino primário, vive na casa própria com a sua familia, a mesma que ela sustenta,  é negociante.
O montante financiado será aplicado na compra de fardos de roupa usada para revender no mercado local.
No futuro espera ampliar o seu negócio, explorando outras áreas ou vendendo outros tipos de produtos como por exemplo a venda de frangos.
A falta de fundos suficientes torna as suas actividades comerciais pouco viáveis, assim sendo continuará a fazer empréstimos na hluvuku como forma de flexibilizar os seus propjectos.
texts.en: Rosita is 50 years old and has two children, one of whom is in primary school. She lives in her own house with her family, which she provides for. She is a saleswoman. This loan will go toward buying bundles of used clothing to sell at the local market. In the future she hopes to grow her business, expanding in other areas or into other types of goods, such as selling chickens. Insufficient capital limits the viability of her her business ventures, so she will continue to take out loans with Hluvuku as a means of gaining flexibility in the pursuit of her projects.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. For the past 26 years, she has run a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines. Marcelina has borrowed six previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Marcelina is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
A Senhora Laurinda é separada, trabalhadora, mãe de três filhos dos quais um é maior de idade e indepedente, os outros são depedentes, um deles esta a estudar na beira (provincia de Sofala), ela vive com apenas um filho, um neto, e dois sobrinhos, na casa propria. Tem tido dificuldades financeiras para pagar a escola das crianças, custiar as despesas do filho que esta a estudar na beira isso porque o seu rendimento não é suficiênte e o pai dos filhos não ajuda com as despesas.
Com o presente emprestimo vai comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco e varoes) para dar continuidade com a obra na casa onde vive. O seu maior desafio é terminar a obra.
texts.en: Laurinda is a hardworking, separated mother of three children, one of whom is of age and independent. Her other children are dependents, and one of them goes to school in Beira (Sofala Province). She lives with one son, a grandson, and two nephews in her own house. She has experienced financial difficulties in paying for her children's education, particularly in paying the expenses of her son who studies in Beira, because her income is not high enough and her children's father does not contribute to their expenses. With this loan she will buy construction materials such as cement, sheet metal, and beams to continue construction on her house. Her main challenge is in finishing this work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, sheet metal, and beams.

loans.name: Mineira

texts.pt:
A Senhora Mineira vive maritalmente, tem sete filhos dos quais seis são menores de idade. É agricultora e comerciante, com o presente emprestimo vai adiquirir recargas, bolachas e doces para revender. Ela tem uma banca no mercado da vila de marracuene.
Tem como desafio comprar instrumentos de trabalho ( charua, regador e outos), sem estes instrumentos o trabalho na machamba é mais dificil e a produção é muito baixa enquanto tem machambas com grandes capacidades de produção.
O seu maior sonho é abril um salão de beleza.
texts.en: Mineira is married and has seven children, six of whom are minors. She is a farmer and a saleswoman. With this loan she will buy phone cards, cookies, and sweets to sell in her booth and the town market in Marracuene. Her main challenges are in buying work supplies (e.g. a plow, sprinklers, etc). Without these tools, work on the farm is more difficult and her output is very low compared with the the big farms with high capacity. Her biggest dream is to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy phone cards, cookies, and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc., to construct a septic tank and a bathroom.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, 50, goes fishing and sells fish to earn a living. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years. Sally is married, and has eight children. Her youngest child is 11. Together with her family, she lives in Carles, Ilo-ilo.  

Because of a financial problem, Sally has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 Php to buy a fishing net and a motor boat engine. This will help Sally and her family improve the daily catch. Thus, able to pay for food and other expenses.

Sally hopes to have a stable income that would help her send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a motor boat engine

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en:
Casiana is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is 53 years old, married, and has nine children. She is engaged in a fishing business together with her husband. For the past 15 years, fishing has provided them the income that they need.

Aside from taking care of their children, Casiana supports her husband in their fishing business. Right now, they both decided to take a loan for their business. With this, Casiana has requested to take a loan from CEVI to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights and floaters, hooks and other fishing materials. 

This will help Casiana and her husband in improving their fishing business. They sell their daily catch to the market in their place. 

Casiana hopes to improve their livelihood and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights and floaters, hooks and other fishing materials

loans.name: Ma. Dy

texts.en:
Ma. Dy is a 42-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She supports her husband in their fishing business. For more than 20 years now, fishing has provided the income that they need. 

As of now, Ma. Dy has decided to avail a loan for the business. She is requesting for a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. A loan will enable Ma. Dy and her husband to improve their daily catch. They sell their catch to the market nearest to their place. 
Ma. Dy hopes to expand their business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Gina Fe

texts.en:
Being a hardworking mother, Gina Fe has been engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within her community. She is 26 years old, and blessed with only one child. She aims to improve more of her business, but she doesn't have enough capital. 

For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP15,000 to buy the needed coconut, sugar, milk, flour, cooking oil, bananas and sweet potatoes to be cooked and sold in the local community. 

Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconut, sugar, milk, flour, cooking oil, bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 32-year-old married woman, and a mother of a one-year-child from Carles, Iloilo. Analie is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. They have been into fishing for more than 10 years now; this is the source of their income.

Analie is now requesting for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and hooks. This loan will allow her and her husband to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Analie hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and hooks

loans.name: Gracia

texts.en:
Gracia is 52 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. For the past seven years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Gracia has borrowed 12 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Gracia is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, groceries, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, groceries, and other products

loans.name: Shunhanda Group

texts.en: To find out more about how Ejido Verde is working to create opportunity for indigenous populations watch this video In the Purépecha language ‘Shunhunda’ means resin. This is the name of a group of people who collect resin in the indigenous community of Cherán. This community is in the heart of the Tarasca mountains, the home of the Purepecha indigenous people in the state of Michoacán, Mexico. Josué is the representative of this group, and he is also part of the advisory council. Josué is married, and his wife works as a professional. They have two children; Josué Felipe, age 13; and Julieta Jatsiri, age 2. Josué points out that the resin collector is the primary forest ranger. The business of collecting resin has directly impacted him his entire life. This makes him feel very proud that he is teaching and making his countrymen aware of the sustainability of working the forest. His plan for the future is for the indigenous community of Cherán to have an industry where they can produce resin derivatives. This has become one of his biggest dreams. In other words, he wants to manage to have an industry in the community where the people know how to take advantage of it, value it, and manage the forest resources. He knows that there are people around the world who are ready to help the indigenous people in their forest project. This makes his group feel committed to deliver good results. He would like to say thanks for your effort to all of those that are helping the indigenous community. They are getting out of a financial downturn and meeting the needs of the forest. In addition to being a business, resin extraction has helped preserve the atmosphere in a positive and cultural way. The trade of resin extraction is highly valued in the village. He feels that one of their biggest challenges is changing the way of looking at the business activity of extracting resin. All group members will use their loans to plant resin producing pine trees. Collectively, Shunhanda group will plant 55,000 pine trees.

loans.use: to buy and plant resin producing pine trees. The resin will be harvested annually, providing income for many years

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a 46-year-old, married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has four children. Jocelyn helps her husband in their fishing business.  Fishing is their main source of income. They have been in the fishing venture for more than 25 years now. Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, floaters, and hooks. A loan will help Jocelyn and her husband in improving their catch, therefore providing them more fish to sell in the market. Their profit will be used to buy food for their daily consumption and to pay for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, floaters, and hooks

loans.name: Dexi Marlene

texts.es: Dexi de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella quiere terminar de construir su casa colocándole  las puertas, ventanas, piso y techo, pero no tiene de suficiente capital, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales como lamina, hierro, polines, piso cerámico, cemento, balcones y pago de mano de obra para que puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Dexi is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner. She has been selling fruit and vegetables for 7 years, and has managed to cover the costs that she incurs in her household through these sales. She wants to finish the construction of her house, and put into place the doors, windows, floor and roof, but she does not have sufficient capital. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as metal sheeting, iron, poles, ceramic floors, cement, balconies and to cover the payment of workers so that they can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, iron, poles, ceramic floor, cement, balconies and to cover the payment of workers

loans.name: Paulo

texts.pt:
O Senhor Paulo vive na casa propria com a sua esposa e quatro filhos menores de idade, ele é padeiro e trabalha muito distante da sua residência. Com o presente emprestimo vai poder continuar com a construção da sua residência que foi interompida devido a falta de valores monetarios p’ra tal, vai comprar cimento, barrotes, pedras, areia, e chapas de zinco. O seu sonho é terminar a obra.
Ele tem como desafio abril uma mercearia para sua esposa visto que, ela tem uma pequena banca em casa que tem contribuido nos rendimentos da familia
texts.en: Paulo lives in his own house with his wife and four children. He is a baker and works very far from his home. With this loan he will be able to continue with the construction on his house that was interrupted due to a lack of funds. He will buy cement, rafters, stone, gravel, and sheet metal. His dream is to finish with this work. His challenge is in opening a grocery store for his wife, as she currently runs a small booth in their house and contributes to their household income.

loans.use: to buy cement, rafters, stone, gravel, and sheet metal.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es: José, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en compañía de sus hijos y su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira. José desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Cultiva en una zona agrícola y la producción la vende en el mercado local. Actualmente ha solicitado otro préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, foliar y pago de mano de obra para brindarle un mejor manejo a sus cultivos. Con el apoyo financiero obtenido él espera aumentar la producción y crecer como productor de frijol y maíz para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: José is 33 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife, with whom he has two children. He lives with his wife and children in a district of the municipality of Gracias, in the Department of Lempira. Since he was very young, José has worked in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans. He grows his crops in an agricultural area and sells them at the local market. Currently, he has requested another loan for 15,000 Lempiras, which he plans to invest in buying fertilizers and foliar products and paying for labor to provide better management for his crops. With the financial support obtained in this way, he hopes to increase his production and grow as a producer of rice and beans, so he can help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and foliar products and to pay for labor to support his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
O senhor  José é seguranca casado pai de 4 filhos dos quais 1 e maior de idade e independente e 3 ainda frequentam o ensino secundario vive na casa propria.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, barrotes, e pranchas janelas 1 carrada de areia, carrada de pedra, arames, e pagar a mao de obra para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos fazer aviario,  terminar a construcao de sua casa e ser motorista de carros pesados.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: José is a security guard. He is married and the father of four children, one of whom is of age and independent. His other three children are in high school. He lives in his own house. With this loan he will buy cement, rafters, window boards, a carload of gravel and stone, and wire, and pay for hired labor to continue with his construction project. His dreams and projects include building an aviary, finishing with the construction work on his house, and becoming a heavy truck driver. He says that the principal challenges he faces are financial, and that he will continue seeking more loans in order to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, rafters, window boards, a carload of gravel and stone, and wire.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
A senhora  Marta de 47 anos é comerciante, e solteira mae de 8 filhos dos quais 6 sao maiores de idade e independentes e 2 ainda frequentam o ensino primario vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, barrotes, e pranchas para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar a construcao de sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Marta, age 47, is a saleswoman and mother of eight children, six of whom are of age and independent, and two of whom are in elementary school. She lives in her own house. She will use this loan to buy cement, rafters, and boards to continue with her construction project. Her projects and dreams include growing her business to meet all the needs of her customers and finishing with the work on her house. She says that her main challenges are financial, so she participates in a rotating saving association (known as a xitique) as a way of saving money. She will also seek future loans in order to pursue her plan.

loans.use: to buy cement, rafters, and boards.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, obtuvo una cosecha abundante de granos básicos, dado que el financiamiento anterior le permitió comprar insumos agrícolas para preparar el terreno y proteger los cultivos, puede cubrir sus gastos personales, apoya a mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia y la situación económica está mejorando.
Por la necesidad de invertir en su negocio, requiere un nuevo préstamo para compra abono, herbicida, insecticidas y semilla para continuar cultivando granos básicos, de esta manera alimentara mejor a su familia y abastecerá a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victor has obtained an abundant yield of basic staple foods, since the previous loan permitted him to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land and protect his crops. He can cover his personal expenses, support the improvement of his family's life style, and his economic situation is improving.
Because he needs to invest in his business, he is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and seed in order to continue growing basic staple foods. In this manner, he will feed his family better and supply his clients.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seeds to continue to grow basic staple foods

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.ru: Зинаида досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Зинаиды есть 3 дойные коровы и телята. Коровы породистые и дают много экологически чистого, вкусного молока, в день около 50 литров, которое Зинаида реализует постоянным покупателям. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья породистых коров.
texts.en: Zinaida paid off her last loan ahead of time after using it as intended.  She's very grateful to Kiva and everyone who contributed to her loan.  Zinaida currently has three dairy cows and some calves on her farm.  Her cows are purebred and produce a lot of tasty organic milk, typically around 50 liters per day, which Zinaida sells to a number of regular buyers.  This time around, she's seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy hay for her cows as well as some new dairy cows, and plans on using any profits due to the loan to add even more purebred cows to her farm.

loans.use: buy hay for her cows as well as additional dairy cows to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
A senhora  Carolina de 53 anos é empregada domestica mae solteira de 6 filhos dos quais 4 sao maiores de idade e independentes e 2 ainda frequentam o ensino primario sustenta 3 netos  que vivem com ela, vive na casa propria.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, barrotes, e pranchas janelas 1 carrada de areia, carrada de pedra, arames, e pregos para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos construir mais dependencias e terminar a construcao de sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano
texts.en: Carolina, age 53, is a domestic worker, and single mother. She has six children, four of whom are independent adults, and two of whom are in elementary school. She also provides for three grandchildren who live with her in her own house. With this loan, she will buy cement, rafters, window frames, a carload of gravel and stone, wire, and nails to continue with her construction project. Her projects and dreams include building more outhouses and finishing the work on her house. She says that her main challenges  are financial and so she participates in a communal savings association (known as a xitique) as a way of saving money. She will also continue seeking loans in order to realize her goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, rafters, window frames, a carload of gravel and stone, wire, and nails.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz de 52 años de edad se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 22 años, su negocio está ubicado en su casa en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, Luz vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz is 52 years old and has sold shoes for 22 years. Her business is located in her house in a very busy area; this is why she has many clients. Luz lives in her own house with her two daughters. With her sales, she can cover the expenses she incurs. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes in bulk in order to have greater earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk

loans.name: Minandra

texts.en:
This is Minandra, a 34-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alvon, a driver and a father to her children. She, together with her children, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Minandra operates a food stall. She sells snacks like banana cue. Banana cue is a popular snack food in the Philippines, comprising deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. It is usually skewered on a bamboo stick and is sold on the streets. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil, and gas.

Minandra hopes that she will have a stable source of income other than what she has now. She dreams of a longer life and good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories from her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, and oil needed in her food stall business

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, está satisfecha por los resultados positivos que ha tenido al invertir el capital anterior en su negocio, al momento de comercializar los cerdos obtuvo mejores ingresos y la productividad de granos básicos ha sido muy abundante, con la nueva situación económica puede subsistir junto a su familia y mantuvo la responsabilidad del pago de sus deudas.
En este momento opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, así podrá tener de inmediato los materiales necesarios para desempeñar sus actividades agrícolas y mantenerse trabajando.
texts.en:
Teresa is pleased with the positive results she has had from investing in her business with the previous loan. When she sold her pigs, she obtained higher earnings and the productivity of her staple grains has been very abundant. With this new financial situation, she can support her family and she remained responsible for paying back her debt.

At this time, Teresa is opting for a new loan to buy agricultural supplies. That way, she will have the materials needed to carry out her agricultural activities right away and be able to keep working.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies so she can have the materials needed to carry out her agricultural activities right away and be able to keep working.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, wine, and juices.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
A senhora  Marta de 48 anos de idade é empacotadora numa empresa agricola, casada mae de 6 filhos dos quais 4 ja maiores e 2 ainda frequentam o nivel primario, vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varroes, areia, pedra, arames, pregos, janelas, barrotes para dar continuidade a ua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar a sua obra e construir dependecias para arendar refocando asssim a renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Marta, age 48, is a packer at an agricultural company. She is married and the mother of six children, four of whom are adults and two of whom are in elementary school. She lives in her own house. This loan will be used to buy cement, beams, gravel, stone, wire, nails, windows, and rafters to continue with her construction project. Her projects and dreams include building more rooms to rent out and improve her family's income. She says that her main challenges are financial and so she participates in a communal saving association (known as a xitique) as a way to save money. She will seek more loans in order to pursue her plan.

loans.use: to buy cement, beams, gravel, stone, wire, nails, windows, and rafters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and piñatas in bulk

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.pt:
O senhor Hermenegildo e pensionista tem 58 anos de idade, casado pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ja sao maiores de idade 1 ainda menor  vive na casa propria.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a construcao de  sua casa.
Projectos para o futuro terminar a sua obra, mobilar e investir na criacao de aves para reveder como forma de reforcar a renda familiar.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos como forma de concretizar seus planos.
texts.en: Hermenegildo is a 58-year-old pensioner. He is married and the father of four children, three of whom are adults and one of whom is a minor and lives with him in his own house.  He says that with this loan he will buy gravel, stone, and sheet metal to continue with construction on his house. His projects for the future include finishing with the work on his house and investing in poultry raising as a means of enhancing his family's income. He is committed to making payments on time and will seek future loans in order to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy gravel, stone, and sheet metal.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 46 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, Carlos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos is 46 years old and has been a farmer for several years. He grows corn and vegetables and sells his products in different markets that are located close to his house. He lives with his wife and his four children in his own house. Carlos is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph to be able to continue his occupation and to gain a greater income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 57-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Erlinda has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming vegetables for 39 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
A senhora  Angelina de 57 anos de idade é comerciante, viuva mae de 10 filhos dos quais 7 ja maiores de idade 3 ainda a frequentar o ensino secundario e sustenta 5 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar feijao, frango em pedacos, moelas, coco, acucar para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar a construcao de sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Angelina, age 57, is a saleswoman. She is a widow and mother of ten children, seven of whom are adults, and three of whom are in high school. She also provides for five grandchildren who live with her in her house. This loan will be used to buy beans, chicken pieces and gizzards, coconut, and sugar to strengthen her business. Her projects and dreams include growing her business to meet the needs of all her customers and finishing with the construction of her house. She said that her main challenges are financial and so she participates in a communal saving association (known as a xitique) as a way of saving money. She will also seek future loans in order to pursue her plans.

loans.use: to buy beans, chicken pieces and gizzards, coconut, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new body for her husband's moto-rickshaw

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
To earn additional income, Ana and her husband engage in making and selling soft brooms within their community. They are both farmers and blessed with eleven children. 

Due to the hardships of living, they help each other in gaining income to sustain the necessities of their family. They aim to continue to strengthen their broom making business, but they have limited capital. 

For this reason, Ana is requesting additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy the tiger grass, rattan and plastics needed to make soft brooms. With this financial assistance, they are hoping that they will be able to make more soft brooms to sell.

loans.use: to buy the tiger grass, rattan and plastics needed in soft broom making.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 35 years of age, lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan where her husband owns a shoe shop selling a variety of men's footwear that he buys from various shoe manufacturers.

He now he wants to offer baby's shoes as well because of customer requests. Therefore, Sofia has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for this purpose. Sofia is very happy about this loan and thanks BRAC Pakistan for the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy baby shoes for her husband's shoe store.

loans.name: Atanacia

texts.en:
Atanacia is 61 years old and married with three children. Atanacia works very hard to provide for them.

Atanacia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Atanacia has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Atanacia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Naear Farzana

texts.en:
Naear Farzana is a 31-year-old married mother of three children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband works in a firm for a low wage. 

Naear Farzana owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from her home. She purchases clothes from the market at a low price, sews them, and sells them for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for her clothes has increased because the winter weather has started and people are demanding warmer clothes. 

Her husband is able to cover all of the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She has requested a loan so that she can buy a bigger variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Naear Farzana wishes for a bright future for her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ready made garments for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 48-year-old married woman who has seven children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. 

He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his shop in a central bazaar, and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows his customer's needs and he has reliable providers. 

Yasmeen's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day, consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his daily stock so that he can sell the maximum amount of fruits until the evening and get the maximum reward for his efforts. 

Yasmeen applied for a loan so that her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 50 years old and lives in the Shahrituz district. He plans to start a new business in the field of animal husbandry. His initial capital is $120, and he has already bought livestock feed and has a barn for cattle in his yard. He is requesting this loan to buy cattle so he can actually start the business. Hasan is married and his wife works as a seamstress, sewing pillows, mattresses and blankets. Hasan is a master at home repair and provides services in this field with his son. This work is seasonal, however, which is why he wants to start a stable business of buying and selling cattle. Through this business he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock for starting a new business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 27 years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. Dina has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Dina is committed to rebuilding her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr: Reine vit avec son enfant de 17ans scolarisé à Lomé plus précisément dans le quartier de HEDZRANAWOE. Elle est revendeuse de sacs dame, chaussures et autres produits à domicile. Ses approvisionnements se font au Grand Marché de Lomé et le troisième crédit l'aidera à acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. A l’avenir, elle espère créer une boutique  et assurer l'éducation de son enfant. Reine âgée de 40ans a une ancienneté de 14ans dans l'activité.
texts.en:
Reine lives with her seventeen-year-old child, a student, in the Hedzranawoe neighborhood of Lome.

She retails purses, shoes, and other products from home. She procures her products from the great market in Lome. This third loan will help her purchase more merchandise to meet the demand.

In the future, she hopes to open a store and to guarantee an education to her child. Aged forty, Reine has been in her business for fourteen years.

loans.use: to buy evening bags for ladies and other products.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 47 years old, married and the mother of five children who lives in Concepcion, Iloilo. For more than 15 years, she and her husband have worked in fishing. Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, a crab cage and other items. With this gear, she and her husband will be able to  improve their catch and have more fish to sell in the market. In the future, she hopes to make her fishing venture a bigger success and save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 30 years old and married with three children who are in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for them. Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, shampoo, etc. Maricel has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: María Eva

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad de oficios domesticos. Ella no tubo la oportunidad de ir a la ecuela ya que en aquel tiempo sus padres solo le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo, que es a lo que ellos se dedicaban, pues para ellos era dificil poder encontrar otra forma de como llevar dinero a casa para comprar los alimentos, en la actualidad esta acompañada tiene 7 hijos de las edades de 20, 16, 15, 13, 5, 1, 5 años de edad. Su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maiz y frijjol, de los hijos solo 2 estan estudiando.

Ella tiene un molino en su casa desde hace 5 años, antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios de la casa, decidio poner el molino ya que consideraba que no podia estar solo en la casa esperando cuando el esposo ganara en las quincenas para ella poder tener dinero para los alimentos de la casa.

El préstamo que estas solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar unos repuestos que le hacen falta al molino, ya que cada cierto tiempo hay que hacerles un mantenimiento al motor para poder brindar servicio a mas de 15 familias y facilitarles el trabajo a ellos y adquirir un par de dolaritos para ella. Su deseo es que su negocio sea bueno para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 36 year old housewife. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school as back then her family was very poor. Her parents only taught her how to work in the field, as they were farmers. It was difficult for them to find another way of earning money to support their family to buy food. Today Maria is married and has 7 children, ages 20, 16, 15, 13, 5, 1, and 5. Her husband is a farmer who grows corn and beans, and 2 of their children are in school.

Maria has had a grinding mill at her home for 5 years. She decided to open a mill as she didn't want to do only housework and be alone in the house all day while her husband worked to earn money to support the family.

The loan she seeks from CREDICAMPO is to buy parts that she needs for her grinding mill, as every now and then she has to provide maintenance on the mill. She services 15 families, grinding their grain for a few dollars.

Her wish is that her business is good in order to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy parts that she needs for her grinding mill.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 40, the mother of four children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He earns enough money here to support his family, and has done well because his manner and tone win the trust of others and help attract customers. Sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with demand. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Shazia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to improve her husband's general store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 42 years old and the mother of one child. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc. Editha has been in this line of work for three years, and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz is 43 and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She works hard to feed her family, which consists of three sons and a daughter. To meet her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business and gets help from her daughter. Mother and daughter have been making clothes for many years, and her daughter now has a lot of experience. Gulnaz wants to buy a new sewing machine for her daughter, so that she can increase her income by sewing clothes. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy the machine and also earn enough additional money to set aside some for her daughter's marriage. Gulnaz thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her daughter.

loans.name: Stefanny

texts.es: Stefanny de 27 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 8 años. Ella el 1 de Marzo del año 2006, debido a que sentia tristeza por una separación amorosa, se fue a otro país a vivir. Allí se hospedó en casa de una mujer comerciante de productos de belleza, como tinturas, aceites, y en general productos capilares cosméticos y esmaltes, quien se dedicó a capacitarla en esta tarea y de allí su inclinación y conocimiento de este mercado, que inicialmente exploró desde el país donde vivia y cuando fue creciendo su negcoio decidió hacerlo desde su pueblo natal en Colombia; hoy vende directamente en el municipio de soledad, de contado y a crédito, a clientes que son los propietarios de peluquerías y para ello trabaja diariamente, desde las 8: 30 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza en el vecino país de Colombia y su interés principal es aumentar sus ventas, para finalizar con éxito su carrera de contaduria Pública, que actualmente cursa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de belleza como colonias en un mayor volumen, pues tiene requerimeintos de sus clientes y a ellos necesita responder. Con esta inversión, su negocio mejorará y sus ventas se incrementarán, haciendo que su credikiva impacte positivamente su negocio.
texts.en:
Stefanny is 27 years old and she has been selling beauty products for 8 years. On March 1 in 2006, due to the sadness she was feeling for a love lost, she moved to a different country to live. There she lives in a house with a woman who had a business selling beauty products such as makeup, lotion, nail polish, etc. She decided to learn about this business and gained knowledge about the business and beauty product market. She initially began to the business from where she was living and when her business was growing she decided to return and launch the business again in her native Colombia.

Today she sells direct in Soledad municipality, both in cash and on credit, to clients that have small convenience stores. She works every day, from 8:30 in the morning until 8:00 PM at night. She makes her purchases in Colombia's neighboring country and her primary goal is to increase her sales and finish her studies in public accounting (in which she is currently enrolled).

Today she seeks a loan through Kiva and it is her first loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With the funds she will buy beauty products such as cologne at a large volume, as she has customer orders that she needs to fill. With this loan her business will improve and her sales increase, resulting that the loan positively impact her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as cologne at a large volume.

loans.name: Maranatha De Samarie 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Rosena est le coordinatrice de son groupe Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4. Elle est marié, elle a 2 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée. Elle dirige son commerce d' articles divers pendants les 14 dernières années. Rosena espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4 ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que: ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses, chaussures, vetement, etc. Elle déclare que son défi principal est de venir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. Elle dit son but principal c'est d'avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Rosena is the coordinator of her group Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4. She is married and has two children. She lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and access to potable water fairly limited.

Rosena has retailed various products for fourteen years. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her business. Other members of Maranatha de Samarie 1, 2 & 4 need loans for such retail businesses as food sales, soft-drinks, shoes, clothing, etc.

Rosena say that her main challenge is to become a major retailer in the North. She adds that her principal goal is to own a large retail business, which will make it easier for her to build a larger house with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 42 años de edad, por la situacion económica que atravesaba su familia apenas alcanzo sus estudio hasta el 2º grado de educación básica.

Esta acompañado, tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 15 años, su esposa es un apoyo para {el y una mujer dedicada a los quehaceres de su hogar.

 Francisco desde muy pequeño se dedico a la pesca, dejo sus estudios y comenzó a trabajar diariamente para los gastos que se presentaban en su hogar y es así que día a día ha venido luchando por sacar adelante a su familia.

Ahora Francisco tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar una motocicleta, medio de transporte que necesita para trasladarse a su lugar de trabajo.

A futuro desea ver a sus hijos convertidos en unas personas profesionales, ademas sueña ver su casa remodelada y acogible para sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 42 years old and due to his family's poverty he only completed a second grade education. He is married, has 2 children ages 20 and 15; his spouse is a housewife, supporting him by maintaining the household.

From a young age Francisco fished. He left his studies and began to work daily to help support his family and it continues today, where day after day he works to help his family get ahead. Now Francisco has made the decision to see a loan to buy a motorbike, which he needs to get himself to and from work.

In the future he wishes to see his children stay in school and have professional careers. He also dreams of remodeling his home to make it comfortable for his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike, which he needs to get himself to and from work.

loans.name: Le Modele De Dorneu 1, 2, 3  & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Kercita est la coordonatrice de son groupe Le Modele de Dorneu 1, 2, 3 & 5. Elle est marie et elle a 5 enfants. Kercita habite dans la région de nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. 

Kercita a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 10 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle a vendu l'artisanat. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du Vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Kercita espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres Le Modele de Dorneu 1, 2, 3 & 5 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, la nourritures, cosmetique et chaussures. Kercita dit que ses défis principal est de un grand commercant.
texts.en:
Kercita is the coordinator of her group Le Modele de Dorneu 1, 2, 3 & 5. She is married and has five children. Kercita lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and access to potable water fairly limited.

Kercita has retailed various products for ten years. Before she started this business, she sold craft products. She would like to use this loan to invest by buying clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc. Kercita hopes that this loan will help her grow her business.

Other members of Le Modele de Dorneu 1, 2, 3 & 5 need loans for such retail businesses as charcoal sales, food, cosmetics, and shoes. Kercita says that her main challenge is to become a major retailer.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Esperanza has been in this business for four years now.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Rosemary, 54 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kigumo, a remote village in Thika. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Thika area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. 

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is the age of 49; she is mother of four children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. Earlier he was selling bakery items in large quantity but according to the customer’s demand he wants to offer rice, sugar, flour, etc. He does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in a daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. 

Therefore, Irshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son could buy the sacks of rice, sugar, and flour for general store. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her son will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her son's general store business

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora Margarita de 40  años de edad, vive con sus hijos y su mama  en casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 4  años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, vive en una aldea San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras.
Doña Dora Margarita es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de dos fardos de ropa como pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, brasieres, biquinis, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Octubre del  2014.
texts.en:
Dora Margarita, 40 years old, lives with her children and her mother in her own home. She has worked for the past 4 years in a business selling new and used clothing. She lives in the village of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Dora Margarita is an enterprising woman with desires to get ahead and she struggles day by day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan to purchase two packs of clothing such as pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, lycra, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, panties, etc.  With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is an existing customer with the desire to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business and grow her customer base and at the same time improve her future and that of her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October 2014.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, lycra, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, panties, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiger grass, plastics, and rattan needed in soft-broom making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large number of propane gas cylinders so that he can meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

She has been doing a tailoring business at home for many years with the help of her daughters. She wants to buy two additional sewing machines for her daughters, but she does not have enough cash in hand.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan for her tailoring business so that she can easily buy sewing machines for her daughters. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase sewing machines for her daughters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, iron, etc. to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de tortillas y tamales, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and for the past 6 years she made and sold tortillas and tamales.  Her business is in her home and she has a lot of customers.  Maria lives in her own home with her husband. 

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy bushels of corn and lime in order to continue making tortillas.  This is how she will be able to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bushels of corn and lime

loans.name: Ingrid Jasmin

texts.es: Ingrid de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 4  años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, chicharrón, frijoles, quesillo, harina de arroz, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their son.  For the past 4 years she has made and sold pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish). Her business is located in her home and she has many customers.  

She is seeking a loan to buy corn, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, rice flour, etc. in order to continue working.  This is how she will be able to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rattan, plastics and tiger grass

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Lucy. She lives in the Thika area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations. Lucy is a mother of four children and she has been in the agriculture business for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. 

Lucy has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Lucy remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Lucy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Lucy will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. 

An increase in income for Lucy is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize a better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Lucy’s economic activity and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
María, mantiene en el mercado la venta de ropa, calzado, juguetes y otros productos, esto es posible por la buena administración del préstamo que Kiva le facilito anteriormente para ir mejorando su situación económica, cuenta que hoy le da a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y pudo cancelar su deuda.
Como ya se aproxima la temporada de mejores ventas y ve que no cuenta con la mercadería suficiente para complacer las demandas de sus clientes; María se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar sandalias, zapatos, chancletas, ropa, etc., así mantendrá un buen inventario en su negocio.
texts.en:
María maintains a sale of clothing, shoes, toys and other products in the market. This is possible by her good management of the previous loan facilitated by Kiva to improve her economic situation. She says that today she provides her family with a better lifestyle and she could pay off her debt.

As it is approaching the season of the best sales and she sees that she doesn't have sufficient merchandise to satisfy her customers' demand, María decided to ask for another loan to purchase sandals, shoes, flip-flops, clothing, etc. and in this way she will maintain a good inventory in her business.
