loans.use: to purchase sandals, shoes, flip-flops, clothing, etc. and in this way maintain a good inventory in her business.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is 45 and she is the mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days recently his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Najma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Najma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, Flor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Flor, 30 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children. She has worked selling personal products for some years. Her business is located in her home and she also sells them as a street vendor in the different colonies. Flor is asking for a loan to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc., all in bulk and in this way to be able to continue with her work to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional high quality breeds of  poultry

loans.name: Sergio De Jesús

texts.es:
Sergio de 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, debido a las dificultades económicas de su familia y que tenía que recorrer grandes distancias para asistir a la escuela, solo estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, pues llegó a la conclusión de que tenía que trabajar para ganarse la vida y apoyar a sus padres. Con el solo vive su esposa y sus dos hijos y dependen totalmente de él.

Sergio es agricultor y jornalero, tiene 8 años trabajando en una ganadería, es el encargado de las vacas en ordeño y de cuidar los animales del corral. Tuvo otros trabajos relacionados con la agricultura y trabajo en otra ganadería, pero no ganaba lo suficiente.

El préstamo será utilizado para construir un pozo en el patio de su casa, Sergio ha mejorado su vida gracias a los préstamos, ahora tiene una mejor casa  y necesita el pozo porque dónde sacan el agua actualmente está muy lejos de la casa y su esposa tiene que esforzarse mucho para acarrear las cubetas con el agua.
texts.en:
Sergio is 31 years old, he is married, and he has 2 children that are 10 and 4 years old. Because of his family's economic difficulties and because he had to travel very far to attend school, he only completed the third grade. At a young age he came to the conclusion that he needed to work in order to earn a living and support his parents.  His wife and his two children live with him and depend on him for everything.

Sergio works on a farm and as a laborer.  He has worked for 8 years in raising livestock. He is responsible for milking cows and caring for the barnyard animals.  He has had other related jobs in agriculture but he didn't earn enough money in them.

This loan will be used to build a well in his backyard. Sergio has improved his life thanks to the other loans. Now he has a better house but needs a well where they can get water.  Currently the well is very far from the house and his wife struggles to carry the heavy water buckets.

loans.use: to build a well in the backyard of his house.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 54 years old, and from Lambakin, Jaen, Nueva Ecija. He is married and blessed with three children. He is a tricycle driver while his spouse is a housewife. Having no definite income is hard for the family, especially now that they have to send their daughter to college. That’s why Francisco wants an education loan to pay for the tuition fee of their daughter Bealyn. Bealyn is earning a Bachelor's degree in Secondary Education. She wants to finish college and find a stable job to help her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Marhta

texts.en:
Martha is a house wife who is 41 years old. She looks after her family including four children. Her husband is a sweeper by profession and provides sweeping services in various houses of his hometown. For this purpose he uses a mop, wiper and sweeping liquids. With the passage of time, his garbage trolley has become out of order, and this is the reason he wants to buy a new garbage trolley.

Therefore, Martha has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a garbage trolley, additional mop, wiper and sweeping liquids to continue his services.

Martha thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a garbage trolley, additional mop, wiper and sweeping liquids

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is the age of 45, living with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a sweets and baker shop in their hometown; he sells all kinds of cakes, rusks, milk, biscuits, juices and different kinds of sweets. Earlier his father was running this sweet shop, but due to his old age, her husband looks after all the matters. He purchases the inventories on large quantities from a nearby bakery and general store, and sells it at his sweet shop. 

Now he wants to offer more different types of sweets to his customers, but he does not have sufficient amount of money to buy these additional sweets. Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband enhance in his sweet shop business. 

This will help him to continue his business. Yasmeen is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different sweets

loans.name: Cristian Adalberto

texts.es:
Cristian de 28 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene una hija de 1 año de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato,  su pareja es ama de casa y cuida a su hija. Con él solo vive su pareja y su hija y dependen totalmente de él.

Cristian trabaja como chofer de una ruta de buses, tiene 2 años trabajando de esta manera, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado de 5:00 ama a 5:00 pm y los domingos descansa. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar unos muebles que necesita para su hogar, para que su familia tenga un mejor espacio donde relajarse. Cristian espera conservar su trabajo para que con su esfuerzo siga manteniendo a su familia
texts.en:
Cristian is 28 years old, he is married, and he has a 1-year-old daughter.  He finished high school and his wife is a stay-at-home mom that works hard raising their daughter. His wife and daughter live with him and they depend on him for everything.

Cristian works as a bus driver.  He has worked in this job for 2 years.  His work schedule is from Monday to Saturday, from 5:00 AM until 5:00 PM.  On Sundays he rests.  

This loan will be used to buy furniture that they need in their house so that the family can have more space to relax. Cristian hopes to continue working in his job so that he can continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 40-year-old lady; she is living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Saima's husband is a turner by profession and manufactures spare parts for vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts for various vehicles. His lathe machine has become out of order and some tools have worn out due to continuously working and they need replacement. He has spent all of his savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and does not have the money to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Saima has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the deficiencies of his lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix her husband's lathe machine

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 64 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, de 20 y 22 años de edad y ambos están estudiando en la universidad. Su pareja es ama de casa y está dispuesta siempre a aprovechar cualquier oportunidad para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa.

Oscar es albañil, ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a esta actividad y es así como ha sacado a sus hijos adelante hasta el momento, trabaja de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm. El préstamo será utilizado para cubrir gastos universitarios de sus hijos y algunos gastos del hogar.

Oscar sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para que puedan valerse por sí solos, pues así Oscar sabrá que cumplió como padre.
texts.en:
Oscar is 64 years old, he is married, and he has two children that are 20 and 22 years old.  Both of his kids are studying at the university.  His wife is a housewife and takes any opportunity that she can to help pay the household expenses.

He works as a builder and has worked in this field for many years. This is how he has helped his children get ahead.  He works from 6:00 AM until 1:00 PM.  

This loan will be used to cover his children's university expenses and some of his household expenses.

Oscar dreams that his children will complete their studies so that they will be able to support themselves, and this is how Oscar will know that he succeeded as a parent.

loans.use: to cover his children's university expenses.

loans.name: Andres Alcides

texts.es:
Andrés de 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga de cuidar a los hijos, también cría animales de granja como gallinas, cerdos y patos. Andrés solo pudo estudiar hasta 9° grado de educación básica, solo su esposa y sus hijos viven con él.

Andrés es agricultor, tiene una parcela en la que siembra maíz y frijol, pero su actividad fuerte es la de prestar servicios de transporte hasta la comunidad donde vive, ya que el transporte público no llega hasta allí. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una vaca y para cosechar el maíz y el frijol que tiene cultivados.

Andrés planea con la ayuda de la institución cambiar de vehículo para dar u  mejor servicio y seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés is 39 years old, married, and has two children ages 7 and 3 years old. His spouse is a housewife and in charge of the children and she also raises farm animals such as chickens, pigs, and ducks. Andres could only complete up to 9th grade in school. He lives with his wife and children.

Andres is a farmer; he has a parcel of land where he grows corn and beans, but his main work is providing transportation services from the community where he lives as public transportation doesn't arrive there.

The loan he seeks will be used to buy a cow and to harvest corn and beans that he has planted. Andres plans with the help of the institution to change the vehicle to provide better service and to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to harvest corn and beans that he has planted.

loans.name: Claribel Esperanza

texts.es:
Claribel de 30 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato, su pareja trabaja como peluquero y solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Claribel es comerciante, tiene un negocio en el que vende tortillas desde hace 5 años y aprendió por iniciativa propia, pues necesitaba una manera de ganarse la vida y ayudar a su pareja con los gastos de la familia. Claribel trabaja de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz, leña y cal hidratada todo en grandes cantidades, al comprar al mayoreo es más barato. Claribel espera mantener estable su negocio pues es su única fuente de ingreso y gracias a ello mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Claribel is 30 years old, married, and has two children ages 7 and 2. She was only able to complete a high school education. Her husband works as a barber and only he and the children live with her.

Claribel is a merchant who has had a business selling tortillas for 5 years. She learned this trade on her own as she needed a way to support herself and help her husband with the family expenses. Claribel works Monday through Saturday.

The loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, and lime in large quantities, as buying wholesale is less expensive. Claribel hopes to maintain a stable business as it is her only source of income and thanks to that business she supports her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Phulan

texts.en:
Phulan is a 55-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Phulan has been doing her business of cloth selling for the past twelve years and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Phulan needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her cloth selling business purpose. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Phulan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items for supplying general stores

loans.name: Josue Benjamin

texts.es: Josue tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad y sus dos hijastros de 8 años y 12 años de edad. Él es transportista de una fabrica de construcción cercana a su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y mantiene la economía de su familia. Josue desea terminar de construir un cuarto que hace un tiempo dio inicio pero por falta de recursos  económicos no ha podido terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc.
texts.en:
Josue is 30 years old and lives in his own house along with his life partner, his 5-year-old daughter, and his two stepchildren of 8 and 12 years. He is a driver for a factory near his town, and that is how he makes a living and takes care of his family. 

Josue wants to finish building a room that he started a long time ago, but which he has not been able to complete due to lack of economic resources. For this reason he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc. to finish building a room.

loans.name: Jorge Arturo

texts.es: Jorge de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace 5 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y tiene muchos clientes, Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de trasmallos y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner. For the past 5 years he has made a living in traditional small-scale fishing. He sells his products in the different markets that are found close to his house, and he has a lot of customers.

Jorge is requesting a loan to purchase driftnets and to do maintenance to his boat, shown in the photograph, since this is his only source of work.

loans.use: to buy driftnets and do maintenance to his boat.

loans.name: Las Sonadoras Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de trece, nueve y cinco años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de bolsas para frutas y verduras.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, luchadora, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en un mercado caracterizado por el comercio mayorista, donde el  desorden y la falta de higiene reinan; Hombres cargados con bolsas a cuestas, carretillas llenas de mercadería que van de un lado a otro, mujeres que preparan frituras en carritos en medio de los contenedores de basura, librecambistas y limpiabotas pendientes de los clientes, se confunden en el contaminado entorno.
Francisca  es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español por el comercio (sentada con blusa blanca). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y sus tres hijos, los dos mayores estudian en la escuela. Su deseo de superación la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; elaboración de colchones, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, tejido a máquina, servicio técnico de equipos y venta de muebles, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de bolsas para frutas y verduras; que ella misma elabora y las hace de malla diamante suave y flexible que se puede ajustar suavemente alrededor de los productos delicados y es lo suficientemente fuerte para contener y proteger distintas cargas.  Además, el diseño de malla abierta proporciona transpirabilidad y visibilidad superiores para los contenidos en la bolsa de frutas y verduras. 
Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en diez años que viene realizando este trabajo. Su sueño es distribuir por mayor sus bolsas a todos los mercados, y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina industrial.
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina industrial para elaborar bolsas en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Fancisca is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their three children, ages 13, nine, and five years. Francisca runs a business producing and selling bags for fruits and vegetables. Her partner provides transportation for the three children, the two oldest of whom are in school.

Francisca is independent, entrepreneurial, tenacious, trustworthy, and hardworking. She works in a market filled mostly with wholesale businesses with messy and dirty facilities. Men carry heavy bags full of goods, there are carts full of merchandise that go from one side of the market to the other, women who prepare fried foods at pushcarts amid trash containers, miscellaneous vendors, and shoe shiners waiting for customers, all making a confusing mix amid a dirty environment.   

Francisca is brown-skinned and of medium height, with long dark hair. Her native language is Quechua, but she uses Spanish for business (she is seated in the photo, wearing a white blouse). Her ambition to improve her situation led her to form a communal bank with other small business owners in order to apply for loans and help their businesses thrive. The other bank members run businesses such as mattress manufacturing, empanada sales, cosmetics sales, seasonal clothing sales, machine-knitted textiles, appliance repair, and furniture sales. Francisca's business is the manufacture and sale of bags for fruits and vegetables. She makes the bags herself from soft and flexible diamond mesh material which can hold delicate produce without bruising it but is also strong enough to carry and protect various loads. The open mesh design provides greater transparency and visibility of the produce in the bag.    

This is the first time Francisca has applied for a loan in the ten years she's been running her business. She hopes to sell her bags wholesale at many more markets, expanding her business through the purchase of an industrial machine with the proceeds of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial machine that will prepare greater quantities of bags.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad es vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de loroco, frijol ,maíz, chile entre otros, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her children and her husband. For the past 10 years she has made a living in agriculture, in the cultivation of loroco (an edible flower used for flavoring), beans, corn, chile peppers, among other crops. When her harvest is ready she sells it in the neighboring towns. She already has a lot of regular customers. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc., to improve the land shown in the photograph, to be able to continue with her farming. This is her only source of work and this will help her have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her son and husband. She has had a stand selling food near her home for several years. With the earnings she receives from her sales she is able to pay her household expenses. Ana wishes to expand her stand buy buying to tables and chairs as well as more ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to vary her menu and have a little more flexibility economically. She doesn't have enough income to make this kind of investment, so she approached INTEGRAL to seek a loan to be able to buy these items and thus obtain greater income in order to have an improved economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is grateful for the 20,000 PHP loan that was granted to her. She has used the loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Letecia dreams that her store will become a grocery store in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Al-Kefah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Kefah. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Horia is a 57-year-old married woman with five children, living with them in their own house in a poor area. She studied until the elementary education level, but she could not complete her studies because she got married when she was very young. She works in a tailoring business inside her house with little equipment and sewing materials. Horia couldn't achieve her business well because she doesn't have the enough equipment. She wants to purchase the basic sewing materials to do well. 

Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money for that. For this reason, Horia applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase another sewing machine beside in addition to the first one, and to purchase sewing materials as buttons, zippers, thread, etc to enlarge her business. 

Horia looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a large store for sewing.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and  sewing materials as buttons, zippers, thread, etc

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 27-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is running a fuel station in which he sells petrol, diesel, kerosene oil and lpg. His shop is situated on front roads, and a lot of vehicles pass his shop. 

Because of the rapid increase in the demand for fuel, her husband wants to increase the stock on a daily basis. He wants to ensure the secure future of his children by generating additional income.

This is the reason Kiran has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy the described inventories.

Kiran is very pleased with this cooperation; she is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy petrol, diesel, kerosene oil and lpg

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 56 years old and married. She was gifted with five children, and they live happily in a rural community. She helps her husband in gaining income by buying and reselling fruits and vegetables in the public market. She aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income to sustain the necessities of her family. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10,000 to buy more tomatoes, bananas, cabbages, beans, eggplants, potatoes, cucumber, onion and sweet peas to sell. 

Aida hopes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, bananas, cabbages, beans, eggplants, potatoes, cucumber, onion and sweet peas

loans.name: Haddah

texts.en:
Haddah is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 41 years old and has one child. She is married, and has one child who is still in school.

Amalia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Amalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a 42-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three children. Her husband provides white wash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of city, also. 

He has gotten a new contract for white wash and oil painting of newly constructed houses, but he has no paint brush or rollers for providing services.
Hussain has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.

His savings are very small; that is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing white wash services. She wants to change the condition of her family, and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paint rollers, kerosene oil, paint brushes and paint for white wash services.

loans.name: Mondester

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Mondester, who is 41 years old, and is very hardworking, honest and humble. She hails from Nyamira, Kenya - an area that is blessed with elite and world renowned runners, and also the best weather patterns that favor farming activities. 

Mondester is a proud mother of four children that she really loves and adores and will do anything in her power to always give them the best. She has been farming for the past 10 years, and through these years she has always provided them with all the basic needs that they require. 

Mondester practices mixed farming - that is crop and animal farming, and through these two she has been able to support her family, but she still faces challenges, which is why she wants to diversify and start poultry farming so that she can make ends meet. 

She is seeking a loan to buy poultry, and she believes that through the increased income she will be able to comfortably take care of her family and assure her grandchildren of a secure future. Mondester has experienced difficulties in acquiring funds to start her poultry business, but she now feels relieved knowing that Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and other lenders to support aspiring women like her to be economically empowered and be able to realize their dreams. 

Because of the many years that Mondester has had in farming, she has learned the culture of saving and being honest with money, and she hopes through the loan she will be able to save more and repay the loan on time. She believes that the loan will assist her to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Edgar Armando

texts.es:
Edgar de 32 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijas de 10 y 3 años de edad, su pareja reside en el extranjero con sus hijas y regresa al país una vez al año. Él vive solo.

Edgar es comerciante, trabaja con su madre en un comedor que ella inicio hace ocho años, él se regresó del extranjero hace 2 años para ayudar a su madre con el negocio. Vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas y trabaja todos los días desde las 6:00 am hasta que se va el último cliente en horario de la cena.

El préstamo será utilizado para reparar su automóvil, es el medio de transporte que utiliza para viajar a la ciudad y comprar los alimentos ingredientes y materiales que necesita su negocio para dar un buen servicio.

Edgar espera repara su vehículo para tener en funcionamiento su negocio y para cuando su familia venga para salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Edgar is 32 years old, married, and has two daughters of ages 10 and 3. His partner lives abroad with their daughters and returns to the country once a year. He lives alone.

Edgar is a merchant. He works with his mother in a small restaurant that she started eight years ago. He came back from abroad 2 years ago to help his mother with the business. He sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner and he works every day from 6:00 A.M. until the last dinner customer leaves.

The loan will be used to repair his automobile. It is the means of transportation that he uses to travel to the city and buy the food, ingredients, and materials that he needs in order to provide good service in his business.

Edgar hopes to repair his vehicle to have his business running and to go on trips when his family visits.

loans.use: to repair his automobile and buy the food, ingredients, and materials that he needs for his business.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a  mother of four children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Neema has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. Neema dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Silvia Noemy

texts.es:
Silvia de 40 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad y uno de 1 mes. Su pareja trabaja como albañil y con ella solo viven su pareja y sus hijos.

Silvia es empleada, trabaja en un laboratorio clínico desde hace 15 años. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una medicina que necesita su madre y para solventar unos gastos de la casa. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para dar a sus hijos el estudio completo y tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children of ages 17 years, 15 years, and 1 month. Her partner works as a construction worker and only her partner and her children live with her.

Silvia is employed. She has worked in a clinical laboratory for 15 years. She needs this loan to buy medicine that her mother needs and to resolve some household expenses. Her dream is to continue working to give her children a full education, so that they have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy medicine that her mother needs and to resolve some household expenses.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila, age 38, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children, and this is the reason for her working extremely hard - to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her three children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. She decided to start tailoring work at home, and since then, she has been sewing clothes for her community. Because she wants to enhance the beauty of her craft, she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives, and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

Jamila is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine.

loans.name: Jenny Lorena

texts.es: Jenny tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 años y dos años de edad. Jenny se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollo desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y mantiene la economía de su familia.  Jenny solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una fosa séptica para lo cual necesita materiales como cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc.
texts.en: Jenny is 28 years old, and she lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children, 5 and 2 years old. Jenny has worked selling chicken tamales for a long time, and this is how she supports her household and her family's finances. Jenny is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in the construction of a septic tank, for which she needs materials such as cement, sand, brick, iron, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron, etc. to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rukia operates a grocery stall from which she sells vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge with the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is 38 years old and married to Jonathan. God blessed them with three children, one of whom is in elementary school while the other two are already in college. She and her husband are helping each other by working so they can give their family a good future.

Ma. Victoria owns a computer shop. These computers are rented for PHP 20 per hour. Some families still don’t have their own computers so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad and others, especially the children and the youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8 am and close at 7 pm. Her regular customers are the children and youth of their community. She earns PHP 400 a day.

Just like any other business owners, she is also hoping that her shop will continue to expand and have more customers and branches. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es:
Santos, utilizó el préstamo anterior para cubrir todos los gastos de la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y frijol, ha mejorado la alimentación familiar, abasteció a sus clientes, tiene mejores ingresos y se mantiene trabajando.
Está planificando la siembra de la milpa de postrera y recurre a la institución para solicitar un nuevo financiamiento que será de ayuda para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra para los trabajos del campo, espera tener una cosecha abundante y sin plagas de maiz.
texts.en: Santos used the previous loan to cover all costs of collecting the corn and beans harvest.  His family nutrition has improved, he catered to his clients, has better earnings and he keeps working.  He is planning the second corn planting season, and draws upon this institution to request for new funding that will help to purchase agricultural inputs and pay manual labor for farm work.  He expects to have an abundant harvest free of pests.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and pay manual labor for farm work.  He expects to have an abundant harvest free of pests.

loans.name: Jennie Esperanza

texts.es: Jennie tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y sus dos hijos de 8 meses y 8 años de edad. Jennie trabaja como operaria en una empresa cercana a su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene la economía de su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora de un cuarto dormitorio. Desea reparar el techo, el piso y repellar las paredes del cuarto. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada, madera, y grava.
texts.en:
Jennie is 26 years old and lives in her own house with her family and her two sons, who are 8 months and 8 years old. For a long time, Jennie has been working as a machine operator for a company that is located near her home. She makes a living and maintains the finances of her family this way.

With the dream of improving her living conditions, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the improvement of a bedroom. She wishes to repair the roof and floor and to plaster the walls of the room. With the loan requested, she will buy cement, sand, corrugated sheets of metal, wood, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, corrugated sheets of metal, wood, and gravel to repair the roof, cement the floor, and plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es:
Gabina es una mujer de 63 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 19 y 23 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, responsable, constante y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el desorden y suciedad, donde los vendedores se acomodan hasta en la vereda para vender sus productos, el tránsito es un embotellamiento diario y los efectivos policiales son muy pocos para el tamaño del comercio existente allí.
Gabina es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello gris largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español para el comercio (al centro detrás, de pie, blusa blanca son flores lilas). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que trabaja en construcción y sus hijos que terminaron la escuela secundaria y se dedican a trabajar. Debido a su deseo de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de videos, venta de ropa, venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de productos cosméticos, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de frutas en un puesto fijo dentro del mercado, sus clientes son constantes y la fruta que vende es fresca y deliciosa. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta en un mercado nuevo en construcción en la zona, porque su mercado es viejo e improvisado y no cuenta con buena higiene. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando este trabajo. 
Es por esos motivos que Gabina solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas por mayor para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gabina is a woman of 63. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 23. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She is independent, entrepreneurial, responsible, persevering, and hard-working. She carries out her business in a market in the "Plan 3000" zone, a location characterized by disorder and dirtiness, where the vendors even settle themselves on the sidewalk to sell their products. Traffic is a daily bottleneck, and the level of policing is very low for the amount of commerce that exists there.

Gabina is of dark complexion, medium stature, and long braided gay hair. Her form of dress is traditions (shawl, skirt, and hat). Her maternal language is Quechua, and she speaks Spanish for business. In the photo, she is in the center in the back, standing, in a white blouse with lilac flowers). She lives with her husband, who works in construction, and her children, who finished secondary school and work. Because of her desire to get ahead, she formed a bank with people who have businesses such as a video store, selling clothing, selling sandwiches, handicrafts in plaster, selling soft drinks, a bookstore, and selling cosmetic products, so that they could apply for a loan and prosper in their businesses.  Her business is a stand for selling fruit at a fixed location inside the market. Her customers are regular, and the fruit that she sells is fresh and delicious.

Her dream is to have a sales stall in a new market under construction in the zone, because her market is old and makeshift and doesn't have good hygiene. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 15 years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Gabina is requesting a loan to purchase fruits wholesale in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale to increase her sales.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 30-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband has been running a tire shop for two years. He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Asia's husband wants to purchase different sizes of tires to resell, but due to financial constraints, he is not in the position to buy them. To fulfill his business needs, Asia has applied for a Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy tires to resell. This will also help him to increase his daily sales and earn a more profitable income to manage the business and his family's needs.

Asia is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy tires to resell.

loans.name: Holly

texts.en:
Holly is 32 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Holly has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Holly has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Holly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: El Almendro Group

texts.es:
La localidad del grupo El Almendro es una zona cañera; el lugar donde se reúnen los integrantes está rodeado de montañas y plantaciones de caña. En temporada de zafra, cuando se cortan los cañales, se logra apreciar el barrio de los integrantes; mas cuando las cañas son altas, las casas quedan escondidas. Los miembros del grupo enfrentan la vida día a día de distinta manera, buscando el bienestar de su familia. Cada uno de ellos decidió emprender una actividad la cual les reditúa ganancias para ayudar a los suyos.

El señor Noel está casado con la señora Guadalupe con quien ha procreado tres hijos, su principal motivación para emprender su propio negocio. Comenta que primero trabajó en una panadería de la localidad y que fue allí donde aprendió, a base de práctica, todo lo que sabe de la actividad. Sin embargo, al ver que su jefa obtenía muy buenas ganancias, decidió volverse independiente. Hace ya seis años que Noel estableció su propia panadería y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y de 6 empleados más quienes le ayudan a repartir el pan; número que aumenta con la época de frío, cuando los clientes buscan más el pan para acompañar alguna bebida caliente. Don Noel somete el pan a cocción en un horno que piedra el cual depende de la leña como combustible principal; material que suele buscar él mismo en los alrededores. 

Con las ganancias obtenidas, Noel ha tenindo la posibilidad de mejorar su negocio poco a poco, de remodelar su hogar y de cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Con el préstamo, Noel comprará los ingredientes que más utiliza en su actividad: harina, azúcar glas, manteca, azúcar, colorante, queso y un rodillo. Noel necesita abastecerse, pues la época de invierno comienza a acercarse y en tan sólo una semana la tradicional celebración mexicana del Día de Muertos, en la cual es muy común comprar pan tanto para consumo como para adornar los altares que se preparan para los difuntos. 

Los demás integrantes y sus actividades son:

Rosalba -Venta De Hambuerguesas Y Hotdog
Paula -Venta De Antojitos
Marco -Venta De Antojitos
Roberto - La Venta De Pollo
Guadalupe -Venta De Ropa, Tamales Y Chiles Rellenos
Maria - Venta De Cosmeticos Jafra
Isabel - Venta De Pollo
Jesus - Venta De Pollo
Maria -Venta De Antojitos Y Dulces

*En la imagen: Noel viste de playera blanca.
texts.en:
The town of the group El Almendro [The Almond Tree] is a sugar-cane zone. The location where the members meet is surrounded by mountains and sugar cane plantations. In the harvest season, when the cane is cut, the members’ neighborhood can be seen, but when the cane is high, the houses are hidden. 

The members of the group face life day-by-day in different ways, seeking the wellbeing of their families. Each one of them decided to learn an occupation that yields earnings to help them. 

Noel is married to Guadalupe, with whom he has had three children, who are his primary motivation to start his own business. He notes that first he worked in a bakery in the town, and that it was there that he learned, through practice, everything he knows about the occupation. However, when he saw that his boss was making a lot of earnings, he decided to become independent. 

It has now been six years since Noel established his own bakery and he counts on the help of his wife and 6 more employees who help him deliver the bread. The number of employees increases in the cold season, when customers want more bread to go with hot beverages. Noel cooks the bread in a stone oven that uses firewood as its principal fuel. Noel usually looks for this material himself in the surrounding areas.

With the earnings he has obtained, Noel has had the opportunity to improve his business little by little, to remodel his home, and to cover his children’s educational expenses. With the loan, Noel will buy the ingredients that he uses the most in his occupation: flour, icing sugar, butter, sugar, food coloring, cheese, and a rolling pin. Noel needs to stock up, since the winter season is starting to come closer. Also, in just a week it is the week of the traditional Mexican celebration of the Day of the Dead, in which it is very common to buy bread for consumption and to decorate the altars that are prepared for the deceased.

The rest of the members and their occupations are:
Rosalba – Sale of hamburgers and hot dogs
Paula – Sale of snacks
Marco – Sale of snacks
Roberto – Sale of chicken
Guadalupe – Sale of clothes, tamales, and stuffed chilies
Maria – Sale of Jafra cosmetics
Isabel – Sale of chicken
Jesus- - Sale of chicken
Maria – Sale of snacks and sweets
*In the image: Noel is wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy flour, icing sugar, butter, sugar, food coloring, cheese, and a rolling pin.

loans.name: Aracely Del Rocio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Aracely, tiene 50 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos mayores de edad, una hija aun viven con ella.
Doña Aracely con la finalidad de  salir adelante tiene un negocio de venta de camarón y mariscos, las mismas que vende por libras  o envía al por mayor  a otras partes, trabaja todos los días y no se le hace complicado pues el negocio lo tiene  en su casa, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, los  mariscos se los envían desde una camaronera en Pedernales o va a comprar a Manta cuando necesita de urgencia. Lleva más de 14 años con su negocio con el cual saco adelante a su familia después de la muerte de su esposo.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar camarón y otros mariscos. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito desde hace más de 11 años y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The credit group San Juan Eudes meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known on a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats.

This is where Aracely lives, and she is 50 years old. Some years ago her husband died and she was widowed but from this relationship she had four children. They are all adults now, and one daughter still lives with her. 

In order to earn a living, Aracely has a business selling shrimp and seafood, which she sells by the pound or sends wholesale to other places. She works everyday and it is not complicated because she has her business in her home. Her daughter helps her with the business. The seafood is sent from a shrimper in Pedernales, or she goes to Manta to purchase the seafood when she needs it quickly. She has had her business for over 14 years, and with it she has gotten her family ahead after the death of her husband. 

She is going to use the loan to buy shrimp and other seafood. She has been a member of the credit group for over 11 years and she likes it because of the help they provide with the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and other seafood.

loans.name: Genesis

texts.en:
Genesis is a 39-year-old widowed woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Genesis requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials to use in her business.

Genesis has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to use in her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Nelly would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 10,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Nelly aims to save enough for her old age through her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work. She also can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 34 years old, with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Janice has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, biscuits, candies and school supplies.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000. She wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale in her business.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He earns a living through farming. Aside from this, he also runs a small retail store managed by his wife. Despite hardship, he is determined to improve the status of his family and give them a better life. He aims to improve his farming business and his retail store, but he has limited capital. For this reason, he would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 20,000 from KIVA lenders to buy more grocery items, fruits, and vegetables to resell in the local community. He hopes that he will receive his loan request to enable him to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, fruits, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 54 years old and has three children. She is a married woman and has two children who are in school.

Loreta is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Loreta has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 44 years old and she works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, beers, etc., to sell. Jennifer has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, beers, etc., to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lolita has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Lolita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, aged thirty-seven, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He has three children aged 12, 8, and 6, and all attend school. 

He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, rice, and beans, and he earns additional income from farming. Emmanuel has always hoped to develop and expand his business though bad roads hinder his desired dream due to delays in service delivery. 

He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, who sells produce and drives to earn a living, is a hardworking Ugandan married man, aged 42 years, living in Kagadi-Uganda. 

Peter desires to grow his business but he is challenged by rains that make roads impassable. He intends to use the loan to buy maize and cassava for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and cassava for selling.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
This woman's name is Gulbahor. She is a friendly, hospitable rural woman from A.Jomi district. 

Her district A.Jomi has good weather conditions for doing farming and animal husbandry. Therefore Gulbahor, like many of her villagers, is engaged in the livestock business. For more than 20 years, she has been breeding cattle. 

Gulbahor continues the craft of her parents. She says that thanks to this craft, she provided the family all these years with income, as well as with milk and dairy products.

Gulbahor is a teacher by profession. She has a higher pedagogical education and  for 15 years she taught at a local school. Gulbahor now is 47 years old. She is married and has four sons. Her husband works in Russia as a migrant worker.

The purpose of the requested loan is to expand the livestock business. Gulbahor would like to purchase a few head of cattle and increase the profitability of her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a few head of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
This is Restituto. He previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures, and he successfully paid back his loan.

He would like to apply for another loan,  this time amounting to PHP 50,000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Restituto hopes that his business will become bigger and better. He also desires to give his children the best education possible. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who has children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Joyce dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 80,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Jane, a 44-year-old farmer from a remote village in the Kemera, Nyamira area. She resides with her husband with whom she has been blessed with five lovely children. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 25 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells tea, milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure. which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that would have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to her family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria tiene 55 años de edad y se dedica desde hace 18 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes, ella vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijas, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and for 18 years she has worked in the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her place of residence in a very busy area, and she has many customers.   She lives in her own home with her four daughters.  

Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn by the "quintal" [100lb] and lime powder in order to continue tortilla production, and as such be able to improve earnings to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the "quintal"[100lb], and lime powder.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 58-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in the motorcycle repair and maintenance business since 1973.

Her business is very hard for a woman to develop but she proved that she is capable of handling a lot more than she can reveal; she took the challenge and proved to be a hard working woman whom everyone can rely on.

Samira's husband taught her this business and provided her with the necessary skills requested to succeed, although he is not working in this domain any more and prefers fruits and vegetables trade.

Today, Samira is working hard on developing her business, through her acquired loan she will buy specially-requested motorcycles with affordable prices to sell in her shop for additional income.

She is very anxious about this loan and is looking forward for more developments in the future.

loans.use: to buy specially-requested motorcycles with affordable prices to sell in her shop

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 42, the mother of four children, and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetable at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. He has decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase inventory in her husband's vegetable shop.

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.en:
Mabelle is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school. Mabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Mabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc..

Mabelle has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Santa Rosalia Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas invierten sus esfuerzos en poder mejorar sus vidas, con la ayuda de las capacitaciones constantes que van recibiendo. 
Patricia tiene una librería, vende de todo y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene su local muy bien surtido. Lucha por su familia y sus seres queridos, ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, libros, pinceles y todo tipo de insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas. Ella está esforzando para poder crecer cada día mas.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this committee engage in different business activities. All of them have invested their efforts into improving their lives with the constant training they have been receiving.

Patricia has a bookstore where she sells everything. She says that she has a very good clientele because her shop is always well-stocked. Patricia strives on behalf of her family and her loved ones because she wants to give them everything she was not able to have.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy notebooks, pencils, books, paintbrushes, and other types of supplies so that she can continue her sales. Patricia is doing her best to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, books, paintbrushes, and other types of supplies to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Due to financial hardships, Magdalena and her husband work together to sustain the necessities of their family. Magdalena is now 44 years old and blessed with two children who attend school. They aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life.

With this regard, they aimed to expand their onion farm to ensure a high production. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in onion production. They believe that this financial assistance will enable them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in onion production

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge viene de una familia humilde, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está siguiendo sus estudios para poder ser un buen profesional.
Se esmera también para poder ayudar a su familia y a la sociedad por medio de su carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jorge comes from a humble family. He is studying for a degree in Accounting. With great effort and sacrifice, he is continuing his studies so that he can become a successful professional. Jorge is also striving to help his family and society with his degree.

He is requesting this loan in order to pay his fees. In this manner, Jorge will be able to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Marcos Elias

texts.es: Marcos de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposa, el trabaja vendiendo lácteos por ruteo, y con lo que gana logra solventar los gastos del hogar el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no le alcanza lo que gana en su trabajo por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios ladrillos, hierro, cemento, arena, laminas, polines, piso cerámico y pago de mano de obra, para el su familia puedan vivir mas comodos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 37 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and their three children. He works by selling milk on his delivery route. With the money he earns, Marcos is able to cover the household expenses.

He wants to improve his home by building a room in the space shown in the photograph. However, he does not earn enough from his work. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy needed materials such as bricks, iron, cement, sand, metal sheets, beams, ceramic flooring, and also to pay for labor. As a result, his family will be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is grateful for the loan  that was extended to her because she was able to purchase quantities of fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for 15,000 PHP to buy additional supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Loreta wants to have her own space at the business capital in her community. She is hoping to improve her family's living condition. She meets weekly  with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. She draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Asumpta

texts.en:
Asumpta lives in Hoima Uganda. She is a 4year-old married woman with five children who are 18,14, 12,12,10,and 5 years old; three of them attend school. 

She sells  maize and beans. She strives to expand her business and pay school fees for her children, which she considers to be a gift that all loving parents would give their children.

She believes that unpredictable weather  limits her profits. Asumpta will use the loan  to buy more maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has  run a tailoring shop in the local market for many years; he is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family.

Naseem's husband needs to buy pieces of material, laces, needles, a sewing machine, and it's accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not able to buy these items. Therefore Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

Naseem is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for this assistance.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of tailoring accessories and a machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Mujeres Campesinas Group

texts.es:
Francisca, Paula, Epifania, Gregoria, Maria, Ma Guadalupe, Cleotilde y Guadalupe son mujeres que viven en una comunidad mazahua y aún  conservan su lengua materna, sus tradiciones, sus fiestas, etc. Ellas se conocen desde que eran niñas y el lazo de amistad que las une es algo que también las distingue. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque la mayoría se dedica a trabajar en el campo, en sus terrenos cultivan maíz, frijoles, habas, calabazas, los cuales sirven como alimento durante todo el año para sus familias. Además, esta actividad les permite a todas ellas ayudar a sus esposos quienes trabajan como obreros. 

Francisca, Epifania, Gregoria, María, Ma Guadalupe y Cleotilde también crían borregos, pollos y pavos para tener un ingreso extra. Sin embargo, la inquietud y curiosidad de Guadalupe la han impulsado a iniciar una tercera acctividad: la venta de dulces. 

Paula, por otro lado, tiene una actividad distinta al resto de sus amigas: elaboración de artesanías bordadas. “Me encanta lo que mi mamá y mi abuela me enseñaron desde niña, para mí es algo muy preciado pero sobretodo porque así puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar”. Paula es casada y tiene tres hijos que ya no dependen de la pareja. 

Desde muy pequeña, Paula observaba a su mamá y su abuelita cuando bordaban sus servilletas, manteles y labradas (adorno de la típica falda mazahua que visten las mujeres de su comunidad). Paula debe comprar materia prima como hilos, agujas y tela cuadrille pues tiene que estar lista para los siguientes meses en los cuales sus ventas aumentan. A pesar de que sus hijos ya son independientes, Paula aún sueña con hacer algunas mejoras a su casa para que ella y su esposo puedan vivir mejor. 

*La foto fue tomada en el jardín municipal, el cual es el lugar más concurrido por los habitantes de este lugar*
texts.en:
Francisca, Paula, Epifania, Gregoria, Maria, Ma Guadalupe, Cleotilde y Guadalupe who live in a Mazahua community where they still maintain their native language, traditions, festivals, etc.  They've known each other since childhood, and the bond of friendship that unites them is also something that distinguishes them.  The name of this group was chosen because most of them work in the fields, in land where they cultivate corn, beans, and squash which are used to feed their families throughout the year.  Also, this activity allows each of them to help their husbands, who work as laborers.

Francisca, Epifania, Gregoria, María, Ma Guadalupe and Cleotilde also raise sheep, chicken and turkeys for extra income.  However, the restlessness and curiosity of Guadalupe have led her to start up a third business selling sweets.

Paula, on the other hand, has a business that is different from the rest.  She works making embroidered crafts. "I love that my Mom and my Grandmother taught me to do this as a child, for me it is something precious, most of all  because I can help my husband with the household expenses." Paula is married and has 3 children who no longer depend upon her and her husband.

Ever since she was very young, Paula used to watch her mother and grandmother when they were embroidering napkins, tablecloths and "labradas," (a Mazahua typical motif skirt worn by the women in their community).  Paula needs a loan to buy raw materials such as thread, needles, and gingham fabric because she needs to be ready for the upcoming months when her sales will increase.  Even though her children are already grown, Paula dreams of making some improvements to her home so that she and her husband can live better.

The photo above was taken in the municipal garden, which is the main gathering place for the people who live in this area.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her embroidery business

location.town: Dios Padre, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 42 years old and married with two children. Maribeth works very hard to provide for them.

Maribeth has run a general store for 8 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, beverages, and cigarettes.
