In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married mother and has children that attend school. She lives at her own house that does not have electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business to sell clothes door to door to her neighbors. She is challenged by the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She will use  40,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has been in the fish vending business for 3 years.

Loreta requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Loreta would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
Agnes  is a single woman in her early 30s with two children, one attends school and the other one is too young.  She has run a beauty salon for ten years and works from 7am to 9pm daily to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be one of many loans from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock, sell cosmetics, and buy four dryers. She has successfully repaid her loans.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a TV set, deck, Kinyamuzi, kitchen cupboard, a fridge, a plot of land, and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy salon products according to her customers' requirement.  She dreams of building her own house.

Agnes will share this loan with her loan group "WAUKAE" which consist of four members who hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

loans.use: to buy salon products to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 30 years old and married with three children, two attend school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann has run a general store for 9 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase cigarettes, canned goods, and beverages.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, canned goods, and beverages.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a married woman with eight children, she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income providing manicure/pedicure services, and food vending. Maricar requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Maricar has sustained her business with 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lady Mae

texts.en:
Lady Mae, 36, is a married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lady Mae has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Lady Mae has been in this business for 36 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abudalaziz

texts.en:
Abudalaziz lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a married retailer charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children, three attend school. He earns an additional income from farming. He has always wanted to develop his business to pay the school fees for his children.  He is challenged by fluctuating prices and inadequate capital. 

Abudalaziz will use the loan to buy more plastic items to sell.

loans.use: to buy  plastic items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins and more cattle so that he can grow his business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a fish vending business for 4 years.

She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell .

Remedios would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 58 years old and married with four children, one attends school, Pedrita works very hard to provide for them.

Pedrita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Pedrita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her rice retail business.

She requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to by additional sacks of rice to sell.

Pedrita is committed to rebuilding her business, and in the future,  would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 49 years old and married with two children.

Sylvia works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 6 years  and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Sylvia has borrowed and repaid 5 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from fishing.

Sylvia aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married mother with children, all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables for her family.

For over two years, she has operated an open air, home-based food selling business to her neighbors. She  is challenged by weather conditions. 

She will use 50,000 KES  to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman with  children all under her care. They own a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Veronicah wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area and increase her profits.

She will use 40,000 KES to purchase green vegetables, oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 54 years old and lives in Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single.
 
Manuel has raised hogs for 2 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP each month. He has requested a loan to purchase 3  piglets. Manuel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  

In the future, Manuel hopes to expand his hog raising business by building additional hog fences for his pigs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, age 42, is from Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is a single parent with 4 children.  PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start a pig raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs.

Helen is now trying to expand her pig business and start a little restaurant. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for 14,900 PHP.  

She thanks Paglaum MPC for financing her needs. She wants her business to be well known and well managed to support her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a fence.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana vive con su madre y sus tres hermanas en la ciudad de Itá, ella estuvo trabajando en una Empresa y por motivo a un mejor remuneración cambio de trabajo, además está trabajando en lo que es su ramo, es soltera, estudia la carrera de contabilidad, y dice que su mayor meta es poder ser una profesional exitosa que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diana lives with her mother and three sisters in the city of Itá. She is working for a company, but she wants to switch jobs in order to earn a better salary. In addition, she is working in her selected field.

Diana is single and is studying for a degree in Accounting. She says that her greatest goal is to become a successful professional so that she can help other people.

Diana is requesting this loan in order to pay her degree fees and continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old and married with five children, one attends school. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma has run a general store for 15 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy beverages, canned goods, and groceries.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 28 years old and lives in Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has three children. 

Kenneth has collected plastic, scrap metal and other junk items, and repaired sidecars for two years. He earns 3,000 PHP each month. He has requested a loan to purchase a second-hand motor sidecar to use. 

Kenneth has been a member of PMPC and hopes to engage in other types of businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a motor sidecar.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 6 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Sandra esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is 42 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and daughter. She has been producing clothes for six years. Her sewing workshop is located in her house. Sandra has many customers because of the quality of the clothes that she produces.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy thread, needles, various fabrics, buttons, elastics, and other supplies so that she can continue her work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, various fabrics, buttons, elastics, and other supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a general store for 5 years. Teresita earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase rice, canned goods, cereal, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, and juice to sell.

Teresita has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wishes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase  rice, canned goods, cereal, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks,  and juice.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar está siguiendo la carrera de criminalistica, para él es muy sacrificado  ya que su universidad está a una gran distancia, pero todo es por el sueño que tiene   de ser un buen profesional de aquí  a unos años.
Su meta es ser un buen profesional y a través de eso poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Edgar is continuing his studies toward a degree in Criminology. He has had to make many sacrifices since the university is a great distance away. However, he does everything he can to accomplish his dream of becoming a successful professional within a few years.

By becoming a successful professional, his goal is also to help his family. Edgar is requesting this loan so that he can pay his university fees. As a result, he can continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is 26 years old and lives in Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children. Edwin has been engaged in the flower delivery business for one year already. He earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month from doing this type of work. This amount is so helpful to meet their family needs. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing carpentry materials for ongoing house construction. Edwin became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, he hopes to expand his own flower shop business.

loans.use: purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and gravel in order to build a room.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a married man who runs a bar that sells soda and beer. He built rentals to generate more income. Bosco is charged with the responsibility of looking after four children. He started business in 2008 to be able to cater to his family. Bosco desires to see all his children educated.

He wants a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que le gustaría poder ejercer su profesión y ayudar a las personas.
Le gustaría poder tener su propia empresa en la que podrá trabajar y crecer como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Raul is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He is studying for a degree in Accounting. Raul says that he would like to pursue a profession and help other people. He also hopes to have his own business where he can work and grow just as before.

Raul appreciates the opportunity he has received since it will be of great help. He is requesting this loan in order to pay his university fees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a hardworking woman who sells clothes. She intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell during the peak season of Christmas when demand is high to generate more income. She desires to build a commercial house to earn more income, but inadequate capital hinders her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Yolanda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Yolanda has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Yolanda has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es estudiante, está siguiendo sus estudios en enfermería, quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas con su servicio, y es por eso que se está esmerando.
Su meta es poder recibirse de licenciada y algún día poder estudiar medicina especialmente ginecología.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene y culminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Carmen is a student who is continuing to pursue a degree in Nursing. She wants to help other people through her service, so she is trying hard to achieve this. Her goal is to receive her degree and someday study medicine with a specialty in gynecology.

Carmen is requesting this loan in order to pay her degree expenses. By covering this existing expense, she will be able to finish her education.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 61 years old, married and lives at Punta Miray, Baliangao, Philippines. She has four children and three of them are in school. Their only means of earning a living is through fishing. Despite the strong wind and the heavy rain, her husband would still go fishing to earn and survive. She sold the fish in public places or anywhere she could find a customer.

Because of the family's financial difficulties, Lolita decided to join Paglaum MPC to avail herself of financial assistance, but she was also happy knowing that she would also be able to save part of her income and obtain other benefits offered by the Cooperative. Now, she is requesting 6,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing nets to be able to catch more fish. Her greatest desire is to see her children finish their studies and live a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets to be able to catch more fish

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposo y un nieto, cónyugue es peón agrícola. Viven en el Caserío Huancas, distrito de Querocotillo, porvincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú. El caserío donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias personales y laborales.

La actividad que realiza Angelica es criar y vender animales desde hace 5 años, su negocio funciona en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en compra de un número mayor de cerdos y mejoramiento de los corrales donde estos son criados. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida del animal para poder venderlo aun mejor precio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angelica is 53 years old and lives with her husband and a grandson in their own home made of basic materials. Her spouse is a farm laborer. They reside in the village of Huancas in the District of Querocotillo in Cutervo Province, which in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The village where Angelica lives is a small rural area where she is known among the other residents. They have given her good personal and work-related references.

Angelica has been raising and selling animals for five years. She operates her business from an area behind her house. This loan will be invested in the purchase of a large number of pigs and improvements to the pens where she raises the animals. This investment will allow her to improve the quality of life of the animals, which means that she can sell them at a better price. In the short term, Angelica will be able to increase her earnings, improve her income, and eventually improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and make improvements to the animal pens.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old, married and has three school-age children. They live in rural community and make their living through farming. Due to the high cost of school fees, Agnes and her husband want to improve their vegetable-growing business to earn a higher income. 

Due to insufficient capital, Agnes wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed for vegetable farming. Through this loan, they believe that they will be able to improve their farming business as well as the living standard of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed for growing onions

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 32 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Vivian has a live-in partner with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Vivian has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. Vivian has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business, such as a fishing net, gasoline, fish container, etc. Vivian has been in this business for 19 years. 

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials  for her business, such as a fishing net, gasoline, fish container, etc.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 24 years old and married to Felister. They have no children yet but he supports his two siblings who are 12 and 9 years old. He has a hardware and a welding business in Nakuru town and he has been in this business for two years. 

He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow and start dairy farming so he is able to supply milk. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farming by buying another cow. 

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to grow his businesses and live a prosperous life with his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 49-year-old divorced mother of four children. She works hard to provide them with their living needs and the best education ever. Mona has worked as an administrative assistant in an engineering company since 2012. She is working hard since she got divorced to prove to her beloved children that she is capable of providing them with their living needs and requests. Her limited income is barely enough to cover their living expenses. 

Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school tuition needs. Mona is working hard to provide her children with the best education and will make sure to provide them with a better future.

She hopes to develop her career path to a better level to make sure that she can keep on supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school tuition needs

loans.name: Magaly Jazmin

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa Ana.
En este lugar vive la señora Magaly,  tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 12 y 2 años de edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Magaly es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante y ganar lo suyo para sentirse independiente, ella  se dedica a la venta de carteras y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Ella también parte del crédito se lo da a su marido el cual se dedica a la venta de cachorros el compra estos animalitos y luego los lleva a vender por la ciudad. 
Este crédito es para comprar carteras y cachorros. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, which is known for its beautiful landscapes and lovely waterfront resorts that are frequented by many tourists, the members of the Communal Bank “Santa Ana” meet every 15 days.

Sra. Magaly lives in this place. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 12, and 2). The two older children are in high school. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Magaly is a woman who has always enjoyed going out in order to earn her living because it makes her feel independent. She sells handbags by going door-to-door. Magaly will also give part of her loan to her husband, who sells puppies. He buys these animals and sells them throughout the city.

This loan will be used to buy handbags and puppies. She has participated in four loan cycles with her Communal Bank and she enjoys being a member because the loans are issued quickly. Her dreams include providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy handbags to sell in her business and to acquire puppies for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Candida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling fruit. Candida is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. 

Candida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman is 27 years old. He is living in the Baku region with his mother and sisters. When he was little, his father left them and he started to work to support his family. Mehman has been working six years in the market. Mehman sells food products. Today he wants to increase the retail business and for that, he needs a loan of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to buy foods products. He hopes that this loan will develop his business and his monthly income will increase.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es estudiante de criminalística del segundo año, trabaja en una bodega, pero  vive con sus padres y su hermana mayor.
Estudia porque le gusta la carrera que escogió y también para dedicarme a eso al recibirse, y también poder ayudar a sus padres.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Cesar is a second-year student who is pursuing a degree in Criminology. He also works at a store. Cesar lives with his parents and his older sister.

He is studying for this degree because he enjoys the field that he chose. Cesar also wants to devote himself to his studies until he earns his degree. In addition, he would like to help his parents.

Cesar is requesting this loan in order to pay his fees. This will enable him to continue his studies as before. He appreciates the opportunity he has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Her name is Monica, 28, and she is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Arlie, a construction worker, she has three children, two of whom are still in the elementary level and the youngest who is not in school yet. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school.

Monica operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 900 a day.

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that this will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source for meeting their daily expenses and sending her children to school. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Monica hopes to maintain and grow her business so they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for charcoal, grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Meet Caroline, a small-scale farmer in Nyamira, Kenya. She owns a small piece of land where she lives with her three children. For the last 10 years, she has been growing maize on the piece of land. She has managed to make a living selling the maize grains to millers after the harvest. She is also involved in other small personal businesses to make extra money. Recently, Caroline started keeping poultry for fun. She liked the fact that she could wake up in the morning and collect eggs for her family's breakfast. She started looking at poultry as a business when she had more hens and surplus eggs for breakfast. She started selling eggs to neighbors. More neighbors kept coming and wanting more and more every day. Caroline seeks a loan to purchase poultry. She can hardly meet today's demands. Her major challenge is raising funds. She was, however, referred to Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's field partner, by a well-wisher. With your loan, Caroline will grow her poultry business to the next level. The extra income will meet her high business-related costs. The loan will help her family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages and canned goods. She has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like beverages and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 48 years old and married with eight children. Five of her children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Zosima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and cigarettes. Zosima has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and cigarettes.

loans.name: Erasmus

texts.en:
Erasmus is 27 years old and a single mother of one child. She does farming in Nakuru town where she grows vegetables and beans to sell. She has been in this business for three years. 

She will be using this loan to buy seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and repay the loan.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her farming and be prosperous.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Marcy

texts.en:
Marcy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. 

Marcy has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and from her general store.

Marcy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hajati

texts.en: Hajati has a bar and lodge that brings income to her family. She started the business to meet her family's increasing needs. She desires to educate her children. She built rentals to generate more income. She needs a loan to buy drinks and a refrigerator to satisfy the demands of her customers who need cold drinks. Hajati usually complains of inadequate capital as her biggest challenge.

loans.use: to buy drinks and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Gillian

texts.en:
It's a normal thing to have a chicken farm in Kenya, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely. Gillian is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kebirigo village. She is the mother of three and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years.

To earn a decent living, she makes income selling milk, poultry, and greens and engaging in numerous small personal businesses to supplement the meager income she earns. 

Only recently, she started seeing how she could be making big money from poultry farming. Raising hens to Gillian is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs but figures the quantity she produces won't make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand.

Gillian is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. 

Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Lidice Moncerrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidice,  tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Lidice es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y con su esfuerzo ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, granos, legumbres, plátano y ciertas bebidas, allí ella también vende productos Avon. Yanbal, Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), estos productos los vende en su tienda y también sale a recorrer en sus ratos menos ocupados, le encanta su negocio ya que allí ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante, lleva más de 18  años con su tienda.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva 8 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en  su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes Communal Bank meets fortnightly in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and its craftsmanship, which is recognized at a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats.

This is where Lidice lives, she is 37 years old, married and has two children of 6 and 2 from the relationship. The eldest goes to school. Her husband is a teacher.

Lidice is a woman who likes to get ahead and with her effort helps her husband with the general household expenses. She has a small grocery shop in her house, there she sells all types of basic necessities, grains, vegetables, bananas and some drinks. She also sells Avon products, Yanbal, Belcorp (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories), these products are also sold in her shop and she also goes out to do sales during her quieter times. She loves her shop as she earns something which helps them get ahead, she has had this shop for more than 18 years.

This loan is to buy groceries to stock her shop. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she likes it because the loans help her with her business. Her dreams are to have a bigger shop and fully stocked.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Yojani

texts.es:
Yojani tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y crianza-venta de carneros. Vive en casa propia con hermano que estudia primaria en colegio nacional de Mocupe tradicional. Persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Comunidad conocida por ser habitada por gente proveniente de la serranía y dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Yojani se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y crianza-venta de carneros desde hace 04 años aproximadamente. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería para negocio (cafe, azúcar, arroz, etc) para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos, así poder cubrir todos los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yojani is 20 years old and single. She is known in the area for selling groceries, as well as for raising and selling sheep. Yojani lives in her own home along with her brother, who is a first-year student at a traditional national high school in Mocupe. She is a person who has good personal and work-related references. In addition, she comes from a close family. Yojani lives in a community that is located in the District of Lagunas in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Her community is known for the mountain people who reside there and engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding.

Yojani has been in both of her businesses (selling groceries and raising and selling sheep) for approximately four years. She needs a loan in order to invest in merchandise for her store (coffee, sugar, rice, and other goods) so that she can increase and diversify her stock of products. As a result, she will be able to cater to all of the tastes and preferences of her customers. In the short term, Yojani will be able to increase her earnings, improve her income, and eventually improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store so that she can increase and diversify her inventory of products.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 41 years old and married with two children.

Marigen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, coffee, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell.

Marigen has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Marigen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, coffee, eggs, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy educational supplies for her studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for special tests and to buy medicine.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
His name is Romeo, 46, and he is a resident of Coron Palawan, Philippines. He has two children who are currently in school.  He catches and sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Fishing is one of the common sources of income in Palawan since most of the folks are living near seashore lines. Among them is Romeo. First thing in the morning, he prepares his boat, fishing tools and accessories like nets, rod holders, bait prep and tanks, grippers, knives and more. After hours of bearing the scorching heat of the sun, he  goes back to the shore with other fishermen with their nets full of tons of fresh-caught fish. Coron island offers some of the freshest fish in the Philippines. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Romeo is now requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy a fish net and a new engine for his boat. His boat has to be efficient and safe so he can fish in a deeper part of the sea. He is thanking God and you in advance for the increased earnings and the financial help that will be given him. His income from fishing helps cover their everyday needs and for the schooling of his kids.

He aims to have more boats in the future to improve his fishing business. He prays for his safety and guidance to give his children a much better life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

 *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for his boat engine and fish net needed in his fishing business.

loans.name: Salehe

texts.en:
Salehe, who is in his early 50s, is married with three children. Two of them are in school and one is still young. He has had a transportation business for eight years now.  He works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salehe's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used the previous loans to service his bajaji (automated rickshaw) and managed to make many trips without any problems. He has paid back all of his loans successfully. He is doing fine with his loans. He used the profit to pay for school fees, bought two sewing machines and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to service his bajaji and repair another one. He dreams of owning a food shop.

Salehe will make sure he pays back his loan according to the scheduled loan period.

loans.use: to service his bajaji and to repair another one.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está cursando en el 4to año de la carrera de administración de Empresas; tiene una hija, por quien esta luchando para poder darle una vida sin privaciones.
Desea ser una profesional, y sabe que lo logrará poniendo todo su esfuerzo y dedicación  para que en el dia de mañana pueda crear su propia empresa y asi progresar poco a poco, para su bienestar familiar.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is in her fourth year of study toward a degree in Business Administration. She has a daughter, so she is striving to provide her a live without deprivation.

Maria wants to become a professional, so she knows that she must try her hardest and dedicate herself so that she can open her own business one day. In addition, she will be able to make gradual progress for the welfare of her family.

Maria is requesting this loan in order to pay her fees, which will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Liduvina se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como pavos, patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 10 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento de engorde balanceado para los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer mas su negocio y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Liduvina is 39 years old, married, she lives with her husband and children in their own home, in a big community in the urban zone of Cayaltí and enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors. Her community primarily works in agriculture, cattle-raising and trade. This community is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, norther coast of Peru.

Liduvina has worked raising and selling animals such as turkeys, ducks and guinea pigs with more than 10 years in this business, from her own home. 

She is requesting a loan to buy animals and balanced feed for them. In this way she will grow her business and thus be able to satisfy the needs of her customers. In the short term, this will allow her to improve her income, increase her earnings and thus improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Hello lenders! Meet Gladys, 37 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Kebirigo, a remote village in Nyamira. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. Gladys is happily married and blessed with four children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Nyamira area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. Gladys is a member of Up-rising self-help group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Sonia Leticia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 37 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 20, 14 y 10 años de edad,  estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela.
Doña Sonia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para  así salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad en la cual vende ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes y muchos otros productos, trabaja todos los días sola y con la ayuda de sus hijos que cuando ella tiene que salir se hacen cargo de su local, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días pero solo a sus clientes más conocidos, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al contado, tiene más de 20 años dedicada a sus ventas lo cual le sirve para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar más ropa, zapatos, carteras y perfumes. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the members of the Patito Donald [Donald Duck] communal bank meet fortnightly. This area is famous for the confectionary made by the townspeople, which is known throughout the whole country and for the quality of its friendly, hardworking residents.

This is the place where Sonia lives, 37 years old, divorced and with 3 children of 20, 14 and 10 years old, they are in university, high school and elementary school.

Dona Sonia is a woman who has always liked to work in order to get ahead. She works in business, she has a shop in the center of the city where she sells clothes, shoes, bags, perfumes and many other products. She works alone every day and with the help of her children when she has to go out they take charge of the shop. She leaves a credit and charges every fortnight but only for her most loyal customers. Most of her sales are cash, she has more than 20 years working in sales which have enabled her to get her children through.

This loan is to buy more clothing, shoes, bags and perfumes. She has been in the communal bank from the start and she likes it because the loans are fast and without so many conditions. Her dreams are to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bags and perfumes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has a retail shop in Nakuru town, which she has been running for one year. She is 32 years old, married and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with four children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, rice, sugar, milk and detergents to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 30 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children. She does farming in Nakuru town where she grows maize, beans and vegetables to sell. She has been in the farming business for the past 12 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children by paying for their school fees. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive loa señorita María, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres.
Doña María es una joven mujer que para obtener sus propios recursos pra salir adelante y ayudarles a sus padres que son de escasos recursos  se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisuterías. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the members of the Patito Donald [Donald Duck] communal bank meet fortnightly. This area is famous for the confectionary made by the townspeople, which is known throughout the whole country and for the quality of its friendly, hardworking residents.

This is where Maria lives, 33 years old, single and living at her parents' home.

Maria is a young woman who in order have her own resources to get ahead and help her parents who are poor, works selling Avon products and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances and accessories for ladies). She works three days a week from two to three hours a day. She leaves her products on credit and charges every week. She has been in this line of work for four years.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry. She has been in the communal bank for 5 years and she likes it because with the loans she started her own business. Her dreams are to have good health and push ahead.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 46-year-old divorced mother of three children. She has been working hard for five years to provide them with their living needs and requests, since she is putting so much effort to take the role of the hardworking father and the caring mother at the same time.

Sabah is a Palestinian refugee who has lived and worked in a Palestinian camp since she was born. She has fruitful future dreams for her children, which require so much effort to make them come true.

She sells women's underwear and sleeping clothes and needs more capital to diversify her products for different customers' needs. Sabah's business income is almost enough to cover her family's needs, but she is planning and working hard to expand it in a well-managed way to make sure she'll benefit from an increase in capital and income.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly-released special autumn and winter collections at affordable prices so that she can increase her business capital and income in a well-managed way.

Sabah is dreaming of developing her business in a well-managed way, hoping that one day she can move her business outside the camp to a more developed place.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly released special autumn and winter collections at affordable prices

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 13 years, she has operated a business selling clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation and competition. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza wants to add one more dairy cow to her existing herd of four cows plus one male calf. She also has been doing some repairs to their washroom and wants to finish it off.  Thus, adding one more cow and finish repairing her family’s washroom is what this loan that she is requesting from you will be used for. Roza hopes that she will be given some consideration in this matter. 

Roza is 56 years old and a married mother who lives in northern Albania. Agriculture/livestock is what she has been practicing for a long time now and she is pleased, according to her. In addition to her cows, she’s got chickens and ducks as well. Furthermore, she owns some agricultural land where she plants fodder and lucerne for her animals. Her only child, her son who is 26 now, works with the parents on their mini-farm. The only income they make is from the livestock.

loans.use: to add one more dairy cow to her mini-farm and with a very small amount of the loan finish off the washroom repair.

loans.name: Hector Octavio

texts.es:
Hector Octavio tiene 37 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Morropón. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Hector Octavio es la venta de fruta, la actividad la realiza desde hace más de 1 año en el exterior del mercado de Morropón. El destino del crédito será para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, para poder construir su habitación en su vivienda, ya que actualmente comparte cuarto con hermano de esta forma tener obtener su privacidad.

El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el Hector Octavio tiene ya clientela fija y los precios con los que trabaja son muy comerciales en la zona, además de comercializarse de manera diaria. Hector Octavio piensa trabajar otorgando buen producto a sus clientes e incrementando sus ventas y obtener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hector Octavio is 37 years old and single. He lives in a house that he owns in the Morropón district. Life here is very peaceful. The inhabitants work in farming and the raising of cattle and other animals. Hector's community is in the district and province of Morropón in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast.

Hector makes a living selling fruits. he has been doing this for over a year at the outdoor market in Morropón. This loan will be used to make improvements to Hector's home. He is going to build another room as he currently shares with his brother; this loan will give Hector more privacy.

There are good opportunities at the fruit market. Hector has regular customers and offers competitive prices. He sells his products every day. Hector sells good quality products so that he can increase his sales and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego tiene 50 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge y una hija de 7 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso, Diego y cónyuge son nacidos en caserío Miraflores; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío Miraflores Distrito de Santo Tomas; vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Diego es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor, plantación tiene cuatro años de edad ya que en la zona todos tienen plantación nuevas; café esta en tercer año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 3 has. donde realiza cultivo de café, actividad la realiza hace 10 años ya que anteriormente a cultiva café variedad nacional. Cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito.

Adicionalmente Diego se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno y también al cultivo y productos de pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío Miraflores distrito de Santo Tomas. El destino del crédito será solamente para mantenimiento de 1 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is 50 years old, he has a stable home at the side of his wife and daughter of 7 years old. He lives in his own one-story home of rustic material. Diego and his wife were born in the village of Miraflores; they live in harmony within the family and in fellowship with the village. They live in the rural part of the village of Miraflores Distrito de Santo Tomas; they live in a small community primarily dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising. Their home is connected to the water supply.

Diego works on a coffee plantation, he has 2 hectares to date. He grows the Catimor variety, the plantation is four years old as it is in a zone of new plantations; coffee is in its third year of production, he has 3ha of farmland where he has his coffee plantation, a line of work he has been in for 10 years as previously he grew the national variety of coffee. He has experience in the coffee growing business, he sells his product in the district. Additionally Diego works in with livestock breeding cattle and also grows basic crops, all of this takes place on his own land in the village of Miraflores, Santo Tomas district.

The purpose of the loan is simply for the maintenance of 1ha of coffee plantation, and with this he will assure bigger and better production for the 2015 season and thus he will get better income to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain 1ha of coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn, 26, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married and has two children who are both in elementary school. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Jonalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 2,000 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store, she is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery items. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her store is her source of income to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Jonalyn hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they can have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education and she prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell at her store

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en: Truphena, 30, is a housewife who practices small-scale dairy farming in Tinga village in the Nyanza province of Kenya. Truphena is active when it comes to commercial activities. She is a pragmatic problem solver. Her distinguishing factor is that she adds a business angle to every cultural way of life. While her community keeps cattle and poultry for food, she does the same on a greater scale in order to sell the surplus. Truphena is seeking a loan to purchase a brood of hens. She will use the same technique she used to grow her dairy farm to grow her poultry farm. The flock of hens will lay eggs, half of which will be sold and the rest kept for hatching and family consumption. From the clutch of chicks, chick breeding will be conducted where female chicks will be kept, for they are destined to lay eggs for commercial purposes, while male chicks will be culled because they are more relevant to meat production. With your investment, Truphena will be able to improve her family's livelihood by contributing to the income they generate. She will use the money from the poultry farm to grow the business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: M. Ehsan

texts.en:
M. Ehsan is 40 years old and a father of a daughter. He lives in Lahore. He has a small dairy farm, which is the main source of income for his family. He is hardworking. He has been raising cattle for many years now and sells milk to local households and other businesses like shops and restaurants. His wife helps him all the way. He has established himself well and has many cattle on his farm. 

Given the increase in the number of cattle, he needs to widen the space where he keeps them. He therefore needs additional financing to expand the area of his farm, taking into consideration hygiene and better nourishment of his cattle. 

He is thankful to BRAC Pakistan for its timely assistance. He wants to save money for his daughter's wedding in the future.

loans.use: To expand the area of his dairy farm.

loans.name: Bossa

texts.fr: Jeune entrepreneur de 30ans, Madame Bossa revend depuis 2010 des bazins de façon ambulante. A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, elle sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins des clients. Bossa désire faire évoluer son activité et assurer l'avenir de la famille(Elle est mariée).
texts.en:
A young 30-year-old entrepreneur, Bossa has been selling damask fabric door-to-door since 2010. 

Because of the approaching end of the year festivities, she is seeking a second loan so that she can buy merchandise that responds to her customers' needs.

Bossa wishes to expand her business and ensure her family's future. (She is married).

loans.use: to buy damask fabric

loans.name: Gonzalo Francisco

texts.es:
Gonzalo Francisco tiene 23 años de edad, vive en armonía familiar con padres y un hermano mayor que aporta ingresos a la UEF, vive en casa de material rustico de dos pisos, es nacido en caserío la Granadilla; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío la Granadilla del Distrito de Santo Tomas; vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Gonzalo Francisco es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad ya que en la zona todos tienen plantación nuevas; café de cliente esta en primer año de producción para campaña 2015 estará en segundo año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 2 has. donde realiza cultivo de café, actividad la realiza hace 3 años ya que anteriormente a cultiva café variedad nacional. cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente cliente se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno. El destino del crédito es para mantenimiento de 2 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Francisco is 23 years old. He lives in family harmony with his parents and an older brother who brings earnings to the UEF. He lives in a two-story house of rustic materials, was born in the Granadilla village, lives in unity with his family and fellowship with the villagers, he lives in the rural part of the Granadilla District of Santo Tomas, he lives in a small community primarily dedicated to agriculture and cattle-raising, their house is connected to the water supply.

Gonzalo Francisco works in coffee-growing, to date he has 2ha. of the Catimor variety, the plantation is three years old as it is in a zone of new plantations; coffee is in its first year of production, for the 2015 season it will be in its second year of production. He has his own 2ha of farmland, a line of work he has been in for 3 years as previously he grew the national variety of coffee. He has experience in the coffee growing business. Also he works in cattle breeding and raises beef cattle. 

The loan will be used to maintain 2ha of coffee plantation, and with this he will assure bigger and better production for the 2015 season and thus he will get better income to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain a 2ha coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell in animal markets.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Veuve de 44ans, avec 05 enfants en charge, Amah âgée de 44ans se bat chaque fois pour apporter le meilleur d'elle même à sa famille. Pour cela, elle revend des ignames et céréales au marché d'Atikpodji et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays. Elle se fait aidée par 01 personne et son premier crédit l'aidera à s'approvisionner en céréales, ignames et autres produits. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère devenir grossiste et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amah is a 44-year-old widow, who has five children under her care. She fights each day to bring the best of herself to her family.

To do this, she resells yams and cereals at the Atikpodji market. She procures her goods from the interior of the country.

One person helps her with this work. This first loan will help her procure cereals, yams, and other goods.

For the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cereals and yams

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enhanced her business. She was able to purchase additional biscuits and pastillas (a sweet and sugary dessert that is well known and loved by many people in the Philippines), which were needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her to pay for the educational expenses of her children and their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business with a loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will go to additional stocks of biscuits, pastillas, and other sweets. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. She also could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Nemesia aims to send her children to college. She is pretty sure that if she gives the best for her children's education, their lives will improve and become more successful. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of different biscuits needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 53 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with five children. Lucy is proud of being a farmer; she raised her children through this business. She requested a loan to purchase three sacks of fertilizers for a growing healthy corn. Lucy has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to have a jeepney for her service.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of  fertilizers

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendere is married with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has been in business for the past 10 years, operating an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy additional hogs and feed, which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go for additional supplies of feed and hogs, which will increase her profit. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

Fe wants to give her family a better life someday. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of feed and hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 40 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four children. Elsa is a hardworking farmer and she has done this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizers to make her rice healthy. Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to have a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is 63 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with five children. Sofia raise heads of pigs and the piglets are for sale. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy five sacks of feed and vitamins for more sales in order for her children to finish their studies. Sofia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes that her children can find a stable job.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of feeds and vitamins for her new born piglets

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro un tradicional campesino de 49 años de edad, con el empuje y la verraquera que caracteriza a estas personas trabajadoras y honradas.
Lázaro se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria, produciendo leche que lleva a sus vendedores, trabaja todos los días entre 10 y 12 horas  y ahora quiere solicitar un crédito el cual usara para comprar una vaca y así aumentar su producción y aunque esto le aumentara su jornada laboral lo hace todo pro su esposa y dos hijas quien son el motor de su vida y quiere que ellas salgan adelante y puedan tener buenas aspiraciones en la vida como ser universitarias y dedicarse al campo pero como profesionales.
texts.en:
Lazaro is 49 years old. He is a traditional farmer with the drive and tenacity that characterizes these hard-working, honest people.

Lazaro is a dairy farmer, producing milk which he takes to his sellers. He works for 10 to 12 hours every day. He wants to apply for a loan to buy a cow and increase his production. Although this will increase the length of his working day, he does it all for his wife and two daughters who are his reason for living. He wants his daughters to get ahead and to have great aspirations in life such as going to university and then working in farming, but as professionals.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase his milk production, as he needs capital to give his daughters the opportunity to study.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 35 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Annaliza has a shop that sells charcoal, and she has had this business for 8 years. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. 

In the future, Annaliza hopes to have a tricycle to transport their charcoal to the city.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks of charcoal

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 67 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with 7 children. 

Lolita has a sewing machine that she uses to make curtains to sell. She has had this business for 30 years. She has requested a loan to buy sewing materials and cloth for curtain making in order to have an income to support her children, who depend on her. 

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to have more clients to buy her curtains.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and cloth for curtain making

loans.name: Ferancia

texts.en:
Ferancia is 53 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Ferancia has been a farmer since she was 10 years old. She helped her parents with their farming activity. 

Recently she has requested a loan to buy 3 sacks of fertilizers for her corn production, which provides her family with food to eat. Ferancia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. 

In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make necessary improvements to her barns and stables as rainwater is leaking in and her animals are very affected by this.

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en:
Valeh is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Baku region. 

Valeh is a master in his profession. Now he wants to buy some new, different materials which are necessary in his work, so he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

In the future he wants to open his own place, and in his personal life he wants to get married. 

Valeh says he is very thankful to the Kiva organization for its help.

loans.use: to buy new materials

loans.name: Verro

texts.fr: VERRO est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants ; elle fait le commerce des friperies et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché d’hédzranawoé.VERRO habite au quartier Adakpamé dans une maison en location avec une latrine traditionnelle, disposant d’un poste radio mais pas de moyen de déplacement. VERRO désire un prêt pour stabiliser et appuyer son commerce afin de pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle et aussi plus épargner pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en: Verro is 36 years old, married and mother to five children; she sells used clothing and gets her supplies four times a month at the Hédzranawoé market. Verro lives in the Adakpamé district in a rented house with a traditional latrine; she has a radio but does not have any means of transportation. Verro would like a loan to stabilise and boost her business so she can satisfy customer demand and also save more money to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy four bed sheets, four towels and three sets of clothing.

loans.name: Ndèye Thiouthiou

texts.fr: NDEYE THIOUTIOU est une femme âgée de 58ans qui habite dans le quartier ou se situe le Guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle n’a pas de charge particulière car ceux sont ses enfants qui gèrent les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Elle a une expérience de 5ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des tissus, Thioub et des Wax. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h.
